content.short-description: The open air well bar at Bar SaVanh Too has been specially created to infuse an open and organic feel to the interior...
content.description: The open air well bar at Bar SaVanh Too has been specially created to infuse an open and organic feel to the interior. Besides being a club and bar, they offer traditionally prepared Vietnamese, Laotian and Cambodian cuisine, courtesy of their sister-restaurant Cochine. Popular venue for events, the stage and seating lends itself to live music and stand-up comedy.

content.short-description: This chic establishment serves Northern Indian cuisine with flavors that are both distinct and diverse...
content.description:
With its name literally meaning eat and drink, Khaana Peena gives no illusions as to where its priorities lie. This chic establishment serves Northern Indian cuisine with flavors that are both distinct and diverse. The décor is inspired by traditional Indian culture with influences of contemporary styles more than evident. The vibrant fabrics, tasteful paintings and unique coasters add a nice touch to the restaurant. Try the grilled fish with tomato relish for a nice twist from your customary Indian meal.

 

Halal

content.short-description: Growing from a humble stall in Penang, Kayu Nasi Kandar is currently a full-fledged establishment...
content.description:
Growing from a humble stall in Penang, Kayu Nasi Kandar is currently a full-fledged establishment with a number of branches around town. Their roti tissue, a humungous dough cone filled with sweet sugary sins, is especially popular. For those with grainier desires, opt for the white rice with chicken rending and fried squid. The spiciness of the chicken blends exquisitely with the crispy goodness of the fresh squids. Adding to the experience is a number of plasma television sets placed around the restaurant.

Pork Free

content.short-description: One of the best outlets to fulfill your banana leaf rice craving...
content.description:
One of the best outlets to fulfill your banana leaf rice craving. Service is slightly shady but the food makes it more than worth the wait. Their chili chicken is generously covered with a spicy dressing and certainly adds some flavor to your meal. Strangely enough, what Kavitha's does the best is the basic rice with vegetarian sides. Mostly taken for granted, Kavitha's fresh ingredients with a few scoops of curry is a satisfying meal without further pretensions.

Pork Free

content.short-description: The cuisine is an exotic combination of authentic scents and textures from Asia...
content.description:
With an area over 7,500 square feet capable of accommodating 200 patrons, ISHq certainly has space and luxury going for it. Furnishings are a blend of Asian and Western influences with comfortable sofas, wooden shutters and cool balconies providing a sense of luxury. A garden courtyard is available with rustic furniture is available for a more intimate dining experience. The cuisine is an exotic combination of authentic scents and textures from Asia. As such, the Indian cuisine isn't exactly extensive but do give the lamb Hydrabad korma or the salmon massala a try.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Authentic Indian fare at Pearl Hotels satisfying Indian restaurant...
content.description:
Authentic Indian fare and a warm welcome are the order of the day at Pearl Hotel's satisfying Indian restaurant.

Pork Free

content.short-description: What really sets this place apart is the authentic cuisine such as the rich and creamy chicken makhani...
content.description:
Tucked away neatly in a corner, Gills may not look like much at first glance. However, looks are extremely deceiving in this case as the food here has earned it some very admiring followers through the years. Ambience is simple with nothing to shout about. What really sets this place apart is the authentic cuisine such as the rich and creamy chicken makhani (butter chicken) and tongue-numbing fish curry. For those of less spicy cravings, opt for the palak paneer (blended spinach) which is tasteful while offering a welcome reprieve.

Pork Free

address.street: Persiaran Awana, Taman Cheras Permata ll
Persiaran Awana, Taman Cheras Permata ll

content.short-description: Cempaka Cheras Campus is part of Cempaka School, one of the many International school in Malaysia...
content.description:
Cempaka Cheras Campus is part of Sri Cempaka School, one of the many International school in Malaysia.

"The Cempakan is a Scholar". It is said that the moment a student is accepted into the Cempaka school, he/she is a scholar.

Introduced to a culture of academic rigour and discipline, the Cempaka standards are high and competition is keen.

Technologically adept, Cempaka is well equipped with wireless network facilities. Students can access both internet and intranet resources around campus.

content.short-description: Bombay Spice is best described as an affordable melting pot of authentic Northern and Southern Indian cuisine...
content.description:
A casual dining restaurant in the plush Gardens Mid Valley and Pavilion KL, Bombay Spice would be best described as an affordable melting pot of authentic Northern and Southern Indian cuisine. The walls adorned with sari fabric and the mosaic stained glass lamp exude a chic and contemporary ambience belying it's low-medium end status. Highly recommended are the Hydrabadi briyani and the flavorful prawn masala. After your invigorating meal, pick up some traditional condiments or delicately prepared chutneys which are available for purchase.

Halal

Other Branches:

Floor 1, Pavilion Kuala Lumpur, Jalan Bukit Bintang,  55100 Kuala Lumpur.

content.short-description: Outstanding outlet, unquestionably the best family friendly place in KL...
content.description:
Outstanding outlet, unquestionably one of the best family friendly place in KL. The menu is fresh, interesting and good for the young ones, who can also have fun in the play area. Also on site is a room for workouts (for mothers pre and post birth) and they host plenty of promotions and competitions to make a wonderful experience for parents and little ones alike.

Halal

content.short-description: At this excellent outlet in Bangsar Village, you can get tasty beta carotene fried rice for only RM8.90...
content.description:
Organic food doesn't have to be pricey. At this excellent outlet in Bangsar Village, you can get tasty beta carotene fried rice for only RM8.90. The chef uses slow cooking to make sure none of the valuable nutrients inside the food is lost through overheating. If you are dieting or have diabetes, lactose intolerance or other dietary ills, there are no shortage of foodstuffs and supplements to suit.

Pork Free

content.short-description: The longest running pay-TV provider in Malaysia. Astro, an acronym for All-Asian Satellite Television and Radio Operator, transmits digital...
content.description: The longest running pay-TV provider in Malaysia. Astro, an acronym for All-Asian Satellite Television and Radio Operator, transmits digital satellite TV and radio using direct broadcst satellite on the KU band. Its broadcasting complex, the All Asia Broadcast Centre, is located in Technology Park, Bukit Jalil.

content.short-description: Centre-point is a medium sized shopping mall located minutes away from 1Utama...
content.description: Not as busy as the near but popular 1Utama, Centrepoint is a favourite amongst residents within the vicinity. A new wing has recently been added to Centrepoint with retail outlets such as a DIY shop, Starbuck Cafe, Manhattan Fish Restaurant, a Thai Restaurant,  a clinic and a hair saloon.

content.short-description: Malaysia is ready to entice and seduce its twilight butterflies with au courant art house performances...
content.description:
Whimsical, magical and plush, Malaysia is ready to entice and seduce its twilight butterflies with au courant art house performances. thisis the new clubbing experience. modelled after renowned opera houses across Europe, our clubbing scene is introducing The Opera in Sunway Pyramid

The Opera has three different rooms. The Theatre, known as the main room is stretched over 10000 sq feet of space. Patrons get to party with a sweeping view of this three storied opera house where the mezzanine is flanked on both sides with luxury VIP areas, a commanding view from the rear and high ceilings that sets the room for Opera performances.

The Observatory which is located on the rooftop of the Opera holds several bars, which makes it an ideal place for functions, private parties and events. Here the setting is al fresco and patrons are companied by music, the breezy night air, the moon and the stars. With big projector screens and several seating choices.

The Long Lounge provides an ideal environment to relax nonchalantly and enjoy the best happy hour. Patrons may dine to an array of menu offering both local and international dishes.

content.short-description: Expect attentive and friendly service which will complete a very German night out...
content.description:
Located amongst a bustling area of Italian, Mexican and Mediterranean eateries, Deutsches Gasthaus more than holds its own with its many regular customers. Boasting a cosy, neighbourhood feel, it serves up a mean pork knuckle with the portions sufficient to feed half of Bavaria. With crispy golden skin and oh-so-tender meat, it comes as no surprise that this is their perennial bestseller. The smooth flowing beer from very 'experienced' taps will certainly help to wash the carnivorous meal down. Expect attentive and friendly service which will complete a very German night out.

Non Halal

Other Branches:

24 Lorong Rahim Kajai 14, Taman Tun Dr Ismail;
C112, Centre Wing, Metropolitan Square, Jalan PJU 8/1, Bandar Damansara Perdana, PJ

content.short-description: Ideal for group and family gatherings, it offers the usual bevy of top-class beers to accompany your meal...
content.description:
A hidden gem amidst the hustle and bustle of the main street at The Curve, Bavarian Bierhaus has everything you would hope for from a German restaurant. Ambience is relaxed with a very open feel. Ideal for group and family gatherings, it offers the usual bevy of top-class beers to accompany your meal. And it is no ordinary meal. The crispy pork knuckle (natch) with smoked bacon and honey is able to rival even the best of them. As an alternative, you could have the pancetta salad to limit the porcine a little. Reservations are recommended.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Casual dining with myriad Asian and western dishes on offer and a special array of designer sandwiches...
content.description:
Casual dining with myriad Asian and western dishes on offer and a special array of 'designer sandwiches'. Lavish buffet spreads are on offer for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Pork Free

content.short-description: UTAR stands for Universiti Tunku Abdul Rahman. Named after the first Prime Minister of Malaysia, UTAR has...
content.description:
UTAR stands for Universiti Tunku Abdul Rahman. Named after the first Prime Minister of Malaysia, UTAR has more than 18,000 students spread over four campuses in Petaling Jaya, Setapak, Bandar Sungai Long and Kampar, Perak. The main campus is located in a convenient commercial centre surrounded by residential areas in Petaling Jaya.

It now comprises UTAR's administrative departments, Faculty of Information and Communication Technology, Faculty of Creative Industries, Institute of Postgraduate Studies and Research, Centre for Extension Education, and Centre for Foundation Studies.

content.short-description: Not the best restaurant in the exceptional Feast Floor of Starhill Gallery still it is worthy...
content.description:
Serving different menus according to season is a risk that doesn't always pay off but Shook! is to be lauded for its bravery. Not the best restaurant in the exceptional Feast Floor of Starhill Gallery still it is well worthy of gathering friends together for an evening of something fun and potentially excellent.

Pork Free

content.short-description: The menu spans from East to West; chefs Hadi Ng and Raja Kumar cook up a storm...
content.description:
The menu spans from East to West (with particularly good Chinese options); chefs Hadi Ng and Raja Kumar cook up a storm.   Excellent range of set meals are available and plenty of deals and special events crop up, including the yee sang dish which symbolizes the spirit of 1Malaysia and signifies unity, with its many different races and cultures in Malaysia.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Enjoy the warm Eastin hospitality and experience our passion for efficiency and service excellence...
content.description: Eastin hotel is a business class hotel of international standards. Situated strategically on Jalan Damansara, an upmarket location nestled conveniently within the vicinity of golf courses, shopping malls and office buildings, it is designed to suit your needs as a business or leisure travelers.

content.short-description: KLs biggest, boldest and most family friendly buffet restaurant...
content.description:
KL's biggest, boldest and most family friendly buffet restaurant has several live cooking stations and a large dining area all decked out in modern, bright surrounds. Perfect for celebrations with individuals (family, friends or colleagues) who love to eat and can get value for money through their commitment to refilling their plate. The Japanese and western kitchens are especially good, not to mention the chocolate fondue and other array of desserts.

Pork Free

content.short-description: TY Gallery
content.description: TY Gallery.

content.short-description: Strategically located in the heart of Kuala Lumpur's midtown area, CapSquare's location alone makes it...
content.description:
Strategically located in the heart of Kuala Lumpur's midtown area, CapSquare's location alone makes it one of the city's most desirable addresses. CapSquare's proximity to the Golden Triangle and Central Business District means it has lots of financial, administrative, commercial and leisure activities in one space.

Living up to the standards as a 'community builder', CapSquare is designed to fulfill the needs of the society that craves modern urban living, with a unique mix of signature offices with Manhattan-inspired residence. A place that provides you your shopping needs and desires, CapSquare is also a shopping centre that pulsates a whole 300 metres of retail boulevard.

Featured as an innovative commercial development, CapSquare is an epitome of elegance that raises corporate profiles to a higher standard and class. Corporate buildings are carefully designed based on the core concepts which are efficiency, freedom and flexibility to portray uniqueness and a sense of exclusiveness.

CapSquare, a place for your own personal urban space gives a hinge of chic and comfort in its own distinct way. With a very safe environment that provides maximum security and tranquility, residing here would be almost like living in your very own 'Zen' garden.

content.short-description: Ambience is roomy and cosy but the location is a bit obscure...
content.description: That is why it called fusion. Patrons can meet with numerous foods and beverages. Taken from Japanese, Kissaten (café) presents katsu udon, pizza, pasta, sandwiches, and local favourites. Ambience is roomy and cosy but the location is a bit obscure.

content.short-description: This is a great little place, an urban fusion menu with some lovely sweet treats...
content.description:
This is a great little place, virtually unknown outside of its clientele. An urban fusion menu with some lovely sweet treats to accompany the more wholesome main meals.

Halal

content.short-description: Eclectic and vibrant with all day a la carte and international buffet menus...
content.description:
Eseence is a suave and hip restaurant located in KL's five star Sheraton Imperial Hotel. Under and expansive skylight and surrounded by red walls, dim lighting and comfy couches, the eatery is an ideal place to enjoy a relaxing night out.

Eclectic and vibrant with all day a la carte and international buffet menus. Topped off with a decadent dessert spiral, which is as artistic and cool as the decor.

Enjoy the theaterical performance of master chefs as they whip up dishes right in front of you, whetting your appetite.

Taste Asian favourites and savour dishes from the seafood raw bar. 

Pork Free

content.short-description: Irresistible pastries , multiple choice of sandwiches, cakes, coffee and tea are part of the relaxing fun on offer...
content.description:
Situated in the KL's four star Pearl International Hotel, the Deli Corner offers a blended cuisine. From Malay and Chinese cuisine to Western food.

Indulge in Irresistible pastries, multiple choice of sandwiches, cakes, coffee and tea are part of the relaxing fun on offer, alongside a strong a la carte menu. Plus, they do a great Japanese buffet Sunday lunch.

Bring your friends and colleagues here for a relaxing evening.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Overwhelmingly popular and rightly so; the food is consistently superb and always served quickly.
content.description:
What started off as a quaint tearoom behind the floors of MS. READ has grown successfully.

Overwhelmingly popular and rightly so. From the excellent breakfasts to lighter lunches and fresh, hearty and well-prepared mains (not to mention the to-die-for cakes and desserts), Delicious is an institution in Kuala Lumpur. The food is consistently superb and always served quickly.

Check out signature mains like the chargrilled grain-fed chilled tenderloin steak (250gm or 300gm) served with bearnaise, balsamic reduction or beef jus. Guests can opt for a choice of two sides with this extravangant dish. Recommended with a side of sauteed mange tout and rosemary garlic fried potatoes.

Pork Free

Other Branches:

Bangsar Village II, Jalan Telawi 2,  59100 Bangsar, Kuala Lumpur.

1Utama Shopping Centre, No 1, Persiaran Bandar Utama, Bandar Utama, 47800 Petaling Jaya, Selangor.

content.short-description: Certainly one of the most unique dining experiences around, journeying around picturesque Putrajaya...
content.description:
A dinner on board the DAUN, the Cruise Tasik Putrajaya's luxury sining cruise boat offers a spectacular package with a 5 star food outlet - with a twist- the scenery constantly changes.

Certainly one of the most unique dining experiences around, this cruise actually manages to serve good food, making it a very enjoyable way to spend an evening, journeying around picturesque Putrajaya.

The duration of the cruise ranges from one to two hours. Guests can opt for the brunch, lunch, tea or dinner package.

Not to mention that all guests receive a complimentary snack and drink at the waiting lounge before boarding.

Halal

content.short-description: The outlet at KLCC is famed and a popular meeting point; good food, if somewhat overpriced.
content.description:
Good food, if somewhat overpriced. The outlet at KLCC is famed and a popular meeting point as it cannot be missed being as it is directly opposite the fountains in Suria KLCC by the sliding doors.

The venue serves a mixture of fusion-infused food, local favourites, Western cuisine and international fare like Japanese food.

Among the highly recommended dishesinclude the Lobster Soup, Lamb Chop, Dragon tempura, Confit of Salmon Trout with Poached Oyster, roasted barramundi in potato wrap, wild mushroom with oxtail ravioli, foie gras, fusili with smoked chicken, and more.

Overall a very classy feel.

Pork Free

Other Branches:
Ground floor, Suria KLCC, Jalan Ampang, 50088 Kuala Lumpur

content.short-description: Sunrise Sports Zone is specially dedicated to under-16 youths. It offers several sporting facilities including...
content.description: Sunrise Sports Zone is specially dedicated to under-16 youths. It offers several sporting facilities including football field, futsal court, basketball court, volleyball and handball court, all geared to instill team spirit among youth.

content.short-description: Centro is a nice spot for dinner (or a cocktail) before a night of partying....
content.description:
You might come to Centro for its hip club lounge and have a party. But there's more to this place than that. Centro is a nice spot for dinner (or a cocktail) before a night of partying. Listen to trendy sounds of R&B and House music by resident and guest DJS. Guests will also be entertained by a live band during dinner hours.

Located in one of the more demanding spots in the city, patrons are served a mixture of Italian modern, Western, Fusion-infused, and Asian local favourites with fresh ingredients and well-prepared dishes.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Under the Singaporean Chinese restaurant chain Crystal Jade, Amuleto is their western fusion offering...
content.description:
Under the Singaporean Chinese restaurant chain Crystal Jade, Amuleto is their western fusion offering. Something of a mish-mash, dishes can alternate between the simply satisfying and genuinely tasty. The menu features an extensive list of tapas, vegetarian dishes, rosti and a lavish choice of beverages.

Order a Papaya Salad with Chicken Floss Thai Style; the Quartet Soup (served interestingly enough - in shot glasses) and carry on to the Braised Lamb Shank for mains. Complete with the unique Green tea tiramisu.

Check out the Western Salmon "Lo San" for something healthy and different.

Clean, contemporary setting and decent service. On the pricey side.

content.short-description: 7atenine is set to reclaim its mantle as one of the city's finest night spots, but it's not all about the partying here...
content.description:
Refurbished and cleaned up in early 2010, 7atenine is set to reclaim its mantle as one of the city's finest night spots. Be sure to stop by on 'white night' - a sensually surreal pure white  musicological experience, held every saturday.

However, it's worth noting that it's not all about the partying here. The menu caters to all day dining and the venue boasts a sun bar, barclay bar and a champagne pillar. The food is also worthy of a pleasant semi-alfresco meal opposite the city's most notable attraction.

7atenine's menu swings in the direction of cosmopolitan cuisine; specials include the kakiage, green tea smoked salmon and beef yakitori.

Pork Free

content.short-description: A new kid on the block but already setting quite the benchmark for culinary excellence...
content.description:
A new kid on the block but already setting quite the benchmark for culinary excellence. The Press Room is from the same stable as La Bodega -guaranteeing a strong wine list - but is further up-market. The food is outstanding and the setting more than matches, but prepared to wait a long, long time for your food. One of the highlights of the brand new impressive development of Bangsar Shopping Centre.

Check out the double lamb chop with bubble and squeak; the Braised Wagyu cheek with turnip risotto; and the Saffron linguine with seared scallops, artichokes and truffle oil.


The Time Out Food 40 is our regular definitive guide on where to eat in the Klang Valley. Establishments will only appear in the TOKL Food 40 if they rank amongst the best and most satisfying dining experiences according to our team of independent, honest and experienced food critics.

content.short-description: Third Floor takes diners on a journey of classic modern cuisine with flavours from Australia and the Pacific Rim...
content.description:
Third Floor takes diners on a journey of classic modern cuisine (french-inspired) with a blend of flavours from Australia and the Pacific Rim. Despite a lack of creativity in the naming department, this minor flaw certainly doesn't apply to the food as it serves up to 150 hors d'oeuvres accompanied by an extensive degustation menu by Chef Ken Hoh. Ambience is decidedly modern with a contemporary feel but not overwhelmingly so. Try the delectable foie gras with a caramelised-pear-and-burgundy reduction.

If this is a festive occasion, make use of the Chef's 5-7 Course tasting menu which offers treats from oscietra cavia to seared beef medallion with sarawak pepper to a cheese platter.

For a la carte recommendations, check out the sea urchin with jelly consomme topped with beluga caviar and gold leaf. For something meatier, try the lightly seared wagyu beef with calamansia and butter sauce.

Pork Free

content.short-description: One of the finest upmarket eateries in town, Pacifica is an ideal location for business dinners or intimate social...
content.description: One of the finest upmarket eateries in town, Pacifica permeates exclusivity and elegance and is an ideal location for business dinners or intimate social gatherings. The sleek and relaxing ambiance with warm decorations melds well with the breathtaking interior, each table boasting a circular veil of peach strings for privacy. Regarding where it matters most, there is no doubting the freshness of the seafood as ingredients are flown in twice a week. The variety of oysters is second to none. For dessert, order the soufflé, which comes with a choice of either chocolate served with orange ice cream or praline with toffee sauce.

content.short-description: TMS Art specialises in batik, and pride itself as a one-stop batik centre, where it not only...
content.description: Founder of TMS Art Gallery, Emilia Tan set up the one-stop batik centre to showcase batik paintings and batik artists' works. For unique batik prints, batik news and information, drop by the TMS Art Gallery. An ideal spot for art students and lovers. To indulge in your inner batik passion, sign up for the TMS Art & Craft Workshop. Join classes like Shibori, Batik Painting, Batik Sarong, Jewelry making, Photography, Ceramic and much more!

content.short-description: Considered among the very best eateries in the city for many years for their brilliant food and pleasant setting...
content.description:
Cilantro is back; it is in fact one of the more eagerly anticipated returns KL has ever seen. Foodies flocked to the freshly refurbished restaurant in quivering anticipation of what the hiatus would produce, both in terms of chef Takeshi Kimura's culinary creativity and the perennially sleek interior of arguably KL's best loved eatery. I would probably not be exaggerating when I say the magnitude of Cilantro's return was to KL-ites the gastronomic equivalent of a Beatles tour, assuming John Lennon could somehow be brought back to life. Let's not forget however that during that year, sister restaurant Sage had been deservedly earning plaudits for its obviously Cilantro-inspired cuisine. Challengers to the throne were also clamouring for attention. Throw in the hype about the impending relaunch and it was obvious Cilantro had to really dazzle in order to justify the excitement.
     Which is why the unshakeable sense of sameness not just to the décor - the same beige-cream-off-white hues dominate the same circular seating with banquettes at the side - but also to the service (albeit rather more perfunctory this time round) and the menu made the landing all the more discomfiting. Perhaps the management wanted to ensure a sense of continuity but it sure felt disturbingly reminiscent of a friend who left many years ago only to return untouched by time and trends, telling the same well-worn jokes and wearing the same style of attire he had always done, when we had all obviously moved on.
     That's not to say the food and service have deteriorated. Au contraire. The same faces with the same impeccable manners continue to serve the same signature Cilantro classics, which brings me to my original point precisely: what, if anything, had changed?
     Certainly not the freshly baked bread and complimentary truffle butter that is a peril for those with a low resistance to temptation of the tasty kind, nor the panfried unagi with foie gras, a masterclass in fusion done with alacrity. Even the gold standard - the angel hair pasta crowned with sea urchin - can still be found, and it continues to scintillate with its mouthwatering juxtaposition of flavours and textures, with the al dente pasta providing a perfect foil for the creamy sea urchin roe.
     Perhaps I'm missing the point but the prodigious talents of chef Kimura would have been better served had he given us a fresh glimpse of his culinary innovation with this revamp rather than more of the same.
 


The Time Out Food 40 is our regular definitive guide on where to eat in the Klang Valley. Establishments will only appear in the TOKL Food 40 if they rank amongst the best and most satisfying dining experiences according to our team of independent, honest and experienced food critics.

content.short-description: The only restaurant in town which serve dishes in Filipino style, Cagayan (named after a province in Philippines)...
content.description:
Mabuhay! The only restaurant in town which serve dishes in Filipino style, Cagayan (named after a province in Philippines) serves up pork ribs and Filipino cuisine in a humble setting dining place. Patrons can choose wide menus of mainly pork cooked with Filipino style. The food is relatively fairly priced and more importantly, rich, scrumptious, and authentic. Check out the Golden Mushroom Bacon Maki which consists of golden brown Enoki mushrooms wrapped with pork bacon. For mains, try the 'Little Piggy' which is pork ribs dripped in oriental soy sauce and served with potatoes and salad.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Ambience is relaxed with the typical whiff of an English pub floating in the air...
content.description:
Drunken brawls, tattoo-littered hooligans, nauseating restrooms and bad jokes. Modern pubs have done away with these unwanted accolades (except maybe bad jokes) and have cleaned up their act tremendously. Somewhere at the top of this list lies Bulldog Pub and Café located in the ever-growing Sri Hartamas. Ambience is relaxed with the typical whiff of an English pub floating in the air. Serving traditional English pub grub, their perennial favorite Toad in the Hole is a must-try. Head on upstairs for a quick game of pool with your mates. The hearty portions of each dish are a nice bonus. An epicurean's dream.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Yearning for that English-ness away from home? The Teapot Café could quell that homesick feeling...
content.description: Yearning for that 'English-ness' away from home? The Teapot Café could (in some lengths) quell that homesick feeling with its quaint little interior filled with a myriad of teapots of all shapes and sizes. With the ambience of a typical old English-garden atmosphere, this humble, unassuming establishment is best known for its roast beef which is as scrumptious as it is huge. And what English café would it be if the word 'scones' isn't on the menu? On the Asian section, try out the unusual Roti Jala (Net Bread) or just play it safe with Malaysia's unofficial dish, the Nasi Lemak.

content.short-description: A favourite of everyone who has ever dropped in for a rest and a brew; one of the best tea houses in the region...
content.description:
A firm favourite of everyone who has ever dropped in for a rest and a brew, the outlet at FRIM is a definite must-see for people looking to escape the city. One of the very best tea houses in the region, and the place to experience Malay culture.

Guests are welcomed to the eatery in the traditional Malay way, and are instructed to take off their shoes before being treated to rich local delicacies and premium teas.

The menu boasts usual local favourites such as nasi lemak, ketupat palas, otak-otak, rendang and Malay kueh. There's even traditional Malay dessert. All prepared and cooked with great pains to ensure quality and authenticity.

Halal

Other Branches:
Lot 514, Jalan Symington off Jalan Jelutong, Forest Research Institute Malaysia (FRIM), 52109 Kepong, Selangor

content.short-description: El Patio can be found in the unspoken but enjoyable Melia Hotel in the centre of town...
content.description:
Serving food from various countries around the world, El Patio can be found in the unspoken but enjoyable Melia Hotel in the centre of town.

You can wine and dine here in a genuine Spanish-like setting while you enjoy both local and international cuisines.

Check out monthly seasonal specials created by the Master Chef.

Be sure to try the tender US beef is renowned for its flavor. Choose a side of potatoes and sauces, cooked the way you want.

Among the specialties include the Hainanese Chicken Rice,
Spaghetti Aglio e Olio, Classic Caesar Salad with Smoked Salmon,Fish and Chips, Pan Fried Seabass Fillet, Smoked Duck Salad, Fish Head Noodles Soup,and Australian Beef Tenderloin.

Pork Free

content.short-description: One of the newest Chinese restaurants around, the onomatopoeia of the name is more than accurate...
content.description:
One of the newest Chinese restaurants around, the onomatopoeia of the name is more than accurate. Zing, is situated in the Grand Millenium Hotel on Bukit Bintang. The menu features an array of Oriental influenced dishes and has an indefinite 'zing' or buzz that keeps diners coming back for more. Let's hope its not MSG.

Headed by Master Chef Leong Weng Heng and crew, the venue houses a fine selection of live, exotic seafood (so you know it's going to be fresh), dim sum, home-styled specialties, special noodley dishes, and roasted and barbecued items.

Pork free, the restaurant does not lose out in any customers (the menu is extensive and makes up for the lack of pork).

content.short-description: YiQi is a very good Chinese steamboat restaurant in KLs oldest hotel...
content.description:
A very good Chinese steamboat restaurant in KL's oldest hotel, Federal KL on Jalan Bukit Bintang. YiQi is one of the more affordable and good value in this bracket, with a cosy, comparatively informal atmosphere.
Among the favourite dishes are the Xiu Long Bao, Octopus  ball, Sa-toh fish ball, Spinach porridge, Foo-kuen with beancurd rolls, Deep-fried ginger chicken, Paper-wrapped chicken, and fried chicken skin.

For the perfect meal, start off with shrimp wantons and carry on to the teo-cheow succulent duck. For vegetarians, check out the Yong Tau Foo with stuffed brinjals.

content.short-description: Elaborate yet contemporary, the Chinese restaurant at the Prince has a wide selection of Oriental treats...
content.description:
Elaborate yet contemporary, the halal Chinese restaurant at the Prince Hotel has the standard of dim sum you would hope for - a delectable selection of the finest.  Plus a wide selection of other treats from the Orient.

The award-winning Tai Zi Heen is beautifully interior decorated which is almost as impressive as its innovative menu. You can't miss the extraordinary 2000 piece crystal chandelier in the main dining hall. The wood, marble, art pieces, and glass all create a very soothing and classy ambience.

Start off with the Sweet & Sour Crab Sauce on Fried Mantau; carry on to the crispy roasted chicken with schechuan sesame sauce, and complete with a very refreshing chinese tea. 

Pork Free

content.short-description: A perfect place to makan and chat with friends, this little place in TTDI is the epitome of good local Chinese fare...
content.description:
A family-style restaurant in Taman Tun, the Sun Yau Tak Teng eatery is becoming increasingly popular. If you come at peak hour you may have to wait around before you get a full table to your party. But the venue sometimes clumps you with another party if the wait is too long. Be prepared for some uncomfortable conversation.

Though, it may be worth it- this little place in TTDI is the epitome of good local Chinese fare. A perfect place to makan and chat with friends over the usual stir fries or something a little more unusual, such as the marmite prawns. Other favourite dishes include Pork in Pineapple and Dai zhao with double boiled soup.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Hankering for real German food to accompany that cold beer of yours? Then Stadt is the place just for you....
content.description:
Hankering for real German food to accompany that cold beer of yours? Then Stadt is the place just for you.

Stadt specializes in authentic German cuisine, featuring original recipe of German favourites such as German Grilled steak, sausages, and their specialty, crispy pork knuckle.

Stadt also serves a wonderful selection of German and local beers. So, beers and meat, heavenly, ain't it so?

Stadt Puchong: (see side bar)

Stadt Kepong: No 2, Jalan Metro Perdana 8, Taman Usahawan Kepong, Kepong Utara, 52100 KL. 03 6250 1016

content.short-description: For arguably the best Sichuan cuisine in town, head to Park Royal Hotel in the central street of Jalan Sultan Ismail...
content.description:
The venue is part of a chain of restaurants designed for the sole purpose of Park Royal Hotels and Resorts. Now famous for its quality and authenticity, the eatery has become very succesful.

Si Chuan Dou Hua is well-known for its exceptional fine dining, while appealing to all senses with its authentic cuisine, art of tea, and classy ambience. Sichuan cuisine is known for its sharp taste and numbing effect that stays long in your mouth. For arguably the best in town head to five star Parkroyal Hotel in the central street of Jalan Sultan Ismail. The best of the overall satisfying menu includes eight treasure seafood soup, double-boiled minced chicken dou hua soup and sliced pork in garlic and chilli sauce.

content.short-description: You can feel the regal ambience courtesy of the black wood dining chairs and quaint Chinese paintings...
content.description:
Right in the KL's JW Marriott is the hotel's premier restaurant, Shanghai. A leading restaurant in Kuala Lumpur, this outlet offers, as you would expect, authentic Shanghainese cuisine.

The dishes are generally excellent and come in plentiful variety. The Shanghai pancakes with red bean is a treat while Chinese tea connoisseurs will have a field day. You can feel the regal ambience courtesy of the black wood dining chairs and quaint Chinese paintings.

Tempt yourself with Cheng Kong homestyle ham, Drunken chicken, Deep fried Eel Wuxi style, Pan fried vegetable dumplings, Crispy duck with fortune rolls, and Baked Chinese pastry with sesame seeds.

content.short-description: The Shang's elegant home of Chinese food mostly decorate with imperial yellow Chinese design...
content.description:
The Shang's elegant home of Chinese food mostly decorated with imperial yellow Chinese design. The Palace offers Cantonese food at its best, which one would expect seeing that it's located in a five star hotel. Patrons will get quality fresh food on the extensive a la carte menu. And if that's not enough, Dim Sum is served here too. In fact its their signature. Dishes are prepared by Lee Chiu Hung, executive Chef. With his culinary skill and knowledge in Oriental cuisine, the menu is up to par for the most elite members of society.

Try the Braised Shark's Fin Soup made with Bean Sprouts and Chinese Parsley for mains. For dessert, check out the Double-boiled bird nest with red dates swimming in a whole cocounut.

Non Halal

content.short-description: As long as it's noodly, it's going to be found in plentiful supply at The Noodle Room...
content.description:
Located in the Hilton KL, the Noodle Room is a haven to noodle-lovers.
As the name suggests, you come here for noodles. All noodles. Big, small, thin, thick, dry, in soup, spicy, sour, fishy, plain, you name it, as long as it's noodly, it's going to be found in plentiful supply at The Noodle Room. From Thai Tom Yam to Vietnamese rice noodles to Japanese Ramen to Hokkien noodles to good old Malaysian curry mee; the venue allows guests to customise their meals.
Guests can also enjoy breathtaking views of the Lake Gardens from the floor-to-ceiling windows.


Note that smoking is not permitted here.

content.short-description: Prepare to be stunned in Ming Room. There's a distinct and unusual artistic twist as far as the decor goes...
content.description:
Get prepared to be stunned in Ming Room, the place for indulging in authentic Cantonese Cuisine. Located in the newly renovated Bangsar Shopping Centre, the Oriental Ming Room is a classy dining outlet with teracotta horses engraved in the walls. A perfect place to host a celebratory occasion, capable of seating 200 pax.

There's a distinct and unusual artistic twist in the juxtaposition of history and sophistication as far as the decor goes. Meanwhile get your gastronomic pleasure from baked foie gras with stuffed sea clams and crispy kurobuta pork in money bag. Quite different, but in a good way.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Centrally located, making it a good stop off point for tourists, they serve a reasonable selection of meals...
content.description: The well-known Marco Polo has been going strong for years. Centrally located,and right opposite the Istana Hotel, the restaurant is a good stop off point for tourists, they serve great Chinese cuisine and the menu features the city's best shark fin's. Definitely worth of inclusion in any food outlet list, but on the pricey side. The shark's fin alone costs RM38. Among other highly recommended dishes are the Fish Maw and Scallop Soup, the Steamed Fish, the 'Pei Pa' which consists of 10 different styles of ribs. For vegetarians, there is the vegetarian mushroom dish which comes with a surplus of sweet gravy.

content.short-description: Mandarin Palace restaurant serves a mixture of Cantonese, Hunanese and Szechuan cuisine...
content.description:
Famous for its delicious Hong Kong dim sum, barbecued meats and a mixture of Cantonese, Hunanese and Szechuan cuisine, the Mandarin Palace is an award-winning restaurant. Based in the Federal Kuala Lumpur, the restaurant boasts an imperial dining setting.

The venue also houses live seafood such as lobster, crab, mollusce, river fish and more, so you know your seafood is definitely going to be fresh. For some Hunanese traditional dishes, check out the Deep Fried Shreddecd Duck with Pepper Corn or the Steamed fish with Preserved Bean.

Prices are expensive no doubt, given the location, and can vary according to the season.

Non Halal

content.short-description: The perfect break from a hectic shopping trip; pop in for a real teahouse experience...
content.description:
The perfect break from a hectic shopping trip - Luk Yu is located in Starhill Gallery. Pop in a real teahouse experience to sip Chinese tea and nibble on typical Hong Kong dim sum and other Chinese favourites.

Pick from all-time favourites such as Jasmine, Chrysanthemum, and Oolong. For premium teas, you have the choice of the Silver Needle Jasmine, Ginseng Oolong and the An Xi Guan Yin Wan.

Peep through the ornate lattice walls and you'll spy Chef Lee or Chef Thomas creating his masterpieces in the restaurant's open kitchen. Guests also have the option of sitting outside, request a board game in the courtyard area.

content.short-description: Among the very finest Cantonese restaurants in the city, Golden Phoenix is an excellent location..
content.description:
Among the very finest Cantonese restaurants in the city, Golden Phoenix is an excellent dining experience that retains its attraction whether guests are looking for a romantic pairing or a banquet for hundreds.

Situated inside the five star Equatorial hotel, the popular Golden Phoenix is a signature restaurant which serves authentic cuisine. The menu features rich and traditional Cantonese dishes created by Master Chef, "Alfie".

With its beautiful interior and decor, the restaurant appears elegant yet informal. Private rooms are also available for interested parties, the holding capacity is up to 400 persons.

Check out the new lunch menus changed every day, as well as lunchtime specials.

content.short-description: Enjoyable aromatic Taiwanese cuisine. Gentle and comfy ambience, ideal for lunch...
content.description:
Enjoyable aromatic Taiwanese cuisine, even if the portion is a little bit smaller than elsewhere. Definitely something to complain about especially since the venue has come away with some good food reviews. On the pricey restaurant, this place is perfect for once in awhile celebrations.

Usually very busy, it's ideal to book ahead to guarantee a table at the eatery.

Try Fong Lye specials such as the '3 bei chi' which consists of chicken cooked with chilli, basil leaves and black soya sauce. A must order - especially for the sweet-tootheds!

Check out the Taiwan style glutinous rice wrap-up sausage - a similar bite to a western style hot dog (if a little hard to hold).

Overall, a gentle and comfy ambience (plus a lounge with big cushion chairs for the waiting area).

Other Branches:

94 Jalan Imbi, 55100 Kuala Lumpur;

T208, 3rd Floor, Gardens Mid Valley, Mid Valley City, Lingkaran Syed Putra, 59200 Kuala Lumpur

content.short-description: All the way from London, this eatery is new in town...
content.description:
All the way from Queensway London, this eatery is new in town. Apart from their famous roasts a.k.a the legegendary mouth-watering roast duck, you should try Hong Kong style dishes like Stir-fried Kai Lan and BBQ pork ribs. Check out Four Season specials such as the Hong Kong style Poon Choi, the Fried Ho Fun which consists of a rice noodle with beef in a black bean sauce, and the Honey Barbecued Pork Char Siu which is very moist and sweet.

Something different to try is the fusion-infused dish, the Pork Chop Cheese baked rice is one for cheese-lovers.

For budget food, you're hard pressed to find better value with an individual serving of duck rice for no more than RM8++.

In general however, the menu is above the usual price range, but definitely worth it given the authenticity. If you're not a big eater, don't fret - portions come in three different sizes.

content.short-description: Fine Circle serves gourmet dishes including the wondrously-named Mini Buddha Jump over the Wall...
content.description:
On the Jalan Raja Chulan intersection with Bukit Bintang, Fine Circle restaurant tries something of the unusual.

The menu is predominantly of chinese fare with delicacies combined with both Asian and international influences.

Gourmet dishes include the wondrously-named Mini Buddha Jump over the Wall and Superior Shark's Fin Wan Tan. There is also a solid assortment of dim sum which is ready baked, steamed, fried, and pan fried.

An innovative menu no doubt, the list features a unique selection of dishes such as the deep fried salad roll filled with prawn, and the hark au with foie gras.

Among the venue's specialties include Seared Norwegian Salmon with Soya butter sauce and Lobster Salad with Exotic fruit combination.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Tip top Cantonese food; this is a real 5 star experience and a little haven of calm...
content.description:
Tip top Cantonese food; this is a real five star experience (in the five star Renaissance hotel) with its traditionally Chinese-style room and beautiful interior. A fine dining experience no doubt, Dynasty is popular for its Cantonese cusine. All the usual suspects are on the menu: dim sum, home-made specialties, as well as some unexpected treats; cold starters in the northern style or deep fried yam balls or Peking Duck. Check out the homemade tau foo far for dessert. The food is pricey, given the five star location so be prepared to pay around RM50 per head.

Vegetarian options are also available.

This is dining fit for an Emperor. 

Non Halal

content.short-description: Duck King presents their duck in nine different ways at this cute restaurant in the Jaya One complex...
content.description:
If you're a duck fan, this is the place for you. Part of the international Duck King group, the Malaysian branch opened two years ago.

Working out which are the nine different ways Duck King present their duck is just part of the fun at this cute restaurant in the Jaya One complex. To answer a third of your question, try the Three Duck Combination, comprising of roast duck, teo chew braised duck, and marinated "Nanjing" salted duck.

The Duck Kind seems to have drawn a consistent group of customers from the office crowd, as well as families from the surrounding rea. In general, the place is frequently packed.

Also available are good mixed juices of pineapple and Choi Sum.

And if you feel like ducking out, the menu serves a wide range of seafood, Dim sum, noodles and more.

content.short-description: Not a typical name for a Chinese eating place, Cubes still offers fine Chinese cookery...
content.description:
Not a typical name for a Chinese eating place, Cube Restaurant and Wine Lounge is a trendy and classic dining experience. With its interior themed black and white, the restaurant is modernly furnished. Barely discovered by the KL crowd, CUBEs has already got a name for its fine Chinese cuisine.

The venue caters to Asian and Western tastes with its combination cooking.
Highly recommended is "probably the best London aromatic duck" in Malaysia, served together with crepe, spring onion, julienned cucumber, and special sauce.

Generous portions and heavenly bites, Chef Yap Fook Wah is the man behind this excellent menu.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Tucked away from other restaurants, Chow Yang makes good food for its dedicated patrons...
content.description:
Tucked away from other restaurants, Chow Yang makes good food for its dedicated patrons. Even though the well-known former owner has moved on, Chow Yang still serves mouth-watering food including pork stew, chicken with ginger, hokkien fried meehon, sweet and sour pork and tofu with crabmeat.

Check out the black chicken in herbal soup with mee suah. Relatively strong in taste, this one's for Chinese herbal soup noodle-lovers. Save some room for the 'king of teas' in Chow Yang restaurant to wash down your meal.

Overall, the eatery is comfortable, the food is satisfying, and the service is not too bad either.

Non halal

content.short-description: Chef Ho Boon is a master of Chinese culinary creations...
content.description:
Inspired by Classic Chinese heritage, Celestial court is suited to fine dining. Chef Ho Boon, behind the creative menu, and master of Chinese culinary creations heads the kitchen at this grand restaurant.

Recommended by the chef himself, order the crispy Peking duck with fresh mango and apple; move on to spicy prawns with curry leaves, and complete with mango pudding for your sweeth tooth.

Guests can also enjoy dim sum brunches, which is well worth sampling, particularly the Har gau (prawn dumplings) in the mix, and the Buddha Jumped Over The Wall Dumpling in Sharksfin Soup.

Feel free to add suggestions to the menu as Chef Ho has a tendency to incorporate guests' preferences in his creations.

content.short-description: Be Be's is an intimate, comfortable place for good family dining...
content.description:
Versatile bistro-esque restaurant right in the middle of the city, Be Be's is an intimate, comfortable place for good family dining. Situated in the Capitol Hotel on Bukit Bintang, Be Be's Kitchen and Bar is on the Mezzanine floor.

The menu features an extensive list of international (Japenese, Korean, Shanghainese) and local delights. The venue specialises in breakfast and caters daily buffet lunches with a choice of over 60 dishes available.
If you like to see what goes inside your food, guests are welcome to watch the chefs prepare delicacies in an open kitchen. 

Happy Hour is durng 5:00pm to 8:00pm daily.

content.short-description: With the name meaning 'Brazilian Grill', Bossa Nova is the city's number one example of a churrascaria...
content.description:
With the name meaning 'Brazilian Grill', Bossa Nova is the city's number one example of a churrascaria - grilled tender cuts of meat straight off the skewer. Imported from Argentina and Australia,  all cuts of meat are of prime quality.

Check out the buffet dinners, with every order, Bossa Nova serves complimentary oyster Rockefeller. The venue also houses a wine bar with labels from Latin America, Chile, Argentina, France, Australia and more. Order a bottle to compliment the prime cut.

The dance floor lets you boogie on through Salsa and Samba before and after your dinner. The fun and exceptional quality of meat more than proves value for the price tag.

content.short-description: Who knew that New Zealanders could cook such good noodles and other Asian delights?...
content.description:
Who knew that New Zealanders could cook such good noodles and other Asian delights? If you're adventurous, go for the plate of baked escargots on french bread and cheese, with freshly cut tomatoes on the side. For mains, check out the seafood basket which includes prawns, squid, fish and a side of vegetables.

If you're a rice foodie, check out the seafood fried rice, delicious. And of course- you can't leave without tasting the signature drink - a glass of refreshing Kiwi Fruit juice! They stress value here with big portions at affordable prices. And the quality is not bad either.

Pork Free

content.short-description: A melting pot of flavours; from the signature specialty pizzas to Asian and Western favourites. A world of choice...
content.description:
The Chatz, located in the five star hotel Park Royal is an all day modern dining restaurant which serves a bountiful and delicious lbreakfast, lunch and dinner buffets. A melting pot of flavours; from the signature specialty pizzas (fresh out of the traditional wood fired oven) or Asian and Western favourites including Teriyaki-Glazed Free-Range Chicken Breast or Roasted Apricot-Glazed Lamb Rack. Or... there's the seafood buffet. Vegan dishes have also been added to the new a la carte menu to cater for all tastes. A world of choice.

Overall, good sized portions at affordable prices. Children aged six to 12 dine at 50 per cent off.

Pork Free

content.short-description: This feminine restaurant with chandeliers is a sister restaurant of fabulous Café Café...
content.description:
A sister restaurant of the fabulous Café Café, the Banquet is  decidedly different; from its feminine interior ( chandeliers, flowers galore, wicker chairs), to the food and service.

Planted more-or-less in the middle of Bangsar Village II shopping mall, it offers local and western cuisine with most dishes of a price between RM20-RM30. Quite high for the standard of food served.

Order aromatic chicken wings or the sauteed portabello and button mushrooms with garlic for the starter, carry on with either the oven baked butterfish with cream of honey mustard or Lamb Shank , and complete it with Tiramisu. You can't go wrong with these dishes.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Popular with families, Outback has been around for many years...
content.description:
Popular with families, Outback has been around for many years. Unspectacular but consistent, with the one near Low Yat Plaza especially handily situated for tourists and the like who seem a little out of their depth trying the local fare in the heart of the Bukit Bintang/Jalan Alor triangle.

Outback takes great pride in serving the freshest, highest-quality food possible. The venue serves authentic dishes using authentic ingredients. Check out the USDA Choice steaks, the imported Danish Blue Cheese, toasted hand-cut croutons, the homemade chocolate sauce. At Outback, it's all about quality — and all about the food. Among the feature items on the menu is the signature sirloin paired with succulent Snow Crab, served with a dressed baked potato.

Pork Free

Other Branches:

GL-12, Plaza Low Yat, 7 Jalan 1/77, 55100 Kuala Lumpur.

content.short-description: Positioned just beside the Island shop, this bistro splits into two parts...
content.description:
Positioned just beside the Island shop, this bistro splits into two parts - the air conditioned area and outdoor al-fresco area. But don't worry, diners in the al fresco area will be protected by a glass roof.  Cosy decor and soothing ambience, the bistro makes for an ideal retreat to all customers. The Island offers a combination of delicious authentic local and regional favourites which will satisfy all hunger cravings. The menu features an extensive list of over 40 choices of starters, mains, desserts, and signature dishes. Get local and Singaporean dishes including the mouth-watering Black Pepper Crab Tung Hoon, Singaporean Laksa with Crayfish, and other prawn dishes.

Pork Free

content.short-description: A brilliant cross-Asian outlet as accomplished in Chinese as they are in Malaysian, Japanese, Thai...
content.description:
Catering to Chinese food lovers, EEST boasts an authentic cuisine specially selected from provinces throughout China. A brilliant cross-Asian outlet as accomplished in Chinese as they are in Malaysian, Japanese, Thai and Vietnamese - the cuisines are prepared with authentic recipes, and are all under one roof. As such, your dining experience at EEST will take you on a unique culinary adventure. One of the favourites is the Dim Sum; taste the finest and made to order at this venue.  Don't forget to check out the good value lunchtime deals on bento box sets or go for something more intimate in the evenings.

Pork Free

content.short-description: There is still a heavy hum coming from chef Diego Martinelli's kitchen and it does not look like it will be dying down any time soon...
content.description: There is still a heavy hum coming from chef Diego Martinelli's kitchen and it does not look like it will be dying down any time soon. The dishes on this Italian menu produce rich flavours with a modern touch: the tortellini stuffed with duck and mascarpone with a rosemary sauce, and the Wagyu beef tenderloin with creamed celeriac and porcini jus, have had people raving.

content.short-description: One of the more young and hip hotels in Penang, Hard Rock Hotel is located on the beach at Batu Ferringhi, Penang...
content.description:
One of the more young and hip hotels in Penang, Hard Rock Hotel is located on the beach at Batu Ferringhi, Penang.

The hotel features a free-form swimming pool that is the largest in Penang, as well as a Rock Spa, Lil' Rock Kids Club, Teens Club and a fully equipped gym.

content.short-description: Founded in 1986 to provide affordable quality educational opportunities for Malaysians...
content.description:
Founded in 1986 to provide affordable quality educational opportunities for Malaysians, HELP University College has developed into one of the leading private institution of higher learning in Malaysia.

HELP University College offers a wide and diverse range of programs covering business, law, management, economics, IT, social sciences and the humanities at undergraduate and graduate levels. With research and development as one of their key focus, HELP University College has a certain standard and a setting benchmark in various areas. HELP ensures that their graduates are well-equipped to face the real world which explains why its gradruates are preferred over others for employment. HELP also instills good values and responsibilities to their students thus creating a leadership quality.

content.short-description: The body that oversee the film industry in Malaysia. The Kompleks Studio Merdeka houses, among others...
content.description: FINAS (National Filem Development Malaysia) is the body that oversee the film industry in Malaysia. The Kompleks Studio Merdeka houses, among others, a film library, digital mixing studios, sound studios, lecture halls, a movie screening theatre, and many more.

content.short-description: KidzGrow specializes in helping children with learning difficulties. They also helps children in learning and performing to...
content.description:
The founder of KidzGrow, Cheryl Chia obtained her Master of Physiotheraphy Studies from Australia and has an approximately 10 years of working experience with women and children. Also a former lecturer at Nanyang Polytechnic, she now leads a team of professionals at KidzGrow.

KidzGrow is your solution for learning difficulties. If your child is facing problems such as poor attention and concentration, poor reading ability, untidy handwriting, clumsiness, forgetful and underperforming in school then KidzGrow Center is your solution. Formed to help parents understand their child with these problems, KidzGrow offers help for you to work on your child's learning abilities by focusing on the basics.

Thorough evaluation will be done on your child's foundational learning abilities to figure out what their weaknesses and strengths are. Please take note that  KidzGrow is not a tuition centre, KidzGrow is a place where your child's abilities will be enhanced and put to use, positively.

content.short-description: Without question the best dim sum outside of five star hotels (and possibly even with them included) in KL. Taking...
content.description:
Who doesn't love dim sum, the Chinese version of tapas? Without question the best dim sum outside of five star hotels (and possibly even with them included) in KL. Taking dim sum off the streets where they are more frequently dished up in a ruckus-like environment, A Little Dim Sum Place is different. They do all the old favourites but with an attention to detail that guarantees quality (and of course without the noisy disturbance or pretension). Its many specialities include wu kok (deep fried yam puff), har gao (prawn dumplings) and char siew bao (honey barbecued pork buns)...if you still have the appetite.

(non halal)


The Time Out Food 40 is our regular definitive guide on where to eat in the Klang Valley. Establishments will only appear in the TOKL Food 40 if they rank amongst the best and most satisfying dining experiences according to our team of independent, honest and experienced food critics.

content.short-description: Al-Khawarizmi Astronomy Complex is one of the facilities that are provided by Melaka State Government in order to...
content.description:
The Al-Khawarizmi Astronomy Complex was set up as part of a government initiative to promote education and the study of astronomy.

The complex comprises of three main buildings: the observatory, the Planetarium and the Training centre.

In hopes of enlightening and informing the Malaysian public about astronomy, the Astronomy complex has set plans for further expansion.

Some of the facilities provided in the complex include a planetarium and 3D movie show auditorium, an exhibition area, information kiosk, mini library, lecture room, VIP room and cafeteria.

content.short-description: Fancy dancing? KLDA must be your first stop for dancing in Malaysia!
content.description: Kuala Lumpur Dancers Association or KLDA offers ballroom and Latin dance lessons. If you think you're coordinated enough to learn, then head on down to KLDA! If you think you can't even balance yourself on a bridge, fret not, join the beginners class instead and learn baby steps until you've reached the professional level.

content.short-description: Sports Planet began its services in November 2002, responding to a need for good futsal venues, services and...
content.description: Sports Planet began its services in November 2002, responding to a need for good futsal venues, services and facilities in Malaysia. Its specific emphasis is on facilities and services at an affordable price, as well as the experience one takes home after every futsal game.

content.short-description: Skateline brought in a whole range of the newest skate models - recreational, free-style, aggressive and hockey...
content.description: Skateline brought in a whole range of the newest skate models - recreational, free-style, aggressive and hockey skates - together with the accompanying accessories, especially for you.

content.short-description: Jaya One is a commercial redevelopment project covering some 11 acres of prime real estate in...
content.description:
Jaya One is a commercial redevelopment project covering some 11 acres of prime real estate in Section 13, PJ, At Jaya One's center lies the heart and soul of the development, Palm Square. Home to restaurants, bars, shops, PJ Live Arts 300-seat community theatre and the Life & Learning complex, Palm Square imbues Jaya One with a sense of life, art, culture, entertainment and fun.

At Jaya One's center lies the heart and soul of the development, Palm Square. Home to restaurants, bars, shops, PJ Live Arts 300-seat community theatre and the Life & Learning complex, Palm Square imbues Jaya One with a sense of life, art, culture, entertainment and fun.

content.short-description: Exclusive, secure and all-inclusivethis is the luxurious township of Tropicana Golf & Country Resort...
content.description:
Exclusive, secure and all-inclusive…this is the luxurious township of Tropicana Golf & Country Resort.

Tropicana Golf & Country Resort set out to build a world-class golf course that will be the enjoyment of both avid and amateur golfers.

content.short-description: Brussels Beer Café is a great place to enjoy a variety of delicious Belgian meals. The café has an excellent...
content.description:
Brussels Beer Café is a great place to enjoy a variety of delicious Belgian meals. The café has an excellent interior and comfortable seating area for customers to either to dine or to mingle around the bar.

Comfortable, and uncomplicated, Brussels Beer Café is actually reminiscent of the smaller, snug watering holes of Europe. The crowd is friendly and generally consists of the city's urban working community.

The selection of beer ranges from Australian Crown Lager to the good old Belgian Hoegaarden and can be served in generous five-pint glasses. Service is good, but can be slow.

Other outlets:

Brussels Beer Café, Menara Hap Seng
Lot G-12, 12A Menara Hap Seng, Jalan P.Ramlee, Kuala Lumpur
Tel: 03 2034 1800

Brussels Beer Café, Ampang
No.4 & 6 Jalan 1/67B, Off Jalan Mengkudu Ampang, Kuala Lumpur
Tel : 03 4260 4888

content.short-description: PINKGUY® is actually synonymous with "Bingkai" which means frame in Malay. This gallery offers a variety of...
content.description:
Founded by Winson Loh in 1983, the Pink Guy tells a heart-rendering story of how a poor boy became inspired to start his own frame-making production.
Recognized as the first 3D frame maker in Malaysia, Winson Low created his brand PINKGUY (phonetically derived from Bingkai, which means frame) in 2007.

Loh's paintings are unique, with each frame consisting of a small diamond stud on the side. The company provides both restoration & conversation, as well as installation services on paintings, prints as well as watercolours.

content.short-description: Set up as a nucleus for all art activities in the Hartamas area, MAP consists of two spaces, White and Black...
content.description:
Set up as a nucleus for all art activities in the Hartamas area, MAP consists of two spaces, White (an exhibition space) and Black (a New Media space). Both feature an open-plan space and flexi-walls that allow for the space to be transformed for individual needs. Anyone can participate and make use of MAP's White or Black Boxes.

To make a booking, or for further inquiries, contact 03 6207 9732 or via email at info@mapkl.org or visit www.mapkl.org / facebook.com/mapkl

content.short-description: Established in 1996, Metro Fine Art exhibits works by some of the most exciting contemporary South East Asian artists...
content.description: Established in 1996, Metro Fine Art exhibits works by some of the most exciting contemporary South East Asian artists. Located in the ground floor of the chic Legend Hotel, the gallery 2000 sq. ft. space are often packed with exciting new works of art.

content.short-description: The headquarter of the MCA, one of the biggest political party in Malaysia. The Hall of Wisma MCA are used frequently to...
content.description: The headquarter of the MCA (Malaysian Chinese Association), one of the biggest political party in Malaysia. The halls of Wisma MCA are used frequently to hold various entertainment events and exhibitions.

content.short-description: One of KL's liveliest place, this building has many of the most happening nightlife venues around....
content.description: One of KL's liveliest place, this building has many of the most happening nightlife venues around. Situated right smack in KL, this is a popular place to hang around, with lots of clubs, bars and restaurants catering to all, even to the most demanding of KL'ites. Tenants such Ruums and KL Live have regular live performances from many international acts.

content.short-description: One of Malaysia's most historic landmarks, Dataran Merdeka (Merdeka Square) has a special place in the country's history...
content.description:
One of Malaysia's most historic landmarks, Dataran Merdeka (Merdeka Square) has a special place in the country's history. Situated in front of the iconic Sultan Abdul Samad Building, it is here where the independence of Malaysia from the British was announced on 31 August 1957. Hence the name.

Since then, Dataran Merdeka has been the usual venue for the annual Merdeka Parade (National Day Parade). It is also used for various celebrations, most notably as KL City's official New Year Celebration venue. You can't miss the huge 100 metre flag pole flying the Jalur Gemilang, which is the tallest freestanding pole in the world.

content.short-description: The Royal Selangor Club, founded in 1884 by the British, is a social club in KL, with the objective in providing members with...
content.description: The Royal Selangor Club, founded in 1884 by the British, is a social club in KL, which regularly host sporting and social events. The club is situated next to the historic Dataran Merdeka.

content.short-description: The tatty, stained frame next to our booth enquired, 'Are you having fun yet?' The implication being that if you were in anything...
content.description:
Time Out rating: 1/2 /5
Fun in a bun? Not so much

The tatty, stained frame next to our booth enquired, 'Are you having fun yet?' The implication being that if you were in anything short of rapture as you sat pinned into the too-tight booth supping your 'bottomless beverages' and digesting your basket-served meals, there was no one to blame but yourself.

Now, call me an old misery guts but I somehow managed to avoid all traces of fun at Chili's. That could be because I'm the sort of person who gets hung up worrying about whether the name of the outlet should have one or two 'l's or it could be because I dislike bad service and mediocre food - you decide.

Being a family restaurant - although the four hour long 'Happy Hours' hardly sit with this projected image - and us being a family it seemed a not completely inappropriate choice for a weekend lunch and the steady stream of other family units that joined us affirmed Chili's status as a KL favourite. Psychology students looking for a topic for their dissertation thesis might like to explore this popularity as potential evidence of KL-ites' inherent masochism.

The aforementioned and much heralded (in multi-coloured chalk no less) 'bottomless beverages' arrived to a fanfare of tickertape and popping champagne corks as gymnasts spring-boarded their way across the restaurant with a cavalcade of ribbons. Not really. They were placed drearily on the table. I won't comment on the fact they are served in plastic beakers. I assume it is to prevent us going too overboard on the fun (no, I still wasn't having any if you were wondering).

Big credit point for them bringing the children's meals first. In fact, there's only one other place in KL I know that does this without being asked. It makes a huge difference, allowing us to avoid hunger tantrums and also leave the adults free to enjoy their own meals after the kids are done.

Further kudos for the fact that these meals were free. Yes, that's right: kids eat free when an adult dines. That's really impressive, although also a somewhat cynical (if successful) marketing tool. To my mind 'family friendly' should be more about serving fresh, hearty food and allowing children the opportunity to interact with both friends and their dining environment rather than getting a couple of deep fried chicken nuggets gratis.

Having been denied the right to a medium-rare burger (not that great a sacrifice as my medium was cooked identically to my partner's well done) I was pleased that their beef was of good quality, very good given the price. Although the less said about the unspeakable accessories that came with it the better. I expected my 'Ranch Burger' to have earned its title through its Ranch Dressing. Still, I suppose Bland Barbecue Sauce and Stringy Old Lettuce Burger would be less catchy. And certainly less fun (no, still not).

As my eye glanced back at the sign to my left, I reflected on the word 'yet'. Maybe if we stayed long enough we would finally achieve this fun we'd heard so much about. The length of time the waiting staff took to bring our bill (we asked four members of staff before it arrived) suggested they were willing us on in this endeavour, but sadly it came before we so much as raised a smile.

Other Branches:

G10 Bangsar Shopping Complex, Jalan Maarof, Bukit Bandaraya, Bangsar, Kuala Lumpur, 59100;

3rd Floor, Suria KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, 50088

Lot G(E)12 Mid Valley Megamall, Mid Valley City, Lingkaran Syed Putra, Kuala Lumpur, 59200

content.short-description: A decent outlet that gets through a lot of covers (especially so in the tourist hotspot on Jalan P Ramlee) with all the...
content.description:
A decent outlet that gets through a lot of covers (especially so in the tourist hotspot on Jalan P Ramlee) with all the steaks, chimichangas, and other Latin American produce you would expect.  Maredo is  the perfect venue for dinner before heading out to enjoy the night scene on P.Ramlee. The menu caters to carnivore's cravings galore, with an extensive list featuring mainly beef dishes. Highly recommended is the Surf & Turf grilled strip loin steak which is tender and juicy to perfection. Order the medium rare for best results. In all, good lunch set deals, slightly pricey due to the bigger portions, and cute Argentinian flags in your meals.

Pork Free

Other Branches:

E-01-02 Plaza Mont Kiara, 2 Jalan Kiara, Mont Kiara, 50480 Kuala Lumpur

content.short-description: Don't be distracted by the other western offerings-even at special promotion-on the menu at Gaucho. As with any...
content.description: Don't be distracted by the other western offerings - even at special promotion - on the menu at Gaucho. As with any self-respecting authentic Argentinian restaurant, it's all about the steak. Quickly becoming a a hunt for those hankering for a satisfying steak meal, Gaucho's is famous for its tender and succulent cuts of fresh beef cooked to perfection. With its open fire and grilling, this is the quintessential place to enjoy beef the Argentinian way.The chefs know what their doing so be brave and go bloody. Don't forget to take advantage of the happy hours throughout the week, from six to eight thirty in the evening.

content.short-description: One of the upscale hotels in KL, Sheraton Imperial KL is owned by and is the largest and most global brand...
content.description:
One of the upscale hotels in KL, Sheraton Imperial KL is owned by and is the largest and most global brand of Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide, Inc., one of the leading hotel and leisure companies in the world.

For more information, please visit  sheraton.com/imperialkualalumpur

content.short-description: Secret of Lousiana offers authentic American cuisine using lots of Cajun spice. It's a solid restaurant with...
content.description:
Secret of Lousiana offers authentic American cuisine using lots of Cajun spice. Defined as Creole, the food is a spicy, substantial blend of French, Spanish, African, Italian and Caribbean, mixed up with other influences including Native American and German. Come and experience the lake side dining with water fountain as you enjoy gastronomic delights.

It's a solid restaurant with dishes including pizza, pasta, and rice beyond the standard Louisiana fare, all at reasonable prices. For appetizers and snacks, there's a choice of Bayou Crab, Creamy Seafood Gumbo, the Captain's Baked Oysters, or Cheesy Baked Escargots...mmm.

Look out for special promotions and set lunch deals.  Corporate function, annual dinner and all kinds of occasion are most welcome.

content.short-description: This unusual space is part of the Lake Club, the super exclusive haunt of Malaysia's elite. Adding Zinnia as a...
content.description: This unusual space is part of the Lake Club, the super exclusive haunt of Malaysia's elite. Adding Zinnia as a club in a members' only space is a gamble but manager Nanthan assures that 'drinks are a third of the price of outside and all you have to do is be friends with one of our 9,000 members'. Women will love this place.

content.short-description: With cool décor that pairs steel tension cables with various nuts and bolts, you can understand the significance behind...
content.description: With cool décor that pairs steel tension cables with various nuts and bolts, you can understand the significance behind the name; the initials did spell out 'Work in Progress' though since their makeover recently, the meaning has shifted to 'Whipped Into Place'. The food is great and cocktail list amazing; try a Bloody Mary topped with a liberal helping of celery and they don't skimp on the vodka or Tabasco either.

content.short-description: Urbanattic is edgy, vibrant and geared towards the city's growing alternative community. Live bands play almost...
content.description: Urbanattic is edgy, vibrant and geared towards the city's growing alternative community. Live bands play almost every night, making this venue a springboard for yet-undiscovered local talents. The reasonable prices draw crowds in for the house drinks as well. Come on Mondays for open mic night with the house band and all-night-long Happy Hour.

content.short-description: Solaris adds another club to its quiver by way of this half club/half bar haunt that has a moderate sized dance floor...
content.description: Solaris adds another club to its quiver by way of this half club/half bar haunt that has a moderate sized dance floor with a cool crowd. Some good DJs have spun there, DJ Nikki and others, but they've told us they're toning down on the electronic music. Okay, that may save a few shekels but be careful Spin Club, KL Klubbers expect to be entertained.

content.short-description: A steady fixture in the KL night scene for over ten years now, Souled Out remains a popular hangout spot...
content.description: A steady fixture in the KL night scene for over ten years now, Souled Out remains a popular hangout spot, especially among the city's youths. The extensive menu serves decent, uncomplicated grub and standard drinks but the steady crowd is mainly due to its energetic and lively atmosphere. Never empty, this is a busy hub for patrons to eat, drink, listen to live bands and play a game of football.

content.short-description: Situated in the lobby of Grand Millennium KL, you will see many good-looking ladies come in here. With...
