content.description: Situated in the lobby of Grand Millennium KL, you will see many good-looking ladies come in here. With a jazzy home band, you can swing to cool and funky tunes or get crazy with celebrity DJs. Sip their signature cocktails and enjoy a good variety of tapas.

content.short-description: Who doesnï¿½t know Planet Hollywood? Offering a piece of America in the heart of Asia. Located in the bustling street...
content.description: Who doesn't know Planet Hollywood? Offering a piece of America in the heart of Asia. Located in the bustling street of Bukit Bintang, you can't miss this place. Get together with locals, expats, and tourists to eat in here with local and foreign live band performances. Good ambience, good food, good music.

content.short-description: Constructed to a high acoustic standard, the auditorium has been the place where a lot of Malaysia's young and...
content.description: Their mission is to obtain the highest customer satisfaction by delivering service in a warm, friendly and exciting spirit. Located on the fourth floor of Wisma Bentley Music, this auditorium is really something to behold. Constructed to a high acoustic standard, the auditorium has been the place where many of Malaysia's young and upcoming indie musicians held their concert.

content.short-description: The perfect urban spot to lounge on couches and have a drink while watching the city drive by outside the...
content.description: The perfect urban spot to lounge on couches and have a drink while watching the city drive by outside the glass windows. Think baroque glamour with a twist, including fibre optic chandeliers. An ample dance space is also provided for the partygoers to move to the smooth beats of the house DJ.

content.short-description: This is the place to for traditional German cuisine and Riesling, imported from its origin. Located in the busy...
content.description: This is the place to for traditional German cuisine and Riesling, imported from its origin. Located in the busy streets of Bangsar, this is a real taste of Germany. Plus, this is the place to mingle with Germans residing in Malaysia.

content.short-description: As its name suggests, this pub and restaurant chain is just about as Irish as you can get. With several outlets...
content.description: As its name suggests, this pub and restaurant chain is just about as Irish as you can get. With several outlets scattered around KL, it is mostly a joint for the boys to watch the game and have a pint. Decent pub grub is also available for the peckish. Unpretentious, noisy and fun is the name of the game for this establishment.

content.short-description: A source of family fun, this bowling alley offers hours of entertainment with 38 state of the art bowling lanes. Upping...
content.description:
A source of family fun, this bowling alley offers hours of entertainment with 38 state of the art bowling lanes. Upping the enjoyment scale is the fact that these are all glow-in-the-dark, making it the first of its kind in Malaysia.

To sweeten the deal, it also offers promotions including Ladies Night on Wednesdays where ladies only pay RM5 per game. A girl can also bring two guests with her.

content.short-description: This club does not open at 11:15 or close at that time. The scene and décor here change frequently which can be...
content.description: This club does not open at 11:15 or close at that time. The scene and décor here change frequently which can be confusing. It is inspired by a schoolhouse, sports bar, and India. Despite the unique décor, Club 11:15 does offer some of the cheapest beer in town. On Thursdays, you will also meet a lot of women enjoying free wine until 10pm.

content.short-description: Located in downtown KL, get sinful and soulful with Centro every Saturdays for the ultimate party experience...
content.description: Located in downtown KL, get sinful and soulful with Centro every Saturdays for the ultimate party experience, complete with disco balls on the dance floor. Once you check in, you will not want to check out with music from R&B to house and electro.

content.short-description: This luxurious club in the basement of the Renaissance Hotel comes equipped with a glass surfaced dance floor...
content.description: This luxurious club in the basement of the Renaissance Hotel comes equipped with a glass surfaced dance floor. Prepare to dress up because they have a strict policy on dress code to keep up with the slick image. Happy hour (from 5pm-9pm on weekdays) throws out big discounts on drinks and attracts a diverse bunch of people.

content.short-description: A newly-refurbished nightspot tucked away in a shopping mall away from the city centre. Bar Celona draws a strong...
content.description: A newly-refurbished nightspot tucked away in a shopping mall away from the city centre. Bar Celona draws a strong crowd of young partygoers almost every night of the week. Music mostly consists of R&B and the partying rarely peters down before closing time. On Ladies Night, girls coming in groups of five or more are entitled to a free bottle of vodka.

content.short-description: The decor of this aptly named club is made of bamboo. The sleek black walls, printed windows, cushions and red...
content.description: The decor of this aptly named club is made of bamboo. The sleek black walls, printed windows, cushions and red oriental detail make this sexy club a great place to party. And to top it off, the open-air club section treats you to a breath of fresh air.

content.short-description: Cool and comfortable, the Apartment offers urbanites a large, loft-style space to unwind in. In addition to a wide...
content.description:
Chic and comfortable, the Apartment offers urban living for KL urbanies - a large, loft-style space to unwind in.  Very cool concept; you can eat in the bedroom, the library or even the shower.

In addition to a wide selection of beer and cocktails, it also serves up fusion food; clams or mussels 'Apartment Style', the tenderloin steak and the baked fish were all delicious.  However, non-alcoholic drinks can be highly priced. Every Friday and Saturday, the KLCC outlet plays host to live acoustic sessions by local performers. Happy Hour at this outlet is from 2pm to 5pm daily, with prices starting from just RM10.

content.short-description: e@Curve, located just beside the Curve is an entertainment mall. Cineleisure and an arcade is available at e@Curve!
content.description: e@Curve, located just beside the Curve is an entertainment mall. Cineleisure and an arcade is available at e@Curve! The place where you can shop and enjoy entertainment at the same time.

content.short-description: connected directly with the sophisticated KL Sentral railway hub. Kuala Lumpur, as Malaysia's capital city, is a centre for..
content.description:
Connected directly with the sophisticated KL Sentral railway hub. Kuala Lumpur, as Malaysia's capital city, is a centre for cultural activities and appreciation of arts, as seen in the historical National Museum, spacious Philharmonic Hall and innovative National Theater. Hence, discover all the contemporary attractions and historical charms of KL through your stay in Le Meridien Kuala Lumpur, which can be reached by a short train journey from the airport or any point in the city.

The Le Meridien offers 11 sophisticated meeting rooms, creating the perfect venue for events. Meanwhile, energize your body at our outstanding fitness center or take a dip in our distinctly refreshing swimming pool. As you retire to your well-appointed guest room, enjoy the modern amenities and breathtaking panoramas from the windows which will stimulate your senses and give you an exhillirating atmosphere.

The Le Meridien Kuala Lumpur is just minutes away from famous places in the city, such as the Mid Valley Shopping Center, Merdeka Square and Central Market. Take a jog around the lush greenery of the Lake Garden where gentle streams meander or marvel at avian creatures along winding pathways of the world's largest bird park. An unforgettable fusion of glittering skyscrapers and enthralling sights await you from the Le Meridien Kuala Lumpur.

content.short-description: Mandarin Oriental Kuala Lumpur offers guests the luxury of a superb spa and leisure facilities in the city centre...
content.description: Mandarin Oriental Kuala Lumpur offers guests the luxury of a superb spa and leisure facilities in the city centre. With its prime location between the flowering gardens of KLCC Park and the soaring heights of the Petronas Twin Towers, this hotel also has the most impressive views in the city.

content.short-description: The Gallery @ Starhill engages diverse audiences in powerful experience of artistic invention and serves as a...
content.description:
The Gallery @ Starhill engages diverse audiences in powerful experience of artistic invention and serves as a catalyst for the creation of new works that inspires and challenges. The Gallery "knows" that art is important as looking at art can provide a much needed refuge for reflection, sympathy, quietude, inspiration, and even ecstasy in this increasingly chaotic world. Looking further can deepen knowledge of cultures and artistic practice, develop and hone observational skills, reveal insights into history that other documents can't, and encourage creative, analytical, and autonomous thinking.

Art can be funny, and it can make you cry, too. Having all these in mind, The Gallery dedicates to the promotion of Malaysian contemporary artists. Exhibitions are being organized at regular interval throughout the year for artists to showcase their new works, a wellspring for them.

content.short-description: IKEA offers everything under one roof; everything you need to complete your home. With furniture like sofas, beds...
content.description:
IKEA offers everything under one roof; everything you need to complete your home. With furniture like sofas, beds, tables, wardrobes to soft furnishings like curtains, bedsheets, towels, and rugs to any accessories for your kitchen, bedroom and bathroom to lightings, vases, plants, posters, frames and more.

The IKEA store at Mutiara Damansara, Petaling Jaya is painted with the signature colours of blue and yellow, has two shopping floors and two floors with a very user-friendly car park. Sprawled across 36,000 sq. meters, it's more than four times bigger than the previous store, and has over 6,500 products making you spoilt with choices.

All that space means that visitors to IKEA can whet their interior decorating appetites on more than 50 roomsets. These roomsets feature functional and realistic home furnishing ideas using its wide range of products.

content.short-description: Safely located away from KL's busy streets, 7atenine provides a relaxed and elegant Mecca for the chic to escape...
content.description:
Surely it must be an unarguable, incontrovertible, Darwinian fact that if 'it ain't broke, don't fix it'. When international designer Ed Poole tells us about 7atenine's new facelift, we are a little skeptical. We have high standards when it comes to our drinking spots; if functionality and design can come together to form a perfect union that is chic and stylish, all the better. There are things that do stand out and the Big Ass Fan is one of them. It is exactly what it sounds like and apart from the fact that it's impressively massive, there's nothing much else to say.

We do, however, applaud the new flower-shaped bar (it revamps the traditional bar counter so you no longer have your back to the room) as it makes it a hell of a lot easier to get the bartender's attention… which is the whole point, really. The new lighting system has 16 million colours at its disposal; not noticeable to my naked eye but very cool nonetheless. 7atenine's draw has always been its lovely open-air ambience - all these new enhancements and design features do nothing to detract from or add to it.

Syazlynia Rahim

content.short-description: Sprawling over 1.7 million square feet with 253,000 sq feet of exhibition space, Putra World Trade Centre is...
content.description: Sprawling over 1.7 million square feet with 253,000 sq feet of exhibition space, Putra World Trade Centre (PWTC) is known for its high levels of personal service and a flexible approach to event management, making it popular with event organisers and meeting planners alike.

content.short-description: Dubrovnik is a quaint European restaurant located at Solaris, Mont Kiara that simply exudes a truly...
content.description:
Dubrovnik is a quaint European restaurant located at Solaris, Mont Kiara that simply exudes a truly unique chic dinning experience with wholesome food for you and your family. From hand- made pasta to the bread baked daily in a wood fire oven, this quest for excellence in food preparation demands perfection and authenticity in the culinary offerings.

Dubrovnik just spells great home cooked cuisine at its best, leaving you truly wanting for more. A lot of attention and detail is given to food preparation and to the choosing of the freshest of products, combining rustic, home-made dishes with the modern cuisine accomplishments.

The menu is unabashedly traditional yet refreshingly different without the artifices of 'fusion'. The pastry section showcases exquisite mouth watering desserts which complete the menu in true perfection.

Everyone who dines at Dubrovnik will love the ambiance which evokes the authentic feel of being in the medieval city on the Adriatic coast. The only Croatian restaurant in Malaysia, and probably the only one in Southeast Asia, Dubrovnik is definitely very different from the typical Western restaurants.

content.short-description: Laila's Cafe and Lounge is a modern day concept of a "home away from home" feel of where customers and friends...
content.description:
Laila's Cafe and Lounge is situated in Plaza Kelana Jaya, beside the Kelana Jaya lake. It has a modern day concept of a "home away from home" feel of where they try and give their customers and friends the ambiance of being in a home environment.

They serve home-cooked meals, with the delicious taste of Madam Lee's chicken pong teh, Vee's devil curry, Laila's fish & chips among the taste that really unforgettable. There's nothing like sitting in the alfresco area, having a cold one and watching the sun-set beam across the lake.

Bring the family over and not worry about nicotine-filled environment as it is a non-smoking cafe.

For music lovers, Laila also provides acoustic live performances on various nights of the week. Those that like to perform at Laila's Cafe and Lounge, please contact Ramesh at 012 292 8096 or ramesh.vadiveloo@gmail.com

content.short-description: An independent art space consisting of a gallery and studio facilities. It is located in Ampang, Kuala Lumpur....
content.description:
House Of Matahati (HOM) is an independent art space consisting of a gallery and studio facilities. It is located in Ampang, Kuala Lumpur.

Established in 2007, it is an artist-run initiative to provide a venue for events conducive to the development of local and regional art activities. One of House of Matahati core objectives is to promote and nurture emerging artists through its Matahati Art Residency programme.

content.short-description: Innovative and spacious, Quattro is made up out of four outlets, each themed after one of the four seasons...
content.description:
Innovative and spacious, Quattro is made up out of four outlets, each themed after one of the four seasons. The establishment copies Mother Nature as best as it can, incorporating a miniscule 'snowing room' and a dripping wet corridor to 'rain' on partygoers, all in the name of fun.

The al fresco Spring Lounge fares best with its kitschy furnishings and view of the Twin Towers. It is also one of the only venues in KL that sells absinthe.

content.short-description: Mist caters towards the young urban set. The DJs ensure a good time almost every night, and the black...
content.description: Mist caters towards the young urban set. The DJs ensure a good time almost every night, and the black leather seats , pulsating lights and stark metal ceiling beams lend a punk edge to the atmosphere. Artists at Mist in the past have included Lil Jon. Recently, Mist has also started expanding beyond the nightlife scene by housing events like a clothes sale and fashion show.

content.short-description: It may not be the biggest nightspotaround, but Cynna's relative small space means it also gets to...
content.description: It may not be the biggest nightspotaround, but Cynna's relative small space means it also gets to provide a sensuos and more intimate clubbing experience. Its upstairs location adds to its air of exclusivity and the outdoor terrace is perfect for a breather between dances. The constant crowd, even on weekdays, is proof of its ability to hold its won amid the other, bigger clubs.

content.short-description: Less a club than a venue for killer EDM acts, this place is a godsend for the scene taking back the moribund...
content.description: Less a club than a venue  for killer EDM acts, this place is a godsend for the scene taking back the moribund Ruums locale. a 4,000 capacity space, KL Live has hosted a string of great electronica including Basement Jaxx, 2many Djs, Axwell and others.

content.short-description: Nerofico is one of KL's newest jazz venue showcasing the best local, regional and international musical talent ...
content.description:
Nerofico is one of KL's newest jazz venue showcasing the best local, regional and international musical talent every Friday and Saturday nights (first set starts at 10pm).

Following a major makeover, Fico has become a true listening room and a fabulous space in which to appreciate live music. At Fico you will enjoy a special experience: jazz of the highest standard, a unique environment and gorgeous Italian food.

content.short-description: This Chinese-themed but very cosmopolitan bar has one of the best wine lists in town, and an excellent bistro. With private...
content.description: This Chinese-themed but very cosmopolitan bar has one of the best wine lists in town, and an excellent bistro. With private areas for wining, dining and relaxing, this makes for a chilled night in the city.

content.short-description: Let's just get to the point on this one without any ado; it is amazing, simply beautiful, one of the best new clubs in recent...
content.description: Let's just get to the point on this one without any ado; it is amazing, simply beautiful, one of the best new clubs in recent years. First the location, on the sixth floor of the Gardens with a great inside and outside view of the Mid Valley area. The interior is a stunner, cool and fluid with the perfect sense of style and differentiated covey holes to hang and explore. Aye Caramba, this place will be huge.

content.short-description: The Actors Studio was set up in April of 1989 by husband and wife team Joe Hasham and Dato' Faridah Merican with the following...
content.description:
Just seven months after it closed down its popular theatre in Bangsar Shopping Centre, The Actors Studio will be moving into its spanking new theatre on the rooftop of Lot 10 Shopping Centre.

This all-new theatre is nestled amid overhanging foliage and other greenery that is part of the rooftop's Forest in the City concept (yet another genius idea by Seksan). The chic and minimalist interior gives it a warm and inviting atmosphere.

Without a doubt, the star of the theatre is its dramatic Hanamichi-thrust stage  the first of its kind in the country. Those familiar with Kabuki will recognise its T-shape formation although the thrust section is much wider than the traditional Hanamichi. That coupled with its three-sided, bench style seating makes it an intimate yet exciting space that will open up new staging possibilities.

What's even more exciting than the theatre's unique design is its location right in the heart of town. It is merely a stone's throw from the monorail station and countless F&B outlets!

content.short-description: Swiss-Garden International Hotels, Resorts & Inns distinctive style of service is a reflection of our commitment to...
content.description:
Swiss-Garden International Hotels, Resorts & Inns distinctive style of service is a reflection of our commitment to a refined travel experience.

Ideally located in prime destinations in Malaysia and Australia, our brand exudes the warm hospitality that makes us truly exceptional, which is attributed to our quest to attain service excellence.

From bustling cities to pristine beaches, our group of hotels blends contemporary style with natural elements while providing discerning travelers an assortment of activities from an award-winning golf course, Spa experiences to exquisite cuisine.

content.short-description: If you are a food and karaoke freak, why don't you try Neway Karaoke in Cheras. While singing new and hip songs, you can...
content.description:
If you are a food and karaoke freak, why don't you try Neway Karaoke in Cheras. While singing new and hip songs, you can feast on some great food in here. They also offer additional discounts to members. At lunch time, you only pay for the food and sing for 3 hours, free! Isn't that delightful?

Neway is also available in :

No.04-85, 04-86, Level 4,
Berjaya Times Square
No. 1, Jalan Imbi,
55100 Kuala Lumpur

Lot EZ 502, 5th & 6th Floor
1 Utama Shopping Centre
No. 8, Dataran Bandar Utama
Bandar Utama, 47800 PJ

4th Floor, Jaya Square,
Lot 7343, Jalan SS 17/2,
47500 Subang Jaya,
Selangor Darul Ehsan.

2nd & 3rd Floor, Casa Square,
No. 1, Jalan Kenari 12,
Bandar Puchong Jaya,
47100 Puchong,
Selangor Darul Ehsan.

content.short-description: The much anticipated Sunway-located Opera finally had its soft launch and we were there to witness what all the fuss is about. Three...
content.description: The much anticipated Sunway-located Opera finally had its soft launch and we were there to witness what all the fuss is about. Three stories high with a centre area that's used for circus acts, Opera is really something different and unique on the clubbing scene.

content.short-description: Hotel Maluri offers 238 modern and trendy rooms accommodation ranging from Kayangan Suite, Impian Suite, Family Suite...
content.description:
Strategically located within the vicinity of city centre in Kuala Lumpur for business or leisure travelers, the hotel has successfully completed the refurbishment and has transformed to a boutique hotel.

The hotel is located 10 minutes away from KLCC, 5 minutes breeze walking distance to Jusco shopping mall and the famous eateries (Google Map).

Hotel Maluri offers 238 modern and trendy rooms accommodation ranging from Kayangan Suite, Impian Suite, Family Suite, Deluxe & Standard rooms with reasonable rates. All rooms are well equipped with newest amenities to make your stay with us a comfortable one and guest will experience the Malaysian hospitality provided by the newly revamped establishment.

For your meetings in Kuala Lumpur, the hotel offers a wide range of Banquet facilities newly refurbished pillar less ballroom and meeting rooms catering to different types of set up to suit your requirements. The ballroom is able to cater up to 320 person fully supported by a well equipped business centre and latest audio visual facilities including fast speed broadband internet connectivity.

content.short-description: Rewarding meetings and events happen at our hotel's contemporary function venues and conference centre. This includes the Westin...
content.description:
The Westin Kuala Lumpur Hotel is the epitome of personal renewal, a contemporary five star hotel located in Kuala Lumpur's bustling Jalan Bukit Bintang.

All 443 guest rooms, including 23 suites and 63 one-bedroom and two-bedroom Executive Residences, feature the plush, all-white signature Heavenly Bed®. The Heavenly Shower®, available exclusively at our Executive Residences, will restore your mind and body.

Rewarding meetings and events happen at our hotel's contemporary function venues and conference centre. This includes the Westin Grand Ballroom with Martin Architectural Lighting for an extensive variety of lighting effects and customised projections. Business travellers will appreciate the business centre and Executive Club Lounge.

Rejuvenate with a few laps in our outdoor pool at Splash. Then replenish at one of our six innovative dining options, including Pan Asian at EEST, a Cuban bar and Latin grill at Qba, and authentic Italian at Prego.

For recreation, enjoy our WestinWORKOUT® Gym and Westin Kids Club®. Service Express® and Westin One Call® allow you to experience an unrivalled level of personalised service, where every request can be made with one call.

Experience customised renewal experiences that allow you to feel rested, energised, enriched, and renewed at The Westin Kuala Lumpur.

content.short-description: In a city inundated by budget-conscious, meat-loving punters, it's a brave move to open an haute cuisine, let alone fish-driven...
content.description:
Time Out rating: 4/5
It's all good


In a city inundated by budget-conscious, meat-loving punters, it's a brave move to open an haute cuisine, let alone fish-driven, restaurant. But the team behind Nero Vivo has done just that, and even though it's a bit premature to predict whether or not they will strike culinary payola, the early signs show that KL-ites are going for it hook, line and sinker.

Don't get me wrong, it's not as if it's never been done before: Kingfisher back in the late '90s (the restaurant, not the dodgy Indian pub) was a pioneer, not just in paving the way for the phenom that is now Changkat Bukit Bintang, but also with a menu that was intrepidly fish-centric and characterised by sparkling, nourishing flavours. With the exception of perhaps Pacifica at Mandarin Oriental, High Tide's arrival on the scene, well, let's just say it was High Time.

Helmed by Belgian chef Evert Onderbeke, the menu comprises "fresh, seasonal and sustainably caught seafood" which, apart from ensuring diners never get bored of the same food (if they can afford to eat there on a regular basis, that is), should be a delicious way for Malaysians to get acquainted with such lesser known seafood as roughy, king fish and marron.

Because the seafood is flown in from Europe, Australia and even Japan on a daily basis, the cost — let alone the carbon credits — incurred in getting the fish on your dinner plate is substantial. But what price such exquisite cuisine? Whether it's a simple vegetable ravioli with black winter truffles in a shitake emulsion (moist, ephemeral, memorable) or a more elaborate sole in bouillabaisse broth with rouille and croutons (a virtuoso exercise in textural and taste combinations) you're tucking into, the attention to detail, the presentation, and culinary expertise are all irreproachable, and ample vindication for the substantial price tags.

And here are three more reasons just for good measure: 1) The spectacularly delicious complimentary amuses-bouches (velvety soups in shot glasses and paradisical seafood morsels) and post-prandial petits-fours (the fig cream cannelloni is magical) 2) The superb service by manager Carole Pinel, and 3) The unmistakeable sense of well being that follows such a memorable dining experience.

With so many of the city's restaurants bogged down by a sense of sameness, High Tide's food provides a salubrious blast of originality to jaded palates, and quite apart from the dietary benefits of 'free-range' fish cooked at its prime, I can say — for myself, at least — that High Tide is a sterling example of the philosophy that 'if a job's worth doing, it's worth doing well.' Three cheers.

Lunch and dinner daily except  Mondays

content.short-description: Culti is not a fashion brand but promotes a high-end 'holistic' lifestyle, as it prefers to be known. Judging by its price tag, buying...
content.description:
Culti is not a fashion brand but promotes a high-end 'holistic' lifestyle, as it prefers to be known. Judging by its price tag, buying into the brand is definitely a sign that you've made your riches, as everything in the store costs hundreds. Whether it's home fragrances, pyjamas, bathrobes or home furnishing products, you can be assured of quality, well-made products resplendent in minimalist styles. These are goods that'll outlast trends.

Among the lot, Culti excels with its range of cotton-linen pantsuit styles (RM1,200) pyjamas. When wearing one, it does feel light and luxurious on skin. Although I don't want to wear it for sleep, as I'm rather rough with my clothes. Maybe Culti's range of bathrobes (RM800-900), also made from cotton and linen, would be more suitable, as they're supple enough to be used with careless abandon.

Culti's home fragrances, however, are recommended. Try the Mareminerale (RM300-500 for half litre), made from sea salt minerals and musk, and producing an overall refreshing scent. Ideal to spray on your home's sofa, bed sheets, curtains and even your clothing. Granted this home fragrance costs more than most of the choices available elsewhere in KL, but it really is some quality stuff, one which will leave a nice lingering scent for a long time.

content.short-description: One thing first: I'm a waxing virgin. Aside from a few mishaps with birthday cakes, not a drop of wax has this body seen, so it was...
content.description:
One thing first: I'm a waxing virgin. Aside from a few mishaps with birthday cakes, not a drop of wax has this body seen, so it was with some trepidation that I approached my first date with the hot liquid at Honeypot Wax Boutique. It's only been open a few months but already garnered its fair share of positive reviews and Brazilian-enthusiasts, so here I was dispatched to put my body on the line and test the waters and mix metaphors.

The good news: Honeypot really does deserve the acclaim it's been getting. The bad: due to my well-documented cowardice, I didn't go the whole hog and get a Brazilian wax, but stuck to my genteel guns with a leg wax. My waxer (a great job title, if there was ever one) swiftly put my mind to rest regarding the pain factor, assuring me that it was nothing like as painful as most newbies imagine, just possibly a little uncomfortable.

She then instructed me to lie down and relax as she inspected my legs (always a hard time for a girl). What comforted me the most about the whole affair was when she pointed out two scars on my knee and ankle respectively and asked if they were recent developments and if they were still painful, explaining that they don't touch just healed scars. It's nice to know that someone with the responsibility of covering your skin in hot wax knows what she's doing.

The waxing itself was uneventful, and after I'd got over the initial shock of having warm wax rolled onto my shins and then pulled off, I began to unwind a little. I still wouldn't say it's a relaxing way to spend an afternoon, having hair ripped out of your skin, but as banal as it sounds, it really isn't that painful.

Honeypot also does a remarkable job of calming the senses with its predominantly pink décor, dim chandelier lighting and lovely scented wax. They use a strawberry wax for general waxing and a cherry wax for more sensitive areas - given how nice the strawberry smelt, I'm almost tempted to return to test out the cherry. Baby steps.

content.short-description: Located at Sunrise Mont'Kiara Integrated Global Village is Sunrise Berhad's first commercial-retail development. Its unique concept...
content.description:
Plaza Mont Kiara resort office is located at Sunrise Mont'Kiara Integrated Global Village is Sunrise Berhad's first commercial-retail development. Its unique concept of combining an office complex with resort-like facilities paves the way for a new business lifestyle.

The plaza's strategic location between Kenny Hills and Damansara Heights will release you from the hassle of traffic jams. Parking will not be a dilemma either, simply because there are more than 1,500 covered parking bays available.

A necklace of restaurants in a U-shape formation surrounding the fountain courtyard.Clark Hatch Fitness Centre's regional headquarters is also located right here in Plaza Mont'Kiara. You can jump start your day with a great workout or even de-stress later after office hours with a nice hot sauna or a swim in the heated pool.

Retail outlets, including a supermarket located at Wisma Sunrise (Block E), make it even more convenient to pick up some last minute grocery or household items.

content.short-description: MBA was incorporated in year 2001. Its first centre consisting of 16 indoor-badminton courts at Taman Megah, Petaling Jaya...
content.description:
MBA was incorporated in year 2001. Its first centre consisting of 16 indoor-badminton courts at Taman Megah, Petaling Jaya was officially opened by a former Prime Minister's wife, Tun Dr. Siti Hasmah on February 2002.

Tun Dr. Siti Hasmah, who was also the patron of the Badminton Association of Malaysia (BAM) together with former Thomas Cuppers - Razif Sidek, Cheah Soon Kit and James Selvaraj were impressed with the courts and related facilities of the biggest privately owned multi-badminton courts centre in the state.

This badminton centre at Bandar Puteri Puchong consists of 32 indoor-badminton courts with facilities to accommodate major national and international tournaments / training was fully functional on September 2004. This centre has been officially recognized as the Biggest Indoor-Badminton Centre in the country by the Malaysian Book of Records.

content.short-description: Putrajaya Water Sports Complex is located at the centre of Putrajaya city, Malaysia. Similar to Putrajaya Lake, it is designed to act...
content.description: Putrajaya Water Sports Complex is located at the centre of Putrajaya city, Malaysia. Similar to Putrajaya Lake, it is designed to act as a natural cooling system for the city and also for recreation, water sports and water transport. This water sport complex has been explored for so many times in hosting the sports events locally and internationally.

content.short-description: PARKROYAL Penang, Malaysia is located on the north-western coast of Penang Island (Pulau Pinang), alongside Batu Ferringhi beach...
content.description:
Parkroyal Penang, Malaysia is located on the north-western coast of Penang Island , alongside Batu Ferringhi beach. The hotel is just 17 kilometres from Georgetown and 31 kilometres from Penang Airport. Penang Island is linked to the mainland by the Penang Bridge spanning 13.5 kilometres across the channel.

Its location along the shoreline allows it to function as a hotel and beach resort in Penang, offering guests the best of both worlds. The chief attractions of the island that houses Parkroyal Penang are its pristine and plentiful beaches, a diverse local culture and heritage and some of the finest seafood that Malaysia is famous for. For shopaholics, the island also offers some fine shopping districts.

content.short-description: A must-have at Pepes is ayam pop, chicken simmered in a complex brew of ginger, garlic and chilli powder, then crowned...
content.description:
A must-have at Pepes is ayam pop, chicken simmered in a complex brew of ginger, garlic and chilli powder, then crowned with cut chillis and chopped onions.

Kepala ikan, fish head bathed in a piquant yet sweet-and-tangy, assam-based broth, is another very enjoyable dish for those who prefer a coconut milk-free alternative to fish head curry. use of MSG is avoided whenever possible, an alternative is used in place of palm oil and the cooks also make an effort to drain off excess oil.

content.short-description: Decked out in curved wood panelling, B3 looks like a cross between a Tokyo subway station and a comfy log cabin. the classic...
content.description:
Decked out in curved wood panelling, B3 looks like a cross between a Tokyo subway station and a comfy log cabin. the classic cheeseburger is a juicy pink patty enveloped in a blanket of soft, caramelised onions.

The sesame butterfish burger had a slightly wet texture, but the wasabi mayo gave it a kick worth savouring. Ingredients for the ice cream were back in stock, so the meal ended on a sweet note: the rich, home-made dark chocolate soft serve, a real treat that made a refreshing change from uniform vanilla or chocolate.

With the latest addition to his canon of eateries, Low's B3 is a prime example of the new breed of express-class restaurants that haven't sacrificed freshness in their bid to emphasise taste and quality.

content.short-description: Reservations are still made way in advance to secure a spot at this award-winning restaurant. Old favourites like the multi...
content.description: Reservations are still made way in advance to secure a spot at this award-winning restaurant. Old favourites like the multi-textured sakura ebi cappellini with konbu, and the signature burger with the intense truffle and sabayon sauce, make this modern European eatery well worth the splurge.

content.short-description: I don't think highly of buffets. I tend to believe that they are put together with whatever that's left...
content.description:
I don't think highly of buffets. I tend to believe that they are put together with whatever that's left over in the kitchen from the night before mixed with whatever's going to expire soon. That's just me - cynical. Imagine my surprise when I walked into DISH's new Brilliant Brunch (which comes with free flow of Verve Cliquot champagne) and discovered that the spread read like a gourmet menu.

For once, in a buffet, I felt like a kid in a candy store; I felt hungry and greedy and gluttony. I wanted everything. There was an extensive chilled seafood spread of tiger prawns, salmon sashimi, crabs and freshly shucked oysters. The live cooking egg station could whip up a hot fluffy omelette filled with turkey ham, mushrooms, peppers, cheese and yes, even lobster. The carving station was decked out with roast prime beef rib and roast chicken, while the BBQ station had all the variety of meat cuts, fish, squid and ocean trout. On top of all that, you have the cheese, pasta, salad and antipasti, fruit and juice, sundae, and dessert stations.

My advice is to take everything in sampling portions and have the pan seared foie gras with Muscat dressing in between every dish. It's that good. The fact that it's cut into small canapé-size pieces means you only get enough to tease your palate but never enough to satisfy the craving if you are a fan like me. And since it's cooked upon order, you get that buttery texture melting warmly in your mouth. The scallop on shell with herbed dressing is light and fresh while the mozzarella, tomato and basil skewer provides a nice mix of tasty flavours in your mouth all at once. Just remember to wash them down with champagne.

While most of the dishes were well done, it was the desserts that really stood out for me. The earl grey cream managed to be a little on the heavy side without making you jelak, thanks to the tea infusion. And the three different varieties of truffles - green tea, homemade chocolate and white chocolate blue cheese (I know what you think but it works - strangely) - are so soft, smooth and velvety when your mouth closes around them.

Another good thing about the spread is a lot of the things are made to order, such as the pasta and the salads and the yummy foie gras. So it felt less like a buffet and more like a kitchen at your beck and call. Despite the decadent food, the setting managed to remain casual and relaxing without becoming too high brow and intimidating. It had an anything goes attitude in here. And partly because the restaurant shares the same space with fine food deli and a florist, the ambience was lively and fun, which made for a leisurely and really enjoyable Sunday outing.

Excessive? Maybe. But DISH aims to be unabashedly decadent and they do that very well with this champagne brunch. So, pardon my over zealous enthusiasm but with all that bubbly swimming in my tummy, I can't see how I can not be, well, bubbly.

4/5 star


The Time Out Food 40 is our regular definitive guide on where to eat in the Klang Valley. Establishments will only appear in the TOKL Food 40 if they rank amongst the best and most satisfying dining experiences according to our team of independent, honest and experienced food critics.

content.short-description: In conjunction with the beauty parlour's 21st anniversary, Adonis is giving away a 21 per cent discount for all...
content.description:
It's all about '21' this month at Adonis. In conjunction with the beauty parlour's 21st anniversary, Adonis is giving away a 21 per cent discount for all professional treatments and premium facial products on the 21st of March. For first trial, the permanent hair removal service only costs RM98 while the 7 Haven Chakra + Hydrating Facial is offered at RM180 instead of the usual RM430. For a fresher-looking skin, try the AD Facial only at RM98.

Adonis Sungai Wang Plaza (03 2143 6868)

Pavillion KL (03 2143 3355

This offer until 31 Mar 2010

content.short-description: Pamper yourself with a rejuvenating body spa at 128 Faubourg, a sister subsidiary company of SOTHYS France...
content.description:
128 Faubourg, Salon by SOTHYS. Pamper yourself with a rejuvenating body spa at 128 Faubourg, a sister subsidiary company of SOTHYS France. The salon offers services such as body exfoliation, mud wraps, massage with essential oil, slimming and firming treatments, waxing, eyelash perming, manicure, pedicure and make-up service. Starting from Jan to June, 128 Faubourg will select two winners (one male & one female respectively) to go on a 5D/ 4N trip in Paris. Shoppers must spend a minimum of RM800 in a single receipt to be selected.

Bangsar Village II (03 2287 8128, No. 2, Jalan Telawi Satu, Bangsar Baru, 59100 KL)

1 Utama (03 7726 1280,
No 1, Persiaran Bandar Utama, Bandar Utama, 47800 Petaling Jaya, Selangor)

content.short-description: Shanghai tang, a classy fashion and accessories outlet in Pavilion has just launched its latest fashion collection "Love Restraint"...
content.description:
Shanghai Tang, a classy fashion and accessories outlet in Pavilion has just launched its latest fashion collection "Love Restraint". Mainly inspired by fashion style and trend of the sixties in Hong Kong, particularly from the movie "In the Mood for Love", trendy combined with op-art which emphasises on a rejuvenation of the geometric graphics of op-art with a new sense of modern fluidity as seen on delicate silk blouses with optic clouds print and silk jacquard trench coat with optical illusions of waves in motion. Shanghai Tang caters to the urbanite male, female and children with its exclusive brands in fashion wear, jewellery items, accessories, leather wear and goods, Chinese jades selection, silk, just to name a few.

Shanghai Tang originates from China and boasts itself as the first and leading luxury lifestyle brand since 1994. It promotes and supports the fusion of modern Chinese Chic with current design concepts emphasizing on innovative Sino related elements.

Shanghai Tang through its international network of 40 boutiques located in the world's most prestigious shopping district, offers ready-to-wear for both men and women and children, including accessories and home ware. The Malaysian outlet is at Pavilion KL. Based on my personal observation, Shanghai Tang is aggressively promoting expressions of past Chinese glory combined with modern elements as evidenced in its fashion wear, accessories and home ware, which compliment each other.

Shanghai Tang Boutique is situated on Level three, Pavilion KL.

content.short-description: Spa treatments are good in that they provide a temporary, relaxing respite from your daily chores and stress...
content.description:
Spa treatments are good in that they provide a temporary, relaxing respite from your daily chores and stress. But massage, a good massage, is truly remedial. That I have learned from Donna Spa. I was having a bad week. I was lethargic and to make it worse, I didn't sleep well at all. My therapist Ina, who's from Central Java, seemed to have that figured out.

The 90-minute Excellent Donna Massage that I have chosen as part of the Value Spa Scrub Package is easily the best massage I've had in KL. Using long strokes, Ina worked on the acupressure points to expel wind from my body while stimulating healthy blood circulation. 'Ini mesti sentiasa duduk,' she said while massaging two tensed knots on my lower back to break them up. 'Banyak main computer ya?' she asked, though it sounded more like a statement when she worked on the even more tensed shoulders.

Then she spotted a stubborn knot ('urat simpul,' she explained) at the lower back of my head. As she was massaging that, she explained to me that the wind in my body, which accumulated at my lower back and shoulders, manifested into tensed, hard knots. If not treated, the wind can move up to my head and cause headaches and migraines.

Wind can also lead to a tired and weak body, and affect sleep. Usually I like my massages conversation free but this time, I kept asking her questions and found it fascinating that she could tell so much from just massaging my body and more interestingly, that she could tell that a particular spot would hurt even before I felt it.

As she slowly loosened up my incredibly tense and tired body, I could feel my body getting more relaxed, and I was now craving a long sleep. Ina comes from a generation of mid wives, where they administer this deep-tissue traditional Javanese massage, or at least a variation of it, to strengthen the body and improve the immune system of mothers who have just delivered.

The two-hour Value Spa Scrub Package came with a coffee scrub (using coffee powder imported from India) to smoothen the skin. Feeling really decadent, I topped up for a rose petal milk bath (RM220) to rehydrate my dry skin. The air soon permeated with the delicious aroma of milk coffee, which made me smile.

Yet more than the spacious room and the oversized bathtub, the one thing I appreciate more was that throughout the treatment, I was lying on a comfortably warm heat blanket that covered the lower half of the massage bed. And that, as Ina explained, was very important as it prevented me from getting cold; else wind would get into my body, and end up causing more harm. Lim Chee Wah

content.short-description: While it's mostly true that you should never judge a book by its cover, sometimes it's doing precisely just that, that you must...
content.description:
Rating:3/5

While it is mostly true that you should never judge a book by its cover, sometimes it's doing precisely just that, that you must. If I had a dollar for every time I've walked into a restaurant that's given me the heebies and, hot on the heels of my reservations, the food turned out to be execrable, I probably wouldn't be writing to earn a living now. Luckily, the upside to that is sometimes you also come across little gems that you know will be 'keepers' the minute you step through the door. Mezze is one of them.

"Feels like I just entered a Melbourne eatery," my friend remarked when we visited. I know exactly what she meant. Melbourne is famous for cosy little bistros infused with eccentric charm that is mostly whimsical but nearly always original, and Mezze has that same charm in spades.

Naked lightbulbs with retro wiring are the focal point of the décor, and the effect is effortlessly striking. Co-owner Perin Petrus says the eatery/bar's raison d'etre is to serve as a venue for friends to get together and share memories and food. While I'm more than happy to share memories, I'm not so sure about the food, since the dishes at Mezze are generally — in the words of an enthusiastic chav — pretty lush.

The slow roasted pork belly with its cracking crackling is so good I'm considering another visit just to jog my memory, but its position as favoured starter was definitely challenged by the dreamily smooth duck liver pate with a texture that was almost aerated.

Although I'm wary of ordering mussels in Malaysia because more often than not it feels like I'm chewing on a small child's earlobe, Mezze's steamed mussels may well help me overcome my phobia. The tamarind, lemongrass, ginger, chilli and honey broth in which the mussels are served should be declared our Asian response to the moules mariniere. Adore, adore, adore. And though I'm not generally a dessert person, the panna cotta in all its quivering, acquiescent glory did it for me.

The downside is that as the area is becoming increasingly popular, parking can be challenging, especially on weekends, but since the wine list at Mezze is fairly priced and thoughtfully selected, you've got no business to be driving anyway. Take a cab and get there early.

content.short-description: An early weekend evening, the restaurant was quiet enough for us to earn the full attention...
content.description:
3.5 stars
Middle Eastern

Tarbush is an established name in KL when it comes to Middle Eastern food. Later this year they expect to open in Batu Feringghi, Penang, but our meal took place in the slightly more chic surrounds of Starhill Gallery's Feast Floor.

An early weekend evening, the restaurant was quiet enough for us to earn the full attention of the (apart from their insistence that we should require French fries as an appetizer) helpful team.

Eschewing the fries in favour of a variety of mezze dishes, we cleaned the plates in no time at all. The judging of any Lebanese or Arabic meal naturally affords much to the appetisers, and they were off to a good start. The hummus I normally prefer smoother and the serve of tahina was not the most generous, but otherwise the offerings were outstanding.

The lamb in the kibbeh was joined by tiny chopped onions and crammed with spice. I hadn't tasted any to this recipe before but it was superb. Worth going back for all on its own. Likewise the sambosa, which were a bit heavy for starters but full of taste. The vine leaves were also excellent and the falafel fresh, crispy and could only have been improved by being presented with more in the way of that tahina.

Having crammed so much food in at such an early stage we had to rein things in a bit. That meant sharing a portion of rice for main course and getting just one dish between us. But what a dish it was. The 'Tarbush Mixed Grill' included all their main meaty offerings, from Shish Tawook, a variety of kebabs, lamb chops and several of their arayes (spicy minced lamb). I find with most Arabic meals that the meat tends towards the overdone (frustratingly, the Greeks manage to get the balance right consistently in similar dishes) although Tarbush was better than most and the crispy, somewhat tough lamb and chicken was helped enormously by the evidently long period of marination the meat had enjoyed.

Given the huge numbers of Arabic tourists that come to KL, it is little surprise that the city has plenty of good Middle Eastern restaurants. Tarbush is, despite some small areas for improvement, clearly among the best.

content.short-description: Created to be a one-stop shop for homeware and gifts, Sash offers gifts scoured from all corners of the world...
content.description:
As you walk into Sash, you'll notice delicate traces of perfume in the air. Not overwhelming on the senses, these scents nicely mingle with each other in the store, ebbing and flowing depending on where you stand. The store is done up in the pastels of an English cottage, with a large French Provincial dining table showcasing some of the crystal and crockery available in the store.

Created to be a one-stop shop for homeware and gifts, Sash offers gifts scoured from all corners of the world: 100 per cent Egyptian cotton towel and bed sets, handstitched silk and velvet duvet covers from Italy, clear and coloured Polish crystal, crockery from Australia, Michel Design Works fragrance diffusers and soy wax candles from New York, as well as handmade natural vegetable and fruit soaps from Austria.

But for me, the star products are the 'Sweet Treats' range of bath and body care from the Australian eco-friendly company Urban Rituellle. The lip balm (RM32) comes in 18 different flavours, and is made with beeswax, sweet almond oil, olive oil, shea butter, vitamin E and sunscreen. The range also includes body cream (RM58) made with shea butter, jojoba, macadamia and avocado oils; creamy vegetable soap made from vegetable oil, cocoa butter and vitamin E; as well as candles (RM60) made using 100 per cent natural soy wax.

Also available is the Sweet Delights gift set (RM80), which comes in five different flavours - Vanilla, Ginger Apple, Pomegranate, Peach Blossom and Cotton Candy. Each set contains a 12ml perfume, a 100g creamy vegetable soap and a 20g lip balm. There is also a limited edition candy cane lip balm available for the Christmas season. Plus, their free wrapping service will blow any of your efforts with sellotape out of the water.

content.short-description: KL first allergy friendly yoga and dance studio for kids and adults.
content.description:
Just when we thought we'd seen enough yoga centres in KL, out comes Purple Yogis, which claims to be the first allergy friendly yoga and dance studio in the country. But it is the centre's special attention to children and some unusual yoga classes that got our attention.

The Kids Holistic Yoga (age four to 12) classes are run very differently to the adult ones. Here, the children literally play yoga. They are free to move about the room, take part in breathing games, make noises, act out stories and even pretend to be animals. While this may not sound like the composed and peaceful yoga that we know, Purple Yogis instructors believe that storytelling, games, music and art are the best ways to engage the hyperactive children. And through these playful but structured classes, children can develop better body awareness, concentration, coordination and balance.

For the adults, Purple Yogis has something equally fascinating. Apart from the usual Hatha and Vinyasa Yoga, there is the Slimming Yoga, which over the course of three months, teaches you techniques and postures to help detoxify the body and build up overall muscle strength. It is said to increase flexibility, improve vitality and even transform the way you look and feel about yourself.

Couples Loving Yoga is even more interesting. With poses like 'Couple's Lotus Pose', 'Couple's Turtle Pose' and 'Couple's Moon Triangle', we can't help but think of the Kamasutra. But before you start giggling like a teenager, let us assure you that this yoga is a great way to help you and your partner learn how to balance and work with each other's strengths and weaknesses. And by supporting each other through modified asana sequences, you will be able to move beyond any self-limiting ideas of what you can or cannot do.

But if all this is too new age for you, well, Purple Yogis also offers classes in break dance, hip hop, Bollywood jam and Cuban salsa. Oh, feel free to bring along your children and leave them to play in the Kid's Room while you work through your sun salutations.

content.short-description: Step into a different world when you walk past the door at Wondermilk..
content.description:
Step into a different world when you walk past the door at Wondermilk. With the lo-fi music playing in the background and an overall laidback vibe, the café is a charming escape from the hustle and bustle of the crowded city. Serving up a delightful selection of cupcakes, sandwiches and other light refreshments, the café has seen many working adults and college students biting into its too-pretty-to-eat cupcakes. Popular for bulk orders during special occasions you better order your cupcakes way ahead of time to avoid disappointment.

 

Wondermilk shop & cafeis a finalist in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009 Best Cafe/Bakery category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: known for its cosy calm café setting with a pretty white interior and a team of amiable staff who makes you feel really welcome..
content.description:
Formerly located at Asian Heritage Row, Bisou was known for its cosy calm café setting with a pretty white interior and a team of amiable staff who makes you feel really welcome. Now that they have moved to Bangsar Village, Bisou might not be as laidback as before but has kept its friendly staff and of course, the famed cupcakes. While the menu has been revamped to include plenty of new salads, paninis and soups, eliminating the less popular dishes, Banoffee Pie fans should heave a sigh of relief to know that the best-seller stays on.

Bisou is a finalist in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009 Best Cafe/Bakery category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: The cake counter at D'lish is always tempting...
content.description:
Delicious' little sister D'lish is out with a new menu, veering from their previous premise of fast (but good) food to a weightier dinner menu and mains. Their new direction takes them by way of the Mediterranean, with plenty of Spanish, Greek and Middle Eastern flavours. There's also some old favourites, reimagined D'lish style - look out for the excellent roast beef, salt beef and ox tongue sandwiches, and a novel dish of poached skate. There's fresh flavours in the piquant tomato soup ingeniously served with a finger of grilled cheese sandwich, and grilled mushrooms topped with crispy cheesy bits. If it's a salad you're after, there's a new range to choose from, including an inventive pairing of haloumi and watermelon, a classic roast lamb and mint, and several other cheesy offerings.

D'lish (Ground floor, Bangsar Village I. 03 2288 1770/ www.delicious.com.my) is open from 8am daily, and serves dinner from 6pm daily.

Emma Chong

TOKL - June 2010 Issue

The winner of Time Out KL's best cake/back shop in the 2009 awards fully earned its accolade following consistently brilliant production of cup cakes, pastries and other snacks and delights. A well earned treat for literally thousands of people after their trawl around next door's Village Grocer supermarket each week.


The cake counter at D'lish is always tempting. They have a range of dreamy cupcakes (the raspberry brownie cheese cupcake is particularly good), pastries and bars, all good for that quick sugar fix on the run. If you're not in a rush though, the recliners lining the back wall are perfect for lounging on while licking the frosting off the top of your favoured cupcake.

 

 

D'lish was voted the Best Cafe/Bakery in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: If you are busy counting down the days to the weekend, TGI Friday's can help tide you over with their chilled out vibe ridding you of weekday stress..
content.description:
You can find TGI fridays everywhere in the world - and there is a reason for that. If you are busy counting down the days to the weekend, this outlet can help tide you over with their chilled out vibe ridding you of weekday stress. This vibe continues into their service, which is friendly and welcoming, and their meals which are big portions of American comfort foods. Real family fun and finger lickin' chicken! Sizzling chicken fajitas, overflowing burgers topped off with an Apple Breeze Shaker; yum. Just think...an All American dining experience - steak, chips, fried macaroni and cheese, mashed potatoes, chicken, mousse and brownies.

 

TGI Fridays was voted the Best Family Restaurant in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: Celebrated for its delectable roasted pork knuckles, roasted suckling pig, homemade sausages and apple strudels..
content.description:
The only, and therefore the best, Austrian restaurant in Malaysia is homely and authentically European.  Tucket in the newest night spots of Mont Kiara, Karl's Beisl is famous for its porky-ness. The food is just one of its strengths, especially the pork dishes, with a friendly atmosphere and great selection of beers alongside it. Something of an unsung hero and a wonderful alternative night out. A must try is the roasted sucking pig which is juicy in the inside and crispy outisde. This one is for pork lovers galore, the Choucroute Garnie is a combination of pork belly, kassler ham, bratwurst, frankfurts, and the special sauerkraut.

 

 

 

Karl's Beisl is a finalist in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009 Best European Restaurant category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: Bodytone Wellness Studio takes an exercise-oriented approach to weight loss...
content.description:
Bodytone Wellness Studio takes an exercise-oriented approach to weight loss. It offers to take care of three things for you: exercise, slimming and anti-aging. In fact, it is the first Power Plate authorised centre in Malaysia, a machine which apparently commands a star-studded list of followers such as Claudia Schiffer, Kylie Minogue and even Rafael Nada. Okay, it may sound a bit too gimmicky at first but what this Advanced Vibration exercise does is transfer vibrations to the muscles in your body, which causes them to contract in a reflex action. By holding a pose for up to 60 seconds at a time, you will then be able to tone and firm up your body, accelerate fat loss, enhance flexibility and even improve your fitness and stamina. It hardly sounds like a work out at all but Bodytone claims that you can see results in just three sessions a week.

For slimming, the 517 Ultrasound Lipolysis treatment on the menu can be combined with the Advanced Vibration exercise to promote slimming. It breaks down fat cells into free fatty acids and sugar, which will be released into the blood stream and later consumed as pure energy as you work out. As for anti-aging, the Total Body Photo Stimulation Skin Rejuvenation Treatment uses light to stimulate your skin to start reproducing collagen to help reduce wrinkle and increase hydration.

content.short-description: Welcoming to all, Sid's Pub has a reputation for being almost a home away from home...
content.description:
A brainchild of Geoff Siddle, Sid's pubb has established itself as the cosy neighbourhood drinking hole in a number of locations. Welcoming to all - including children and pets - Sid's has a reputation for being almost a home away from home. The friendly staff and regular patrons have made a name for Sid's in the 'pubbing' scene. But it doesn't just end there, the pub grub has also cemented Sid's in people's hearts, with customers loving the hearty, home-cooked appeal of the affordable English food. Try the pigs in blanket, bangers and mash, steak, Sunday roast and steak and kidney pie.










Sid's Pub is a finalist in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009 Best Pub Grub category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: The George & Dragon is fashioned to look like a typical old English tavern and it's hard not to imagine...
content.description:
The George & Dragon is fashioned to look like a typical old English tavern and it's hard not to imagine being in England when sipping a pint while sitting on one of the barstools. Aside from the beers, pub crawlers come here to look for typical British food like the famous toad in the hole, bangers and mash, pigs in blanket and who can ignore the ultimate British dish fish and chips? The menu at the pub is kept simple and concise so that quality is consistent. If you're one for teatime, you can have English afternoon tea here with scones and clotted cream.










The George and Dragon is a finalist in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009 Best Pub Grub category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: The stalwart KL Irish pub chain has survived as one of the best places in the city to catch live sports...
content.description:
The stalwart KL Irish pub chain has survived as one of the best places in the city to catch live sports. With each branch known for a different game, enthusiasts will have their own favourite venue, but for sheer variety, Finnegan's several locations are tough to beat.  Finnegan's is now a favourite haunt for a refreshing pint, live Irish music, typical pub grub or even just a friendly chat. A good selection of beers on tap also help the action flow but for a taste of Ireland, try the Ulster Fry (a typical Irish breakfast) and the house favourite, pork snackers (a platter of pork ham, bacon and sausages served with English mustard).

Outlets: Desa Sri Hartamas (03 2300 0538), Bangsar Baru (03 2284 0476), Mid Valley (03 2284 8157)














Finnegan's was voted the Best Pub Grub in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: Serving Mediterranean fine cuisine, this elegant yet cozy fine dining features authentic Mediterranean dishes...
content.description:
Serving Mediterranean fine cuisine, this elegant yet cozy fine dining features authentic Mediterranean dishes is paired with an extensive wine list to cater to even the pickiest of eaters. Notable specialties include their Tasmanian ocean trout with orange and kalamata olive and also the sundried tomato-crusted lamb rack with vegetables. Also try the pizza topped with smoked ocean trout, red onion, sour cream and rocket leaf. For something different, MED @ Marche also offers a quality selection of seafood that can be prepared to suit your preferences. Other than that, they do offer a delicious variety of desserts to choose from such as the oven baked tortino with melted chocolate center. Yummy!










MED @ Marche is a finalist in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009 Best Seafood Restaurant category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: Delucca offers a nice array of Italian dishes, a nice touch of an elevated open kitchen...
content.description:
Delucca offers a nice array of Italian dishes, a nice touch of an elevated open kitchen, and there is live music on a regular basis as well. While the décor creates an intimate and fun dining experience, the food is well executed and presented with various varieties of pastas, all ladled in ample sauces. Aside from pasta, the brasato (roast meat marinated in red wine then cooked for four hours) deserves a mention as well.










Delucca is a finalist in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009 Best Italian Restaurant category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.


The Time Out Food 40 is our regular definitive guide on where to eat in the Klang Valley. Establishments will only appear in the TOKL Food 40 if they rank amongst the best and most satisfying dining experiences according to our team of independent, honest and experienced food critics.

address.street: First Avenue, Bandar Utama City Centre
First Avenue, Bandar Utama City Centre

content.short-description: Serving mostly Cantonese cuisine, Zuan Yuan delivers the entire package from classic Chinese...
content.description:
Based in the ground floor of One World Hotel in Petaling Jaya, the Multi-award winning Zuan Yuan delivers the entire package from classic Chinese décor (seen in the silver leaf-ed ceiling, ebony doors, and numerous authentic artifacts)  to attentive wait staff. Without question, this is among the best halal Cantonese Chinese outlets in the Klang Valley.

Known for good dim sum the restaurant can get quite packed during weekend lunch hours. Look out for the pan-fried stuffed Australian scallop with Japanese shoyu sauce. Set menus are available for lunch and dinner and packs in appetizer, soup, main course and dessert.










Zuan Yuan Chinese Restaurant is a finalist in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009 Best Chinese Restaurant category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: Pride of India serves up colourful and aromatic dishes that are mostly of North Indian origin...
content.description:
Pride of India serves up colourful and aromatic dishes that are mostly of North Indian origin, as such most dishes are mild, but there are some that's based off the South Indian fare, which means they're really spicy, so you should think twice before jumping straight in with the spoon. Spicy dishes or not, you're definitely spoilt for choices here. Decorations are minimal, but arranged neatly, giving the impression of a really spacious room.










Pride of India is a finalist in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009 Best Indian Restaurant category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: If you must miss one thing on the menu at Passage Thru India, don't let it be the tandoori chicken...
content.description:
If you must miss one thing on the menu at Passage Thru India, don't let it be the tandoori chicken (or the accompanying naan). They only serve the leg portion, and it is juicy, red without being startling, and perfectly cooked. On the other side of the taste spectrum, the bhona ghost (mutton curry) is dense, savoury and satisfying, and afterwards you can soothe your burning tongue with their range of classic lassis, because one is never enough.










Passage through India is a finalist in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009 Best Indian Restaurant category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: Nawab serves Moghul cuisine in a minimalistic, laidback atmosphere...
content.description:
Having established numerous outlets around the world, including several in India and the Middle East, Nawab serves Moghul cuisine in a minimalistic, laidback atmosphere. Segregated seating areas allow you to dine in privacy while there are also large expanses to hold a large dinner party. Nawab's Moghul cuisine exhibits strong Persian influences in their food using fresh dried fruit, cashew nuts, pistachios and almonds in the meat dishes. Nawab is known around town for its flavourful lamb chop masala, zesty tandoori prawns and cheesy Hazari kebab.












Nawab Authentic Moghul Restaurant is a finalist in the Time Out KL Food Awards 2009 Best Indian Restaurant category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: To eat at Max's is to love it, and to love the extraordinary, super-talented chef...
content.description:
To eat at Max's is to love it, and to love the extraordinary, super-talented chef that owns and runs the place. His kitchen is surprisingly small but he produces simply stunning creations, using natural, delicious ingredients. The seafood is exquisite, the wagyu beef top drawer and the lamb arguably the best in KL. Max also boasts a wine list better than a restaurant that size would normally command. But the real treat and what makes Max among the city's top food outlets is when he goes 'off menu'.










Max @iHaus is a finalist in the Time Out Food Awards 2009 Best Fusion/Contemporary Restaurant category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.


The Time Out Food 40 is our regular definitive guide on where to eat in the Klang Valley. Establishments will only appear in the TOKL Food 40 if they rank amongst the best and most satisfying dining experiences according to our team of independent, honest and experienced food critics.

content.short-description: A gem neatly tucked away in Hilton Kuala Lumpur, Senses is intimate and personalized...
content.description:
A gem neatly tucked away on the mezzanine floor of Hilton Kuala Lumpur, Senses is intimate and personalized. Serving modern Australian dishes, Senses uses only sustainable seafood and organic products so you can dine with peace of mind.  The seafood is simply magnificent and includes probably, no, definitely, the best scallops in Malaysia. 

Each dish is thoughtfully presented and immaculately prepared. If you don't know what to order, try Smoking Allowed (Tasmanian ocean trout smoked in front of your eyes) and the refreshingly satisfying beetroot and scallop salad. Practically works of art, the desserts here are worth overstuffing yourself with at the end of the meal.


 

 

 

 

 


Senses is a finalist in the Time Out Food Awards 2009 Fine Dining category. The Time Out KL's food awards are 100% voted for by the people of KL. This way, we guarantee that popularity and consistent performance is rewarded.

content.short-description: At H5, the minimalist stark white interior looks designer chic but it's like a modern museum of design...
content.description:
At H5, the minimalist stark white interior looks designer chic. But when you browse through the cult watches that are encased within the lit glass inserts along the wall, you realize that this space feels like a modern museum of design, which is exactly what the owner Tong Chee Wei is aiming for; he has created the store as a homage to pop art and culture.

Save for Philippe Starck, all the brands of watches that you find here are only available to H5. Each of these brands has garnered a cult following internationally and they look more like pieces of wearable design art. Nooka, which comes from the States, is of course the pride of H5. According to Tong, Nooka (RM559-RM1400) is a fusion of urban New York and anime Japan. It is very current and modern at the same time, a style which Tong labels as 'techy fashion forward'. There are several crossover editions in stores right now such as SpongeBob SquarePants and Kidrobot.

Using block colours, Noon Copenhagen (RM559-RM719) has a clean design, which speaks a lot about its Danish roots. The highlight of this watch is its patented design where the clock face changes colour according to the time. LIP from France (RM700-RM1800) on the other hand is charmingly retro. Its classic design is now regarded as pop art. Even so it still looks classic and professional, something you can wear to work or party. It even has a series of LED watches. They may look digital but they are not-it's so fascinatingly old school.

You might also find Fei Yue, a fashionable sneaker brand from China that was once a staple among Shaolin Kung Fu masters. Tong plans to bring in another cult brand, Nixon, which is very street, very colourful and has been a hit among skateboarders. Although there are already some in store (Kathie Olivas' The Scavengers), Tong plans to bring in more urban designer vinyl toys such as those from Michael Lau. Oh, if you are really into toys, ask the store for the 'secret stash'. Due to the space constraint, some of the goodies are not on display but they are certainly for sale.

content.short-description: Pure Energy proves that just because treatment prices are lower, it doesn't mean we have to scrimp on quality...
content.description:
Everybody wants to go no frills nowadays. Even spas. However, Pure Energy, the award-winning Energy Day Spa's trendy little sister, now open at the refurbished Nomad Sucasa, proves that just because its treatment prices are 20 to 30 per cent lower (than its elder sister), doesn't mean we have to put up with inconsistent service, discounted qualities and bad/utilitarian design.

Here is what I like most about Pure Energy: the design is ingenious. The minimalist interior is dominated by four treatment cubes, each constructed of wooden frames and art canvas walls. The decor is simple, earthy and comfortable. It almost has a sort of Japanese zen-like simplicity to it, which is very soothing. While some spas go all out to wow the customers, the design at the end of the day can become rather intimidating. Pure Energy has none of that. The space and the design is very functional, down to earth and I like that a lot. And instead of the lame instrumental tunes, Pure Energy plays down tempo chill music.

Pure Energy caters to busy executives on the go; someone who wants a quick fix in between appointments. Its treatments, which range from full body, shoulder and foot massages to facials, scrubs and waxing, also come in express 30-minute versions, which start from just RM35. There are comfy loungers for those foot massages or quick clothes-on body works where you can enjoy a cuppa and take advantage of the spa's free WiFi. Yes, Pure Energy has WiFi. Good eh?

For me, I decided to go for a lengthy session. I started with the dry body brushing (RM45/20min) whereby my Balinese masseuse, Balek, lightly scrubbed my skin with a short bristle brush (in the direction of the lymph nodes) to stimulate blood circulate, remove dead skin cells and help my body detox. Although at first the treatment seemed a little ridiculous, the repetitive movement of the brush slowly gave way to a soothing effect. And seeing how I had to go to the toilet after that, I suppose the treatment did work after all.

Next came the spa's signature Purity Special full body massage (RM120/60min). This oil massage is a blend of relaxing and deep tissue massage so while it is pampering, the masseuse also pays extra care to those tensed muscles. The moment Balek put her hands on me, I knew it was going to be a good massage. Her pressure was strong yet measured (a quality not as common as we think as many masseuse are just strong and brutal) and she seemed to have an intuitive sense of how the body works.

Lastly, I finished off with a foot massage (RM50/30min). For this treatment, Balek did apply pressure on several of reflex zones at the base of my foot. However, it is not one of these excruciating proxy massage of your internal organs. Instead, it is a comfortable and enjoyable massage that soothes tired feet.

While Pure Energy doesn't have all the common spa luxuries such as a full-service lounge, sauna and Jacuzzi, it still feels very much like a complete spa. And they are very strict on hygiene - separate towels for foot and body. The treatments are great and thorough and the space is cosy.
