content.description: The Petaling Jaya City Council's (MBPJ) air-conditioned Civic Centre Auditorium is a regular venue for musical and cultural performances, as well as exhibitions.

content.short-description: The Malaysia International Exhibition & Convention Centre (MIECC) has emerged as Malaysia's premier exhibition venue...
content.description:
The Malaysia International Exhibition & Convention Centre (MIECC) has emerged as Malaysia's premier exhibition venue, having hosted a multitude of major events, both regional and international.

Ample space, elegant interiors and cosy furnishings with a built up area of 1,552 m2 of seminar and meeting areas coupled with state-of-the-art facilities, ideal location, professional and accommodating personnel as well as a complementing golf course, 5 star hotels and resorts, amusement park and shopping centre, MIECC is the perfect venue for any type of event - be them small or large, formal or casual.

MIECC is not only a venue for exhibitions and conventions. It is also as an ideal place for private banquets, concerts, symposiums and theme parties with a capacity to hold 10,000 persons comfortably and 8,000 persons for sit down banquets. MIECC boasts of its own culinary and banquet team catering to various palates and requirements.

content.short-description: PJ Live Arts is a Not-For-Profit organization which utilizes arts as a platform to raise funds for cancer treatment, charities and education...
content.description: PJ Live Arts is a Not-For-Profit organization and best known as a catalyst for community outreach and support, utilizing arts as a platform to raise funds for cancer treatment, charities and education; and to promote the community involvement in its theatre and audience development. By supporting our services and facilities, you would enable PJLA to continue serving the people and causes for the betterment of the community and the arts.

content.short-description: UKM Medical Centre is dedicated to provide excellent service and quality education and conduct research within modern medical facilities...
content.description:
UKM Medical Centre is dedicated to provide excellent service and quality education and conduct research within modern, advanced and cost effective medical facilities.

Now 35 years old,the Faculty of Medicine was established in 1972 as a medical institution to carry out medical and nursing training activities, medical research and clinical services, under the administration of a Dean.

In the beginning, clinical training for medical students and  medical services provided by lecturers were carried out at the Hospital  Kuala Lumpur (HKL) which served as a teaching hospital.

However, in 2008, the Faculty of Medicine merged with Hospital UKM (a teaching hospital for students of UKM) to form UKM Medical Centre - with the motto 'Integrating Education and Research for Society'.

content.short-description: Theo Fine Art Gallery caters for the needs of a client interested in Art pieces...
content.description: Situated in Plaza Damas, the TJ Fine Art gallery was established in 2004 by contemporary Malaysian artist Tajuddin Ismail. A combination of a gallery, dealer and agent, the TJ Fine Art group was set up to cater for the needs of clients interested in starting or expanding their collection in Art. The mission and goal of TJ Fine Art is to deliver high quality and sophisticated artworks to contribute to Malaysian culture. Additionally, the group serves as an exclusive representative of Tajuddin Ismail,as well as several other contemporary international artists.

content.short-description: An exclusive art gallery in Subang town, Core Design Gallery comes with a different concept than the numerous other...
content.description: An exclusive art gallery in Subang town, Core Design Gallery comes with a different concept than the numerous other galleries out there - it is a boutique art gallery. It differentiate itself from other commercial art galleries by personalizing art appreciation and exclusive invitations to the artists or buyers.

content.short-description: The Institute fosters knowledge about Germany by providing information on its culture, society and politics...
content.description:
Goethe-Institut is the Federal Republic of Germany's cultural institution operational worldwide. The study of German abroad as well as international cultural exchange is encouraged.

The Institute fosters knowledge about Germany by providing information on its culture, society and politics. It sets internationally recognised standards in the teaching and learning of German as a foreign language.

The Institute also runs language courses, compiles teaching materials, trains teachers, contributes to scientific research and participates in politicolanguage initiatives.

content.short-description: Blubricks is an entity born out of passion to educate and encourage people to express themselves more clearly...
content.description:
Blubricks is an entity born out of passion to educate and encourage people to express themselves more clearly.

The learning studio strives to empower students with the confidence to be self -leaders and future-shapers, as well as to churn out highly skilled/equipped performers in various skills pertaining to the Arts.

Established in 2006, the learning studio offers courses teaching not only kids speech and drama, but teenagers and adults. The studio also aids people in "expanding their horizons".

content.short-description: Beryl is a premium chocolate brand, mostly exported overseas, offering more than 100 varieties of chocolate...
content.description:
Beryl is a premium chocolate brand, mostly exported overseas, offering more than 100 varieties of chocolate to suit your every mood and desire.

A growing chocolatier, Beryl offers chocolate lovers some of the finest selections in the region.

From ancient time chocolate had been a delicacy and a medicine for the human spirit. Here, an endless choice of chocolates featuring a variety of taste, flavours and packaging to meet your every need!

The options are abundant, catering to suit your every crave! From panned and bar chocolate all the way down to no sugar added chocolate.

Go ahead - have a bite of heaven.

Beryl's factory:

Bangi: Refer sidebar

Seri Kembangan: No. 2, Jalan Raya 7/1, Kawasan Perindustrian Seri Kembangan, 43300 Seri Kembangan

content.short-description: The cutting-edge design of the watches available at H5 will be a cool addition to your watch collection...
content.description:
We're pretty much obsessed with anything that's new, savvy, and futuristic (and we don't mean the Avatar). So, it's not surprising that H5, the sleek concept store that reminds you of a science laboratory, is opening a new outlet at Mid Valley Megamall after the ballyhoo over their fashion-forward cult watches. Inspired by its edgy black décor, this latest inception of H5 is named H5 Black Lab pop-up store.
   
The outlet carries various watch brands but Nooka, the super cool digital timepieces, emerged as the best-seller of all times - although it does take a while to learn how to read time off its unconventional watch face. The omnipresent street culture in Malaysia makes the arrival of H5 even timelier. For trendsetters who enjoy trendy and yet wearable timepieces, the cutting-edge design of the watches available at H5 will be a cool addition to your watch collection.

Kong Wai Yeng

content.short-description: The MECC exhibition and convention centre is a 24 storey structure with a unique archway throughout the entire building...
content.description:
The MECC exhibition and convention centre is a 24 storey edifice with a unique archway throughout the entire building.

Well-equipped, the building comes with a Matrade Hall, three Exhibition Halls, an Outdoor Exhibition area, eight function rooms, and a theatrette. In total, the venue is capable of hosting up to 1,500 persons.

The MECC is also technologically sufficient with advanced facilities like audio-visual and lighting controls, soundproof partitions, and Wi-Fi connectivity.

Undoubtedly one of the best places in Malaysia for Meeting Incentive, Convention and Exhibition with emphasis on the Trade-Centric events.

Also, don't forget to take advantage of the Food & Beverage services offered at MECC.

content.short-description: Tropicana City Mall is designed based on the needs and wants of our customers from surrounding areas and beyond....
content.description:
Developed to bring pleasure and enjoyment for you, Tropicana City Mall is designed based on the needs and wants of our customers from surrounding areas and beyond. With four individual floors assigned with unique themes, the mall houses many established F&B brands, fashion concept outlets to 'family' stores, entertainment, retail and more.

Lower Ground
Choose from a wide variety of grocery products as our anchor tenant (Carrefour) caters to a mix of consumers from housewives to students & working professionals. This floor also houses one pharmacy, a cobbler and other service providers.

Ground Floor
Select from a host of clothing and fashion acessories stores to create a look that is totally unique. Then unwind at our food outlets and enjoy sumptuous food and beverages.

1st Floor
Choose from a range of retail stores that cater to every familial need. Whether you are in need of home furnishings, electronic items or books, find the latest items in our outlets.

2nd Floor
Watch the best movies and enjoy R& R services from the outlets available on this floor. In addition to a state-of-the-art cinema, we have spa and wellness shops to help you revitalise your mind, body & soul. You may also find the latest toys, IT products and other gadgets on this floor.

content.short-description: Authentic Thai appetizers, mains, desserts and drinks form a royal banquet...
content.description:
Authentic Thai appetizers, mains, desserts and drinks form a royal banquet.

The venue houses cozy dining amidst dim-lit surroundings of earthen tiles, wood panelling, helpful service and of course, the warm aromas that spread through the setting. Patrons can choose from an extensive menu featuring culinary favourites such as the Tom Yam Soup, Green Curry, Minced Chicken on Lemongrass Sticks, Pad Thai with Dried Shrimps, Pineapple Fried Rice and more.

The Royal Thai menu comprises a vast selection of appetisers, mains, desserts and drinks that are concocted recipes by Royal Thai's masterful chefs.


Other Branch:

Dataran Mentari
Ground Floor, Wisma TT
No 1, Jln PJS 8/15,
Dataran Mentari
46150 Petaling Jaya
Selangor
Tel : +603-5632 2798

content.short-description: Tao Cusine is the Upscale restaurant that offers an 'all you can eat' buffet with full table service, focusing on quality rather than on price...
content.description:
Tao Cusine is the Upscale restaurant that offers an 'all you can eat' buffet with full table service, focusing on quality rather than on price.
For adults, RM50.00++ and for children, RM25.00++.

The venue serves Japanese, Chinese, Thai cuisine, and more. Tao restaurant with 300pax sitting capacity caters for special occasions such as birthday, Family gathering, anniversaries, banquets, special event, receptions and meetings.

content.short-description: The Sultani is located at the newly renovated Hotel Flamingo...
content.description:
The Sultani is located at the newly renovated Hotel Flamingo.

The venue is a new creation, chosen to represent the royal derivations of unique Moghal dishes. The restaurant specialises in mouth-watering Moghulai Cooking which is the traditional cooking of sub-continent Pakistan and India. Check out chef's specialty dishes: Butter chicken, Fish Kasoori, Chicken tandoori and Raan E Akbari.

Under the same ownership as Alif Layila, this venue has been updated to provide patrons with a traditional and majestic Mughlai setting.

content.short-description: At the edge of Putrajaya city sits Palm garden Hotel, a four star resort-hotel...
content.description:
At the edge of Putrajaya city sits Palm garden Hotel, a four star resort-hotel.

Strategically located five minutes away from the heart of Putrajaya, the hotel offers an all round experience, be it for business or leisure.

The venue houses 151 furnished rooms surrounding a courtyard, five dining outlets, 10 multi function banquet rooms and a splurge of activities to keep you busy.

content.short-description: Offering a wide variety of sushi along with an expansive menu of other Japanese food at affordable prices in a friendly, cosy environment, they quickly gained popularity to become a favourite amongst locals and foreigners alike....
content.description:
Offering a wide variety of sushi along with an expansive menu of other Japanese food at affordable prices in a friendly, cosy environment, they quickly gained popularity to become a favourite amongst locals and foreigners alike.

Other outlets:

Sushi King Berjaya Times Square
Berjaya Times Square

55100 Kuala Lumpur

content.short-description: An international success, McDonald's continues to grow from strength to strength...
content.description:
An international success, McDonald's continues to grow from strength to strength. You are provided with the best - food is made from the highest quality ingredients, the menu is extensive and the food is always great.

Other Branches:


McDonald's Bukit Bintang
120-120A Jalan Bukit Bintang
55100 Kuala Lumpur
Tel : 03 - 2142 7843

McDonald's Bangsar
48 Jalan Telawi Lima

McDonald's Mont Kiara
No. 1, Block D
Plaza Mont Kiara
Jalan Bukit Kiara
50480 Kuala Lumpur
Tel : 03 - 6203 3745

content.short-description: Situated in one of Kl's oldest hotels, the Federal, the Verandah has a casual atmosphere which allows guests to feel right at home...
content.description: Situated in one of Kl's oldest hotels, the Federal, the Verandah has a casual atmosphere which allows guests to feel right at home. Enjoy the friendly service and pleasant views of the tropical garden and swimming pool while tucking into scrumptious meals at any time of the day. There are sumptuous, value-for-money breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets as well as a tempting à la carte menu featuring western and local cuisine to choose from.

content.short-description: The stylish Café Rasa serves both local and western cuisine and offers a casually sophisticated à la carte menu...
content.description:
The stylish Café Rasa serves both local and western cuisine and offers a casually sophisticated à la carte menu, which includes gourmet coffees and designer sandwiches, for diners on the go. Those with the luxury of time can sit back enjoy the Malaysian al fresco experience with great views of Bukit Bintang colour and verve.

Check out the buffet lunch at RM37++ on weekends.

content.short-description: Try the stylishly contemporary Tonka Bean Café. Deli, where you will be able to savour true culinary delights 24-hours a day...
content.description: Impiana KLCC Hotel offers the best dining in Kuala Lumpur with 4 exquisite outlets. Try the stylishly contemporary Tonka Bean Café. Deli, where you will be able to savour true culinary delights 24-hours a day.

content.short-description: Station 1 Cafe has established itself as a premier Malaysian fusion F&B entity...
content.description:
Station 1 Cafe has grown in stature from strength to strength. In a span of approximately four short years, Station 1 Cafe  has established itself as a premier Malaysian fusion F&B entity. Unlike any other cafe in town, it not only provides an excellent variety coffees and related beverages but also a tantalizing array of cuisine - within a superb setting making you feel right at home!

MISSION:

To consistently excel in delivering marvelous customer service by providing:

 -the most enjoyable atmosphere
      
 -top quality food and beverages

 

Other Branches:

Block A-G-6 & A-G-7,
Jln PJU 1A/41B, NZX Commercial Centre,
Ara Damansara,
47301 Petaling Jaya

Lot 1 (Ground Floor),
Citrus Park Food Emporium Plaza OUG,
Taman OUG, Jalan Klang Lama,
58200 Kuala Lumpur.

27-1, Jalan PJU 5/13,
Dataran Sunway,
47810 Kota Damansara,
Petaling Jaya, Selangor.

3-23A, Ground Floor,
Jalan Desa 2/2, Desa Aman Puri,
Kepong, 52200 Selangor.

39 & 41-LG2,
Block C, No 72A,
Jalan Universiti,
46200 Petaling Jaya.

No 21 (Ground & 3rd Floor) &
No.23 (Ground Floor),
Jalan SS 21/60, Damansara Utama,
47400 Petaling Jaya

content.short-description: A town house situated in the Changkat Bukit Bintang area, next to No Black Tie. This town house is used by...
content.description: A town house situated in the Changkat Bukit Bintang area, next to No Black Tie. This town house is frequently used by the underground fraternity of musicians and artists in holding gigs and exhibitions.

content.short-description: Serving choices of lobster flown direct from the North Atlantic, Lobsterman is renowned as one of the premier seafood diners around...
content.description:
As if the name of the restaurant isn't obvious enough, Lobsterman specializes in lobsters of course. Situated in PJ, it happens to be the only place in Malaysia serving North Atlantic lobsters.

Serving choices of lobster flown direct from the North Atlantic, Lobsterman is renowned as one of the premier seafood diners around. You can select the lobster to be cooked a la Italy, American, France, Japan, Thailand, India, and also local Malaysian taste. Rice and pasta are also presented to go along with your lobster.

You can either choose from the a la carte menu or the set lunch or if you're planning a dinner with your friends or family, choose from the special set menu.

Pork Free

content.short-description: This comfy eatery provides good fresh seafood, plus authentic Thai and Malay cuisine...
content.description:
Alongside the hectic road of Jalan Raja Abdullah, this is a comfy eatery that provides good fresh seafood, plus authentic Thai and Malay cuisine. Order siong-tong lala - Lala in fragrant soup with lots of wine and ginger, that's their specialty.

Besides their special lala (clams), dishes like lemon chicken, butter fish, deep fried squid, salted fried prawn, marmite chicken and their salted egg fried crab. This is a suitable place for seafood lovers to indulge in delicious food and an open air dining is always good for the soul, right?

content.short-description: This eatery is known for its cheap and delicious meals, besides the seafood, check out the deer meet...
content.description:
Although a fairly long taxi ride away from civilisation, this eatery is known for its cheap and delicious meals. If you're keen on getting home-cooked meals, you can get it here in Kim Kee. Dishes like steamed bean paste fish and fish belly steamed with garlic ginger paste are among the popular dishes here. Besides the seafood, check out the deer meet or pork with salted vegetables. Also, a must try vege dish is the tofu with angle gourd, simply delightful.

The food price is very reasonable and the environment is lively with people chatting away. You can even bring your own vegetable, fish or meat and tell them to cook it. Isn't that great?

Non Halal

content.short-description: This well-ventilated restaurant is a worth stopover for its enormous, moist and meaty Indonesian crabs, served with rich sweet and spicy sauce...
content.description:
This well-ventilated restaurant is a worth stopover for its enormous, moist and meaty Indonesian crabs, served with rich sweet and spicy sauce.

Teatime arrivals can order reasonable (in both quality and price) snacks including fish balls, sotong kangkung or tauhu bakar. Tauhu bakar? Oh yes, its fried tauhu with very delicious 'rojak' sauce poured over it.

Menus include their famous meaty crab dish, salted egg crab and a few other non-crab dishes such as stir fried clams, stir-fried vegetable and fried squid. The price is fairly reasonable so its worth trying.

content.short-description: Feel free to mix and match to find the crab and sauces which you prefer...
content.description:
Can't get enough of seafood? Are you aching to try something new? Well, King Crab Restaurants serves tom yam prawn with coconut milk, butter crabs (imagine butter oozing out of that fleshy crab), salted egg squid and many more choices to choose from.

If you're dining with someone who doesn't fancy seafood as much as you do, then there's a range of non-seafood dishes to choose from as well, such as, the guiness pork ribs, radish cake, noodles and various fried rice.

Feel free to mix and match to find the crab and sauces which you prefer. Pick your own dishes from seven types of crab and ten different ways to cook them. Good for large parties or intimate (if somewhat loud) occasions. 

Non Halal

content.short-description: Hoi Kee is a much loved dining spot; the secret is nothing more or less than the good, fresh food served...
content.description:
If you fancy good Chinese seafood, do visit Hoi Kee. Well-known for its steamed fish head dish - a huge fish with minced ginger and oyster sauce gravy topped with coriander leaves - Hoi Kee is a much loved dining spot. The secret is nothing more or less than the good, fresh food served. Menus include steamed fish, crispy chicken with plum sauce, Hing Hwa oyster omelette, claypot pork, stir fried chicken, home-made beancurd, bittergourd with salted egg and oyster noodle. There are also various drinks to choose from.

The place looks like your average Chinese restaurant but the price is very reasonable so what are you waiting for?

Non Halal

content.short-description: Kristao is a double storey restaurant and bar that specialises in Malaccan Portuguese cuisine.
content.description:
A hidden gem amongst the trendy nightspots on the Asian Heritage Row, Kristao is a double storey restaurant and bar that specialises in Malaccan Portuguese cuisine. The dark ambience makes it a perfect place for an intimate chat over a drink or two and it also gives a homey feel.

The chef is a Malaccan-Portugese and his specialties are Malaccan-Portugese cuisines. Try the chicken debal curry or other spicy selections such as the chicken vindaloo, beef lambila and navarine of lamb. However, the menu changes from time to time so expect different variety of food each time you visit. There are desserts which are home-made. Prices are reasonable.

content.short-description: Cristang, referring to the Portuguese people of Malacca, has traditional and cultural influences in abundance. A current favourite are pork burgers...
content.description:
With its name referring to the Portuguese people of Malacca, Cristang has cultural and traditional influences in abundance. Located just opposite the Hilton PJ, it is an unassuming eatery with simplicity at the core. Their current bestsellers are the pork burgers, which come in seven different varieties ranging from P1 to P7. There are pork patties, pork burgers, grilled pork with mushroom, bacon and omelette, carbonara with bacon and debal curry. What's best is that you get a 20 per cent off on all pork burgers on Wednesdays. 

The downside of Cristang is the slow service though. Other than that, great pork burgers. Did we mention that there's petai in some of the burgers?

Non Halal

content.short-description: Ribs by Vintry is the latest addition to the Vintry group; With its porcine delights, the Bavarian ribs are highly recommended...
content.description: Ribs by Vintry is the latest addition to the Vintry group and it certainly has picked out the strengths of its predecessors and built on them. A stone's throw from the original, it certainly serves to satisfy any meat craving. The interior has a fine blend of contemporary and rustic accents with its exposed brick walls and comfortable settees. With its meat-falling-off-the-bones texture and smooth barbecue sauce, the Bavarian ribs are highly recommended. The food here comes in a big porportion which is always worth paying for. They also have a good wine list. All this with ample parking and friendly service to boot.

content.short-description: Japanese fast food chain with a speciality of the mighty pork burger, which contains no MSG or preservatives...
content.description:
Japanese fast food chain with a speciality of the mighty pork burger, which contains no MSG or preservatives. Ranked along the best burgers in the city, you might like to try the other deep fried porky treats here but you'll always come back for the burgers.


The more pork burgers you get, the cheaper it gets! Although the size of their burger is pretty small, its quite cheap so it enables you to get more than one burger, and also, more than one flavor. Currently, Ninja Joe's have six different flavors ; spicy, original, oriental, teriyaki, black pepper and sweet and sour. In addition to that, you must try their 'shuriken', its a mixture of pork nuggets and mashed potatoes. Yummy!


Non Halal

content.short-description: Casual Nyonya dining with a rather pricey menu...
content.description:
Ah Tuan Ee has a very serene atmosphere which will definitely let you to sit back and relax. They have a rather illustrated menu which will distract you and leaving you indecisive on which food to pick but their waiters and waitresses are friendly and is always ready to help you out. Menus include fried assam prawn, laksa assam lemak, fried tang hoon, brinjals with prawn and sweet ginger chicken. The food tastes good but it is rather pricey for casual Nyonya dining. Although the quality is fine but in terms of value you can do an awful lot better.

Halal

Other Branches:

Level 1, Western Courtyard, The Curve, Mutiara Damansara, 47400 Petaling Jaya‎

content.short-description: Ostensibly Mexican, Carlos delivers a Tex-Mex menu plus a few surprises...
content.description:
Carlos Mexican Canteena is definitely a restaurant. But wait! It is also a shisha (hookah) bar. A what? Although it is a confusing yet creative blend, this place is pretty much Mexican. This mexican restaurant serves delicious, mouth watering mexican food such as beef and beans, chicken and tomatoes, tomato rice and they even have their own Mexican platter. Not forgetting, basic Mexican food like nachos, enchiladas and tacos of course must be tried upon your first visit.The Tex-Mex menu delivers all you could want, plus a few surprises. Oh and it is a great place to spend an evening with your friends or family. Great atmosphere and cosy environment.

Pork Free

content.short-description: A Mom and Pop family restaurant that dishes up some fine Italian-Mediterranean food with classic paella and pastas...
content.description:
A 'Mom and Pop' family restaurant that dishes up some fine Italian-Mediterranean food - with classic paella and pastas.  They even make their own gelato, with quirky flavours like Oreo, Kinder Bueno and hazelnut which will help cool you down on a hot KL day. With a very extensive menu, there is no wonder why people get caught up in a dillema. Menus include Albanian village salad, Italian salad, pizza diavola, braised lamb shank and salmon carpaccio. And fret not vegetarians, Porto Romano serves vegetarian food as well. Overall, Porto Romano has a very cosy and comfortable environment that would enable you to chill and relax.

Pork Free

Other Branches:

28, Persiaran Zaaba,
Taman Tun Dr. Ismail,
60000 Kuala Lumpur.

content.short-description: Moussandra serves authentic Greek, Spanish and Italian cuisine in a rustic and cosy setting...
content.description:
Moussandra deserves it plaudits for not falling into the commercial trap and continuing to serve authentic Greek, Spanish and Italian cuisine in a rustic and cosy setting. With a vintage telephone in the corner and candles in wine bottles, this is as much a feast for the eyes as it is for the tastebuds. The highlight would be the sauteed beef rib-eye in red wine sauce which is fantastic and also their boneless chicken leg.

For those with a sweet tooth, you're in luck because Moussandra serves delicious desserts. Try the affogato or their classic tiramisu to wash down that delicious meal you had previously.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Flamenco has established itself as one of the best spots in town for a wide selection of tapas and wines...
content.description:
Billed as the first Spanish Mediterranean restaurant in KL, Flamenco has established itself as one of the best spots in town for a wide selection of tapas and wines. Parking shouldn't be a worry. The service is friendly and attentive while the vibe is soft and blissful. The rack of lamb, meaty yet tender, comes with creamed spinach and the home-made pates are always unique. The black mussels are delicious and worth trying and also, the deep fried calamari makes a very tasty appetizer.

The price is reasonable and the place is definitely lively. Very suitable if you're planning a night out with your friends.

content.short-description: In Pucuk Ubi restaurant you can taste authentic Sarawak cuisine and experience the mystical state through its native ingredients...
content.description:
In Pucuk Ubi restaurant you can taste authentic Sarawak cuisine and experience the mystical state through its native ingredients. Although the menu is in the native Sarawakian language, it comes with a brief explanation of what it is. Menus include Singket (sago grubs), fried tempoyak, umai udang (lime marinated prawn salad), pucuk ubi Bidayuh-style (stir fried pounded tapioca shoots and leaves) and there's also a variety of Sarawakian fried rice.

If you're expecting cheap food, you're wrong. It turns out that the price is quite expensive. Fret not! Sarawakian food is hard to find here in KL so you might want to give it a try as it tastes good.

Halal

content.short-description: Specialising in good Malaysian local food, Penang Nyonya, and Chinese cuisine, this outlet aims for the best in quality...
content.description:
Penang Village has eight outlets across Malaysia and even three outlets in Indonesia. Specialising in good Malaysian local food, Penang Nyonya, and Chinese cuisine, Penang Village aims for the best in quality within it's comfortable and cool outlets. And in the main they achieve it. A good hawker-esque selection. Their signature dishes include salted egg prawn, penang assam laksa, pie-tee, yin yang fish and Heh Bee butter prawn.

Penang Village provides good service as well as a well-lit environment. With a team of friendly stuff, one will always welcomed here. Plus, the food price is very reasonable and affordable. So hurry up and visit the nearest outlet and indulge yourself with good local cuisines.

Pork Free

Other Branches:

Hartamas Shopping Mall,     
Lot G8B & 9, Ground Floor,
Jalan Sri Hartamas 1, Sri Hartamas,
50480 Kuala Lumpur

content.short-description: A special atmosphere, complimented by the serving of traditional special dishes...
content.description:
An authentic step back in time, with nostalgia aplenty. Images of famed filmmaker P Ramlee and pals adorn the walls and period music is piped in to help create a special atmosphere, complimented by the serving of traditional special dishes. ‎

That's how you'll feel when you step into this restaurant. The nostalgic sound of local oldies can be heard as you self-serve your plate of nasi lemak. Oh yes, you get to choose what goes in your nasi lemak, and how much you want it. With food placed on a table, you make your rounds choosing from a range of delicious, tasty dishes such as chicken rendang, beef rendang and anchovies as well as your favourite nasi lemak sambal. Although, nasi lemak is their signature dish here, other food choices are worth trying too; laksa johor, murtabak and fried meehoon. As for the price, it is very reasonable.

Halal

content.short-description: To get Ipoh speciality coffee, you dont need to travel to the city up the North/South Highway. Just go to Ipoh Old Town in Bangsar...
content.description:
Every foodie worth their salt (or sugar) knows about Ipoh white coffee, a roast coffee prepared with a unique method of modern and traditional Malaysian brewing. To get Ipoh speciality coffee, you don't need to travel to the city up the North/South Highway. Just go to Ipoh Old Town in Bangsar.

With a range of food such as the delicious pork balls in soup, which by the way tastes rich and meaty, shredded chicken hor fun and their famous deep fried fish with lychee. The fish has a tinge of sweetness which leaves your taste buds wanting for more. Also, do order their coffee to accompany their delicious meal. Its hot and delicious!

Non Halal

content.short-description: Come during the afternoon and celebrate your day with beef popiah and sip chrysanthemum tea...
content.description:
No, not a Japanese restaurant. But yes, the gyu name comes from Japanese language, meaning beef. As a noodle house, Gyuniku serves up various beef dishes and noodles like wantan mee and kuey teow. The local favourite dish is ngau lam (beef brisket) which has the right mixture of chewy and soft. The beef brisket is provided with a sufficient amount of black pepper sauce and is cooked perfectly well leaving you lusting over more.

However, if you're not sure if you'll enjoy the food in Gyuniku, make an effort to spend your afternoon here and celebrate your day with beef popiah and sip a cup of hot chrysanthemum tea.

Halal

content.short-description: Great selections of all the Malaysian favourites in a swanky setting at the top of KLs most impressive mall...
content.description:
The up-market sibling of the popular Madam Kwan's, Grandmama's is an excellent restaurant proving very popular with the busy Bukit Bintang clientel. Great selections of all the Malaysian favourites in a swanky setting at the top of KL's most impressive mall.

The dishes are almost similar to the ones in Madam Kwan's but the taste is a bit different. Although the nasi bojari is almost similar to Madam Kwan's, it has a special taste that sets the two apart. Other foods that are worth trying include fish head noodle, laksa and their deliciously oily hakka fried rice. Oh don't mind the calories, the food tastes good!

Halal

content.short-description: Segafredo is the only bar that controls the entire coffee production process, from cultivation to blending, roasting and serving them in the cup...
content.description:
Okay, bear with me on this: Segafredo is similar to Batman. Seriously. You see, in broad daylight, Bruce Wayne acts as a well-heeled industrialist but at night, this dark knight perches atop the Gotham skyscraper to kick some butts. Like Bruce Wayne and his alter ego, Segafredo during the day is a quiet café that serves freshly-brewed coffee to patrons who enjoy a relaxing casual breakfast. But when darkness creeps in, this 'spuntino' bar - an Italian term for casual gathering place that serves coffee and small bites - morphs into a snazzy cocktail lounge, teeming with various types of martinis and high-end offerings. (Ed: that's one too many a coffee for our writer.)
           
With 400 espresso bars in more than 50 countries, Segafredo is the only bar that controls the entire coffee production process, from cultivation to blending, roasting and serving them in the cup. So you can be sure of the consistency of quality in every cup of Segafredo coffee.

Upon entering the café, you will be buffeted by a familiar coffee aroma that fills your lung with a jolting caffeine kick. As you imbibe the first sip of Affogato (gelato floating in a pond of espresso) and nibble that carpet of coffee powder on Tiramisu, you will realise that Segafredo, does serve quality coffee.

Kong Wai Yeng

content.short-description: Their main course selection encompasses everything from mixed grill, wagyu beef, pasta and teppanyaki sets...
content.description:
Crack open the bubbly

TOKL Rating: 3/5

Greedy people like me aren't terribly fussy when it comes to food. The essence of eating just doesn't permit it, not when you are the kind of person who, when you think no one is looking, will steal leftovers left behind on the plates of others beleaguered with average appetites. A regular buffet is an opportunity to gorge, to consume as much as possible without thinking about what I'm eating. The champagne brunch at Starhill Gallery allows you to do the same but demands that you take notice of what you're eating, such is the menu that's on offer.
   
The standard offerings are available: a carving station offering beef and lamb, an assortment of salads as well as Chinese, Japanese and Italian cuisine. What is worth coming here for is their main course selection which encompasses everything from mixed grill, wagyu beef, pasta and teppanyaki sets - all personally and lovingly cooked on the spot and delivered to your table. Go for the Lemon Butter Sauce Lobster Thermidor - the meat is soft and delicious and I find myself lapping up every square inch. If you prefer lobster 'as is', the Grilled Half Boston Lobster is equally tasty. Our only sore point is that you can only order one dish from the main course menu. Opt for the champagne option (why wouldn't you?), you'll receive unlimited amounts of Piper-Heidsieck Champagne. We'd also like to point you to their cocktail menu, specifically in the direction of the deceptively strong Coconut Margarita.
   
Nothing elevates the mood like brunch so the room buzzed with that happy noise of people for whom brunch has a way of putting life in its proper perspective. This is a city that, whatever else it doesn't do, does talk. We definitely feel that this brunch is worth talking about.

Syazlynia Rahim

content.short-description: Bon Ton is stylish place with an authentic charm of its own...
content.description:
Recently opened in the new look Lot 10 complex, Bon Ton is stylish place with an authentic charm of its own. Excellent wine list compliments the reliably good Malaysian food. A la carte menu includes seafood tomyam, laksa nyonya, assam pedas fish, lemongrass chicken, barbeque lamb chop, sirloin steak and many more. Bon Ton recommends their rib eye steak, sesame crusted salmon fillet and their lamb rack in herb. They also serve a lunch set which consists of soup of the day or salad (starter), spicy nyonya fried rice, roasted chicken with buttered rice or pan fried fish (main course) and as for dessert, you'll get a home-made ice cream! Delicious!

Halal

content.short-description: Traditional Malaysian food in an authentic dining setting that feels like home in the kampong...
content.description:
Traditional Malaysian food in an authentic dining setting that feels like home in the kampong. Enjoy their delicious brinjal with dried prawn, sambal belacan fried rice, sweet and sour chicken with rice, stir fried squid, home-made otak otak, chicken pongteh and assam sotong (squid). These delicious aromatic food is reasonably cheap and with a team of jovial and attentive staffs, it is a nice place for a family feast with decent Nyonya cuisine.

So what are you waiting for? Get up, start walking and get over to Aunty Nat and try their delicious dishes now. But if you are in a hurry, get the take away menu and enjoy it at home.

Pork Free

content.short-description: This quaint restaurant offers a hearty mix of Middle Eastern and Moroccan cuisine...
content.description:
Seemingly separate from the bustling Jalan Bukit Bintang, this quaint restaurant offers a hearty mix of Middle Eastern and Moroccan cuisine. Tajine's interior certainly leaves nothing to be desired. The finer touches such as the vibrant tiles, decorative plates on the wall and glass lantern certainly set the atmosphere for a great meal. The food here is quite basic, albeit done with quality in mind. Dishes include the lamb kofta tagine, a bubbling hotplate of lamb meatballs in a rich tomato sauce and the tabbouleh, chopped parsley with a dash of lemon and oil. They also serves a variety of healthy salads such as Morrocan salad, Fetuch (fresh lettuce, tomato, cucumber, white radish topped with crunchy toasted Lebanese bread), green salad, Arabic salad and yogurt salad. If you've never tried middle eastern desserts, you might want to give it a try. It has a distinct taste!

Halal

content.short-description: This Korean outlet cooks the dishes like you would expect villagers 'back home' would; in the traditional way...
content.description:
Meaning "Korean Village", Han Chon cooks the dishes like you would expect villagers 'back home' would; in the traditional way. If you are a fried chicken fan, then you'll enjoy their allegedly-near-fat-free premium Korean fried chicken with only wings and drumsticks. Don't forget to ask for yummy home-made sauce. There's actually two types of flavor, which is original and spicy. Han Chon's fried chicken is cooked and dipped in vegetable oil making it less oily. But it isn't dry, in fact its juicy and the lingering taste of the chicken is to die for!

Food price is very reasonable and takeaway delivery is free to Sri Hartamas, Mont Kiara, Bangsar, and Section 16, PJ.

Halal

content.short-description: Dae Sa Kwan has its own petite grill place at the top of each table. Home -cooked starters with Korean beer...
content.description:
Like other typical Korean restaurants, Dae Sa Kwan has its own petite grill place at the top of each table. With the spicy beef & octopus casserole, you might be surprised to see a big octopus lying down in the hot soup in front of you. WIth a reasonable price tag, Dae Sa Kwan serves all kinds of appetizers, seafood korean pancake, pork slices which looks and smells delicious by the way, and hot stone mix vegetable rice. Lots of home-cooked starters to get you started and wash it all down with cold Korean beer as you go. Oh and there's a free flow too! Free flow of sky juice that is.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Drop in on Bon Ga for some Korean. Reflecting its name, this eatery specializes in barbecued food...
content.description:
Korean restaurants are mushrooming around the town. If you are in Bangsar area, drop in on Bon Ga to get into the trend. Reflecting its name, this eatery specialises in mouth-watering barbecued food. They have few sets of food such as the pork and beef set. Besides that, they serve delicious appetizers, chab chae, chicken bool kokee, kimchi jeongol and Haemool Pae Jeon. Got your tongue twisted? Worry not, you can just point out which food you want instead of saying it out loud. The staffs would gladly explain what it is.

Regular patrons order samgyeopsal (pork belly) and always, always take dessert… because it is free of charge! Overall, the food price is quite reasonable.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Elegantly neat with a warm zen-like ambience and stylish interior...
content.description:
Soft shell crab salad, salmon sashimi, fugu hotpot, katsu nabe taki komu gohan Set, deep fried chicken, unagi maki sushi and kaminabe set, rolled japanese eel sushi, shitake mushrooms, glass noodle and we can go on forever listing down the list of dishes served in Yuzu. The best part is that you get to eat these food at a reasonable price and it is worth trying. Elegantly neat with a warm zen-like ambience and stylish interior. Served on crushed ice, you must try the exceptional, fresh varieties of sashimi. And bento-lovers will be more than satisfied by the Yuzu Bento with 10 types on offer. 

Pork Free

content.short-description: Quite alike its sister restaurant, U Zen also offers authentic Japanese cuisine across three types of menu...
content.description:
Quite alike with its sister restaurant, U Zen also offers authentic Japanese cuisine across three types of menu - sushi, teppan, and a la carte specialities. Located in the first level of Concorde Hotel Kuala Lumpur, you can decide to dine in the communal sushi bar or a private room.

With choices like saba shioyaki (grilled imported mackerel with salt), chicken teriyaki (pan fried chicken with teriyaki), nabeyaki udon (seafood, chicken and vegetable in claypot) and a number of other mouth watering meals, U Zen also offers a variety of drinks. Its a suitable place if you're planning a quick snack or to explore a particular sampling.

Pork Free

content.short-description: The choice among hip youngsters, formerly known as Sushi Groove, offers a more contemporary Japanese...
content.description:
The choice among hip youngsters, the outlets formerly known as Sushi Groove do little more than change the terminology on its menu - 'Groovy Sushi', 'Dr Octopus Roll', or 'Japaghetti', anyone? - and offer a more contemporary-Japanese pop culture experience, it does so convincingly. A reliable and entertaining meal; just the way Japanese eating should be.

Although they don't have a very extensive menu, they do serve delicious desserts. Desserts like their wasabi ice cream, green tea ice cream and sesame ice cream deserves a try. It comes with a cherry topping to satisfy the lust of you sweet lovers out there.

Pork Free

Other Branches:
OB3-LG-1B Sunway Pyramid, 3 Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 46150 Petaling Jaya

content.short-description: Pleasant pork free buffet meals at very reasonable prices. At Soho KL, its classy and though not busy, pre-book...
content.description: Pleasant pork free buffet meals at very reasonable prices (according to time spent but under RM50). As it's at Soho KL, it's stylish, classy and not really all that busy, although you should definitely book ahead as limited space is available.

content.short-description: Here you can have an authentic lunch for no more than RM30...
content.description:
Here you can have an authentic lunch for no more than RM30, dishes consisting of tasty donburis with noodles and set menus with sushi, tempura, or teriyaki. Also, try the incredibly cheap variety menu starting from only RM14 with 2 dishes served next to salad, rice, steamed egg, and miso soup.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Mouth watering wafts of Japanese flavours hit you as you walk in to this classy looking restaurant...
content.description:
Mouth watering wafts of Japanese flavours hit you as you walk in to this classy looking restaurant.   Treat yourself to sashimi, sushi, or exquisite teppanyaki dishes.  There are cool private rooms for parties and a great Hiru No Set (set lunch) option.

Pork Free

content.short-description: In the heart of KLs Golden Triangle, get a platter preferably with the likes of beef carpaccio, sushi with grilled eel...
content.description:
In the heart of KL's Golden Triangle, get a platter preferably with the likes of beef carpaccio with wasabi mayo and soy sauce, boiled octopus topped with garlic, oven baked California roll wrapped with 5 kinds of raw fish, or pressed sushi with grilled eel.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Pork is far from commonly used in Japanese food, but not in Nonbei Dining and Bar...
content.description:
Pork is far from commonly used in Japanese food. But not in Nonbei Dining and Bar. Various type of pork are presented, you just to decide whether to have it boiled, deep fried, grilled or minced.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Patrons will be welcomed into a modern setting with water features, sleek furniture and open-concept kitchen.
content.description:
Very affordable set lunches are the order of the day here. Patrons will be welcomed into a modern setting with water features, sleek furniture and open-concept kitchen. Request the salmon ikura don set, an unexpected gem.

Pork Free

content.short-description: From the hand of Chef Hideaki Nakashima, Kura comes up with a wide range of very creative Japanese food...
content.description: From the hand of Chef Hideaki Nakashima, Kura Japanese Restaurant comes up with a wide range of very creative Japanese food whether sushi, sashimi or tempura.

content.short-description: Expect the usual Japanee fare and look out for the bento boxes...
content.description:
There's a daily buffet dinner here, as well as brunch on the weekends. Expect the usual Japanee fare and look out for the bento boxes - they're huge and great value.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Out in the old Hartamas area, down from the Petronas, Isaki is friendly, casual and authentic...
content.description:
Out in the old Hartamas area, down from the Petronas, near the Bulldog and Caterpillar, Isaki is friendly, casual and authentic. Pretension is at a minimum and the sashimi and other sushi items are very good. Try the buta kakuni, a lovely dish of steamed pork belly.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Like an up-market (but not that up-market) sushi bar, ENJU thrives on the strength of its cuisine...
content.description:
Like an up-market (but not that up-market) sushi bar, ENJU thrives on the strength of its cuisine. A slick operation that presents a solid array of food. And sake that is even better.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Ideal for snacks and sake, the maki is great as are the satay-esque skewered treats...
content.description:
In reality more of a bar than a restaurant, that doesn't stop the food being very enjoyable. Ideal for snacks and sake, the maki is great as are the satay-esque skewered treats.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Highly original eatery; make your reservation to enjoy the rarest and most unusual menu item 'fugu'...
content.description:
Arguably the best sushi in the country, which explains why this is a new entry for this month's Food 40. Aoyama does all the standard Japanese fare very well from tasty, fresh fish to crispy tempura, plus the odd speciality featuring caviar and foie gras to show its higher end side. However, this is no exclusive outlet, there is genuinely something for everyone.

Pork Free

 


The Time Out Food 40 is our regular definitive guide on where to eat in the Klang Valley. Establishments will only appear in the TOKL Food 40 if they rank amongst the best and most satisfying dining experiences according to our team of independent, honest and experienced food critics.

content.short-description: This strangely named restaurant housed in a stately mansion (circa 1907) dishes up a mixture of Asian and Italian food...
content.description: This strangely named restaurant housed in a stately mansion (circa 1907) dishes up a mixture of Asian and Italian food - traditional ayam masak merah alongside fettucine salmon.

content.short-description: Vincenzo delivers the usual Italian fare in a quiet and elegant surrounds...
content.description:
Situated in one of Bangsar's quieter residential areas, Vincenzo delivers the usual Italian fare in quietly elegant surrounds. Nothing groundbreaking here, but expect favourites such as vongole and the ever-present tiramisu.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Villa Danieli is famed for its handmade pastas and warm, home-like ambience, styled after a typical Italian villa...
content.description:
RM188 per person for a five-course wine pairing dinner is a pretty decent deal. The wines served during this one-off event range from the traditional Tuscan DOCG's to the latest Tuscan Urlo. Grown and cultivated from the Ruffino vineyards of Tuscany, this Italian label has produced some fine wines for over 130 years. In fact, Chianti Ruffino is one of the very first Italian wines that make it into the world market.
Victuals come in the form of pan-sealed US scallops, oven-roasted lamb loin with steamed asparagus and button mushrooms and squid linguine served with peanut sauce and black caviar.

As for dessert, opt for the Spicy Chocolate Parfait or the Moist Rosemary and Olive Oil cake, best served with the 2006 Serelle Vin Santo del Chianti.
To round off your evening Alan Wong, advisor to wine producers in Tuscany and Rheingau Germany, will share his expertise on the various Ruffino wines.

content.short-description: Tuscany draws on Tuscan influences but doesnt stop there it pulls on most Italian favourites...
content.description: It's a bit of a trek out but if you're in the area, worth a visit. As is evident by the name, Tuscany draws on Tuscan influences but doesn't stop there - it pulls on most Italian favourites. The pasta dishes are solid, as are their meat mains.

content.short-description: Roma Pizza Club serves plank-shaped pizzas with healthy, wholesome ingredients thrown on a thin crust...
content.description: Catering mostly to urbanites working in the area, Roma Pizza Club serves plank-shaped pizzas with healthy, wholesome ingredients thrown on a thin crust baked to a crunchy perfection. It's hardly a mystery why the place is always packed during the lunch rush-hour as the pizzas are made fresh to order and are hot, crisp and pack a punch when bitten into. Among the more popular pizzas are the Carmelo and the Basiculus. The no-nonsense futuristic design of the interior takes pity on the lonely lunch-ers, with LCDs screening movies to entertain you if you are alone.

content.short-description: Piza, the new Italian restaurant at Changkat probably has some of the better food weve tasted...
content.description: Piza, the new Italian restaurant at Changkat probably has some of the better food we've tasted. Their signature tuna sashimi pizza, adorned with marinated tuna sashimi slices with arugula on tomato sauce and mozzarella, drizzled with 20 year-old balsamico (the stuff that costs hundreds of ringgit for a small bottle) and truffle oil is utterly, utterly amazing. Their pizzas are fantastic and their pastas and secondi courses (try the terrific la gamba di agnello di bambino con patate di rosmarino, roasted baby lamb leg with rosemary potatoes and cianti sauce) and desserts are solid (mango tiramisu anyone?).

content.short-description: Modestos is an unpretentious place to enjoy Italian favourites without expecting anything ground-breaking...
content.description:
Modest prices and a diverse menu, Modesto's is an unpretentious place to enjoy Italian favourites without expecting anything ground-breaking. Their seafood spaghetti (cooked in a foil bag and ripped open at your table) is consistently good, and their other pastas hold up well too.

Other Branches:

Grd. & 1st Floor, 12A Jalan Telawi 3 Bangsar Baru 59100 K.L;

content.short-description: Michaelangelo's deserves better than to be dismissed as just another watering hole for hungry shoppers...
content.description:
Although indisputably positioned in a shopping mall, Michaelangelo's deserves better than to be dismissed as just another watering hole for hungry shoppers. Their pastas are very good, as are their pizzas, and their appetisers will start any meal off on a good note.

Non Halal

content.short-description: The pizza dough is literally shaped into a cone and filled with pizza toppings...
content.description:
Cone Pizza is what it says it is - pizza in the shape of a cone, sort of like the Italian equivalent of a pai tee. The pizza dough is literally shaped into a cone and filled with pizza toppings. Most unusual but a trend that has taken other parts of the world by storm and is now here in KL.

Pork Free

Other branches:

Wangsa Maju, 35 Jalan 46B/26,
Taman Sri Rampai, 53300 Kuala Lumpur

content.short-description: The food at IL Divo is kept simple and unadorned, letting the flavours shine through...
content.description: The food at IL Divo is kept simple and unadorned, letting the flavours shine through. Their signature porcini mushroom tagliatelle is comfort food at its best, and everything is cooked to a turn, with service amiable and prompt.

content.short-description: Home made pastas and foccacias are favourites; stationed in Avenue K, Grappa looks to retake devoted diners...
content.description:
With the now requisited wood-fired oven for pizzas and stationed in Avenue K, Grappa looks to retake the devoted diners it lost when it moved from Bangsar. Their home made pastas and foccacias are favourites, and their range of mains well complemented by their extensive winelist.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Le Meridiens newest, Favola serves up comforting, home-style Italian...
content.description:
Good for all the right reasons
TOKL Rating: 3.5/5

In the ongoing battle for 'my restaurant is cooler than your restaurant' supremacy, it seems that many restaurateurs have forgotten the fundamental truth about running a successful eatery, and it's that the simplest things often work best. Forget the chrome, glass, slate and dancing unicorns; punters at the crux of it are basic creatures who are actually pretty easy to please. The irresistible aroma of freshly baked bread? Tick! Comfortable chairs and a cosy setting? Tick! Friendly staff and tasty, nourishing food in unstintingly generous portions? Tick! Tick! Tick!

If there was a cheat sheet for restaurateurs - call it Basic Restaurant Truths - then the team behind Favola must have gotten their hot little hands on it because all the right boxes were ticked when they opened this delightful Italian eatery.

It's unpretentious, it's inviting, but most of all, it serves food that evokes memories of the Italian childhood you never had, with flavours that assail your palate with tasty familiarity even as they beguile you. You get the distinct impression that Favola was designed for comfort, not speed. Oh, but the comfort! A complimentary bread platter is an auspicious sign of what's to come: foccacia studded with sun-dried tomato and other breads are paired with a variety of dips. An ephemeral but strangely full-bodied zuppa pavese - beef consommé - is served with wobbly egg, parmigiana and crunchy croutons, while the wagyu lasagne is like a well-loved couch freshly reupholstered in kid leather: it's familiarly comfortable but infinitely plush.

And although I'm generally a sprinter rather than a long distance runner, I reserved some culinary stamina for dessert, because the Illy coffee tiramisu replete with fizzy chocolate bits is as close to being a child as I'm ever going to get again.
 
Favola may have passed the food and ambience test with flying colours but it's a fact that the only thing KL-ites love more than good food in a comfortable setting is a great price list. Guess what? They ticked that box too! Hurrah, it's a jackpot!

Fay Khoo

content.short-description: Primarily a wine bistro, Divino serves a good range of canapés, tapas and pizzas...
content.description:
Like it says on the tin, this is primarily a wine bistro with an excellent selection, that also serves a good range of canapés, tapas and pizzas to sustain you through your wine-quaffing.

Pork Free

content.short-description: French and Italian fine dining come together in this chic restaurant which serves French and Italian favourites...
content.description: French and Italian fine dining come together in this chic restaurant which serves, among others, excellent escargot and a combination of French and Italian favourites. Their fish dishes are also well reckoned, keep an eye out for the grilled butterfish that occurs sporadically on the special menu.

content.short-description: Not so cheap but relatively cheerful, CPK is prime for a shopping stopover when youre feeling peckish...
content.description: Not so cheap but relatively cheerful, CPK is prime for a shopping stopover when you're feeling peckish. Their pizzas might not be the most authentic you'll ever come across, but the variations are imaginative and interesting, and it's popular with families.

content.short-description: The eatery is decked out almost entirely in white and makes for a pleasant, modern dining space...
content.description:
Even though the menu is limited (only pasta, pizza, and a handful of starters and desserts), it's well thought-out and affordable. As its name would suggest, the eatery is decked out almost entirely in white and makes for a pleasant, modern dining space. 

Non Halal

content.short-description: Yatra may lack some of the aesthetical attraction of its co-owner, but the food is consistently good...
content.description: The unlikely brainchild of a beauty queen and a publican, Yatra may lack some of the aesthetical attraction of it's co-owner, but the food is consistently good.

content.short-description: This plush establishment aims to create a "Surprisingly Indian" experience for the diner with an insight into new-age India...
content.description:
With its original concept from Singapore, Vansh has certainly crossed the borders without missing a step. This plush establishment aims to create a "Surprisingly Indian" experience for the diner through its apparently unique concept of regional Indian cuisine with an insight into new-age India. The interior is relaxing with Sanskrit embedded around the restaurant. The chicken vindaloo retains its flavorful taste while being not too spicy. Be warned, over here, quality comes with a fitting price tag.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Glad Tiding PJ is a Christian Church located in Section 13 PJ, holding regular services in English, Madarin, Cantonese, Tamil and Bahasa...
content.description: Glad Tiding PJ is a Christian Church located in Section 13 PJ, holding regular services in English, Madarin, Cantonese, Tamil and Bahasa.

content.short-description: OverTime is the first entertainment outlet in Malaysia. The venue boasts a modern...
content.description:
OverTime boasts a modern yet elegant setting, yet the interior is somewhat trendy and chic. A unique pub outlet.

OverTime is the new haven for night crawlers, with live bands, imported beer and guest deejays.

content.short-description: Secret Recipe is a lifestyle café chain that has become a household name following its debut in 1997...
content.description:
Secret Recipe is a lifestyle café chain that has become a household name following its debut in 1997.

Successfully established in countries worldwide, Secret Recipe has a fine selection of quality cakes, fusion food and efficient service.

content.short-description: Theres a respectable selection of wines and liquors. Beer wise, Hoegaarden, Stella and OConnors are all available on tap....
content.description:
A few doors down from McDonald's at e@Curve, Funky Villa is your typical restaurant cum bar and lounge. If all you need is a drink, something to eat and then go, Funky Villa's convenient location and good drink deals make it a viable place for a pre or post movie hangout. We were rather intrigued by the colour changing walls on our initial visits. The colours fade from green to blue, illuminating the interior with an interesting fluid-like lighting effect.

The bar indoor is shaped like a crescent moon and across from it is an elevated lounge area, cordoned off with a curtain of translucent beads. All decked out in comfy sofas, this is a good spot for larger groups. There are more seats outside at the terrace, which sports an upper deck as well. Music wise, you can expect the usual 80s hits, Top 40 and electro house.

There's a respectable selection of wines and liquors. Beer wise, Hoegaarden, Stella and O'Connors are all available on tap. Weeklong drink promotions are quite worthwhile: beer tower comes at only RM99 nett on Mondays, whereas on Wednesdays you get one free cocktail for every two ordered. We recommend you try the ice cream cocktail if you are a fan of desserts. If you are really keen on eating here, the Thai menu has some worthy dishes as well, particularly the soft shell crab curry and barbequed skewers.

content.short-description: The Cheng Ho Court is a Halal Chinese restaurant located on the third floor of Mines Wellness Hotel...
content.description: The Cheng Ho Court is a Halal Chinese restaurant located on the third floor of Mines Wellness Hotel. The venue has an unique, oriental feetl and boasts delicious and distinguished Cantonese cuisine as well as lovely Dim Sum, small dumplings stuffed with minced meat or seafood. Vegetarian food is also available, other than the Wellness Menu which is the pride of Cheng Ho Court. The Cheng Ho Court was also selected as a finalist for Best Chinese Cuisine in a 5-star hotel in the Hospitality Asia Platinum Awards 2005.

content.short-description: The Crystal Crown Hotels & Resorts is made up of a collection of 4 star business class hotels...
content.description:
The Crystal Crown Hotels & Resorts is made up of a collection of 4 star business class hotels, located conveniently in the Peninsula States of Malaysia.

The Crystal Crown Petaling Jaya is a 15minute drive to KL's CBD. This is a quality hotel equipped with the finest facilities for the modern tourist/business traveller.

Facilities include business centre, shopping arcade, health spa, fun pub, beer garden, convention & banquet facilities, limousine/valet services and more.

The Crystal Crown Hotel Kuala Lumpur is a 3 star family and business class hotel. The venue boasts in high quality, good food, standard service, cleanliness and friendly staff.

Other Branch:

Crystal Crown Hotel Petaling Jaya, No. 12 Lorong Utara A, Off Jalan Utara, 46200 Petaling Jaya, Selangor

content.short-description: Offering all day breakfasts to patrons, Café Libre also throws out your standard local and western cuisine with level-headed prices...
content.description:
Offering all day breakfasts to patrons, Café Libre also throws out your standard local and western cuisine with level-headed prices. Some interesting dishes with a diverse menu. Don't forget to take advantage of the daily set lunch offers for a neat price of RM14.90 for any pasta or rice dish, a choice of Tea or Americano coffee, and Ice cream for dessert. Highly recommended is the  Spicy Seafood Spaghetti House Specialty or the Home Cooked Nasi Minyak with OZ Shoulder-cut Lamb.

Park in the multi-storey carpack at the back and the restaurant will reimburse you with any bill over RM50.

content.short-description: Cameron Highlands Resort is situated on the largest hill retreat in Malaysia, surrounded...
content.description: Cameron Highlands Resort is situated on the largest hill retreat in Malaysia, surrounded by breathtaking scenery, lush greenery, rolling hills and Tudor-styled cottages. The luxurious boutique Resort features 56 beautifully-appointed rooms and suites, and fronts Cameron Highlands' 18-hole golf course. It also houses the third wellness centre of the award-winning Spa Village group, which offers exotic treatments focusing on the healing and restorative properties of tea.

content.short-description: The mussaman curry and tab tim grob, in particular, come highly recommended....
content.description: A moodily-lit, high-raftered space is used to dramatic effect at this eatery on Dempsey Hill. As if the perfectly executed Thai fare weren't already ample reason to visit, giant birdcage lamps and wing-backed sofas crowded with pillows in Khun Jim's fabled silks only add to the experience. The mussaman curry and tab tim grob, in particular, come highly recommended.

content.short-description: Here, an interior of dark brown wood, jazz soundtrack, compact menu and a brisk kitchen make mealtimes a soothing exercise in Japanese efficiency. There are interesting sides like unagi chawanmushi and fried oysters, but the starring roles are dominated by ramen thats cooked Tokyo-, Sapporo-, Kyushi-, and Kyushu Tonkatsu style.....
content.description: Here, an interior of dark brown wood, jazz soundtrack, compact menu and a brisk kitchen make mealtimes a soothing exercise in Japanese efficiency. There are interesting sides like unagi chawanmushi and fried oysters, but the starring roles are dominated by ramen that's cooked Tokyo-, Sapporo-, Kyushi-, and Kyushu Tonkatsu style. This translates into stock that's miso-based, pork-flavoured, or steeped in chicken for 11 hours; meanwhile springy noodles are paired with a variety of toppings ranging from tonkatsu pork and hard-boiled eggs to charred and crushed garlic. Tip: order the mini versions so you can try more dishes.

content.short-description: Hidden behind the Marxx luxury furniture showfront, and furnished by the same designer, is tea lounge Arteastiq.
content.description: Hidden behind the Marxx luxury furniture showfront, and furnished by the same designer, is tea lounge Arteastiq. Sit on baroque-style chairs and sofas while sipping spiked tees like Cointreau menta lemongrass ($14) and nibbling on probiotic prate wraps ($5.90 - 7.90).

content.short-description: Located in the University Cultural Centre in scenic Kent Ridge campus, it manages a growing number of collections housed under-one-roof.....
content.description: Established in 1997, the Museum was formerly called the National University of Singapore Museums. Located in the University Cultural Centre in scenic Kent Ridge campus, it manages a growing number of collections housed under-one-roof. To the existing Lee Kong Chian Art Museum, Ng Eng Teng Gallery, and the South & Southeast Asian Gallery, will be added a new annex for contemporary art

content.short-description: Making its Asian debut in Singapore, this travelling exhibition depicts the opulence of the legendary Mughal empire....
content.description: The Asian Civilisations Museum (ACM) is the first museum in the region to present a broad yet integrated perspective of pan-Asian cultures and civilisations. As one of the National Museums of Singapore under the National Heritage Board, we seek to promote a better appreciation of the rich cultures that make up Singapore's multi-ethnic society.

content.short-description: The Malay Heritage Centre project is part of the government initiative where each of the main ethnic communities in Singapore is encouraged to have their own heritage centre.
content.description:
A cultural space in Singapore, the Malay Heritage Centre was established in 1999 as part of a goverment scheme to showcase the main ethnic groups in Singapore. Displaying the history, heritage and culture of Malay Singaporeans, the centre comprises of the Malay Heritage museum which deals with Malay history artefacts and displays.

In order to promote the Malay culture in Singapore, the Malay Heritage Centre also organises a range of activities to offer fellow locals and visitors insight into the roots and lifestyle of Singaporean Malays. Additionally,  the centre also hosts cultural programmes and workshops to encourage Malay singaporeans to work together in fund-raising activities.

content.short-description: Angsana Green East Coast Park is a vast field that caters to your every need. Be it, weddings, sporting events and etc.
content.description: Angsana Green East Coast Park is a vast field that caters to your every need. Be it, weddings, sporting events and etc.

content.short-description: Amid the bustle of Orchard Road, this new gallery serves up a platter of big names, colourful canvases, and, as its name suggests, plenty of Pop.
content.description: Located in the heart of Orchard Road at Palais Renaissance, this new gallery is rapidly attracting a lot of attention.  In reflection of its name, the gallery hosts solely original paintings, lithographs, screenprints, etchings and scupltures that fall into the Contemporary and Art genres. The company's services include hanging solutions, art sourcing, fine artwork placement, and selection consultancy.

content.short-description: Great Location. Welcome to Kuchings newest International hotel, the Four Points by Sheraton Kuching...
content.description: Great Location. Welcome to Kuching's newest International hotel, the Four Points by Sheraton Kuching. With just two kilometres from the airport and fifteen minutes from the heart of the city, expect to have easy access to all that this fascinating and dynamic destination has to offer.

content.short-description: El Habanero is an ideal hangout and clubbing space for trendy urbanites who are seeking an escape from the hustle and bustle of city life...
content.description: El Habanero, CapSquare in the heart of KL is an ideal hangout and clubbing space for trendy urbanites who are seeking an escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. El Habanero with its warm and inviting interior and al fresco outdoor seating area will not only attract young working adults but also patrons who just like to chill-out, relax in an enjoyable atmosphere all in one place. Try out their new snacks menu today!

content.short-description: The curiously named "Whipped Into Place" exudes Bangsar coolness and to top it off the food is excellent too..
content.description:
The curiously named Whipped Into Place exudes Bangsar coolness. A haven for lovers of good food and drinks, this hideaway welcomes all with its stylishly laid-back coastal resort ambience. Inspired by the relaxed elegance of Nice, France and Santorini, Greece, this eatery brings you a slice of the Northern Mediterranean  lifestyle.

Diners are provided with  a delicious mix of local, Western, Northern Indian cuisine and some pretty mean cocktails. With that many versions of a mojito on the menu, there is a danger of you not making it as far as the food menu (which is not crazily expensive). That would be a mistake. The fish and chips come highly recommended.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Perfect, up high, daytime pool side dining with an awesome view of the KL skyline...
content.description:
Sun yourself on the terrace deck or take a dip in the pool while taking in the spectacular view of the Kuala Lumpur skyline at a distance.  Meanwhile, there are a selection of scrumptious snacks (treat yourself to the highly recommended Nacho creations), light bites, drinks and sundaes on the menu.  Shuts at 10pm so come for lunch or early dinner, or even better, kick back by the pool and get stuck into an all day barbecue. A perfect place if you're looking to laze the day away.

Pork Free

content.short-description: The Terrace Cafe takes you on a culinary journey through local and international fare in the heart of Putrajaya...
content.description:
Tucked in the slick Marriot Hotel overlooking  the beautiful pool garden, The Terrace Cafe takes you on a culinary journey through local and international fare in the heart of Putrajaya. Serving authentic Malaysian and an exquisite spread of gastronomic delights, Terrace Cafe ensures quality and flavor certain to whet your appetite. There's a daily buffet, an Asian and Western a la carte menu for all-day dining, and hi-tea served every Saturday and Sunday.

Halal

content.short-description: Get well and truly stuck into hearty Pork Ribs and barbecue sauce or even a 'half slab' of lamb...
content.description:
A hidden gem among Kl's hipsterati set, Sticky Fingers is a cosy, casual eatery  for meat lover's galore. Get well and truly stuck into hearty Pork Ribs and barbecue sauce or even a 'half slab' of lamb.  Order the 'Baby Back Rack' famous ribs, full slab at RM28 and half slab for RM21, with their original STICK BBQ sauce. This is hands on (no wonder the sticky fingers), elbow deep, eating of the meaty variety.  But, prepare your gnashers as some have reported that the meat isn't as tender as it should be. Dessert specials are usually on the chalkboard menu, you'll be stuck for choice with chocolate fondant, blueberry apple crumble and more.

Non Halal

content.short-description: Good Western cuisine with a twist of spice; this is a great restaurant if you're in need of a little privacy...
content.description:
Tucked quietly away in a little nook near the pool, this is a great restaurant if you're in need of a little extra privacy (no one will find you here…). A tempting place to bring a special friend, relax over a glass of wine (selection from famous vineyards), and savour the gastronomical delights. The resident pianist is also often tinkling on the keys to add some extra romance. A must try is among their speciality flambé recipes. Besides this, Spices offers good Western cuisine, fusion-infused dishes and canapés. Though slightly expensive, it's well worth the extra ringgit as you can enjoy the comfort of the four-star Concorde Hotel.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Pick San Fransisco Steakhouse if you feel like some proper San Fransisco food steaks and seafood or surf and turf with the two on the same plate...
content.description:
Boggled by choice in KLCC? Pick San Fransisco Steakhouse if you feel like some proper San Fransisco food - steaks and seafood or surf and turf with the two on the same plate.  The food is delicious but it comes with a fairly hefty price tag too. Serving large portions American-style, the Steakhouse is ideal for big eaters and carnivores. Side dishes include fine-tasting salads, shark's fin soup, desserts and more. For a bit of everything, order a Set Meal available everyday at only RM16.90 with the chef's selection of pasta of the day, lamb shoulder, barbeque steak, and more.

Halal

content.short-description: The cool décor will knock you sideways and the food will seal the deal; delicious Latino grills and salsas...
content.description:
Reminiscent of the old Latino world, the cool décor will knock you sideways with elaborately painted frescos and chandeliers. Tripling as a restaurant, wine and cigar bar, QBA serves predominantly Latin American food with delicious Latino grills and salsas. And, to top it off, you can embrace the Havana experience by salsa-ing the night away  to hot beats and rhythms downstairs. Granted it's on the expensive side, but the service is excellent, staff are accommodating, and not to mention QBA is located in one of the most prestigious five-star hotels in the heart of K.L.

Halal

content.short-description: Papa Johns boast is that their pizza dough and ingredients are always fresh, never frozen...
content.description:
The third largest pizza company in the world, Papa John's is a well-known franchise from the USA. Papa John's boast is that their pizza dough and ingredients are always fresh, never frozen.  This results in a chewier pizza crust and more interesting toppings - they're definitely fond of the Jalapenos here. Papa John's promise is in delivering consistent superior-quality pizza. No authentic wood-fired ovens, but it's definitely one of the better fast food chains.

Halal

Other Branches:

Lot EG 8A & 8B, IOI Mall, Batu 9, Jalan Puchong, Bandar Puchong Jaya, 47100 Puchong, Selangor

content.short-description: The food is top notch and the menu very creative; welsh rarebit fois gras, salmon gravlax...
content.description:
This two floor restaurant with beautiful art deco that represents the New York grill is indeed a place where people dine and indulge themselves with superb food, lively conversations, and its vibrant atmosphere adds a zesty feel to it.With vintage Yankee posters and lots of red, this place is booming with energy.

The food is top notch and the menu very creative; welsh rarebit fois gras, salmon gravlax or parcels of seafood melange are all there for sampling. With a delicious mouth-watering menu for both lunch and dinner, one can not miss the dessert menu. Amongst the many delicious desserts are the banana toffee pie and the chocolate truffle. It's popular and rightly so.

Halal

content.short-description: They call it Beeftopia. Rib-eye, sirloin, fillet, rump, T-bone, ribs you get the picture?...
content.description:
Inspired by the love of meat and good food, hails MeatWorks.

They call it Beeftopia.  Rib-eye, sirloin, fillet, rump, T-bone, ribs… you get the picture? From salad to soup, and from burgers to steaks, MeatWorks serves just about everything that your 'meaty' heart desires. And with a huge choice of tantalising sauces; black pepper and Hickory barbecue sauce to name just two. Not forgetting, for you parents out there, if you're planning to dine with your kids, look out for the fun little treat they have in store for kids.

For the brave (and seriously hungry) there is the Brontosaurus Steak.  Fear not, non-beef eaters there are plenty of chicken and lamb options too.

Halal
