content.short-description: Marche is French for Market and that is exactly what is on offer here; you can pick and choose your ingredients and have them cooked in front of you...
content.description:
'Marche' is French for Market and that is exactly what is on offer here.  Styled on a market place you can pick and choose your (super fresh) ingredients and have them cooked infront of you. 

Furthermore, with a number food stations within the restaurant itself, be sure to stop on each and every station ; pizza, salad, pasta, bar, grill, dessert, juice, vegetable etc. There is also a children's corner if parents need some privacy. A variety of good food, and a good distraction for both children and parents. What more can we say?

Halal

content.short-description: Look Out Point is the perfect place to catch the sun setting over KL and there are five restaurants to choose from when you get up here...
content.description:
Look Out Point is the perfect place to catch the sun setting over KL - and there are five restaurants to choose from when you get up here.  Our picks are Haven and Look Out Point Western Food, who deliver fairly consistently good nosh.  If you're in the mood for romance watching the sun go down, then this could be the place.

Halal

content.short-description: Jakes Charbroiled Steaks serves up unquestionably delicious steaks and ribs...
content.description:
A place for elegant meat lovers, Jake's Charbroiled Steaks serves up unquestionably delicious steaks and ribs. Appetizers like prawn cocktail, cheese tacos (oh yes, tacos) and their various home-cooked soup such as Hungarian goulash and seafood chowder will leave you lusting over its main course.The main course includes Australian Wagyu sirloin, New Zealand lamb chop, and saucy, tender Bombay steak. And end your almost perfect meal with a range of desserts from home made pastries to fresh fruits and haagen dazs delights.

The menu may not be extensive - but the quality can't be faulted. Service is quick but, as ever, steaks never come cheap.

Halal

Other Branches:

Starhill Shopping Centre,
LG11 Lower Ground Floor,
181 Jalan Bukit Bintang,
55100 Kuala Lumpur.

content.short-description: A melting pot of tastes from exotic Asian to contemporary, classic Western and with exciting fusion creations in the middle somewhere...
content.description:
A melting pot of tastes from exotic Asian to contemporary, classic Western and with exciting fusion creations in the middle somewhere. With a mixture of almost everything, step into this all day dining hotspot that gives you a stylish atmosphere with a wood-fired pizza oven, tandoori oven and an open grill in the middle of the restaurant - it means that your mouth will be watering in anticipation.

Designed to give a pleasurable and elegant dining experience, Eccucino provides a serene and relaxing atmosphere for you to sit back and enjoy delicious food.

Pork Free

content.short-description: A fact not commonlyknown - Pho Hoa is North Americas largest Vietnamese restaurant chain...
content.description:
A fact not commonlyknown - Pho Hoa is North America's largest Vietnamese restaurant chain. You can create your own pho here, choose between different soups,meats and noodles to customise your own bowl of soupy goodness.

With an extensive menu, Pho Hoa serves noodles, rice, appetizers, and vermicelli. This Vietnamese restaurant has a range of noodles such as Pho Tai, Pho Bo Vien, Pho Chin Nam and more. Confused with the menu? Fear not! You don't have to bring a translator, the menu provides a brief explanation of what each food contains in English.

content.short-description: Cungdinh offers authentic Vietnamese cuisine in a warm two-floor house...
content.description:
Looking for real, delicious Vietnamese cuisines? Cungdinh is the place to be as it offers authentic Vietnamese cuisine in a warm two-floor house. Being named 'Royal Palace' in Vietnamese, Cungdinh is decorated wonderfully portraying serenity and calmness, with inspiration from the traditional Vietnamese Palace.

The beef noodles are one of their specialities. Menus include Spicy Hue Style Rice, Bun Bo Hue, and Noodle Soup. Although the desserts are nothing to shout about, the appetizers definitely are. 

Being tagged as a 'fine dining' restaurant, Cungdinh serves tasty food at a very reasonable price. To add up to the reasonable price, Cungdinh offers good service as the staffs are friendly and attentive.

Halal

content.short-description: Try the dragonfruit and lime salad here to start its a novel way to open your meal...
content.description:
Try the dragonfruit and lime salad here to start - it's a novel way to open your meal, which should also definitely include the fresh rice paper rolls, the beef pho and grilled lemongrass chicken.

Pork Free

content.short-description: Typical Chinese dishes, highly flavoured. If youre a newly converted veggie, or just fancy taking a walk on the healthy side, this is your place...
content.description:
Does vegetables make you cringe? Then Yishensu is the solution to your problem. This all-vegetarian restaurant serves everything from fried rice to fried noodle, and from fried fish ball to honey chicken cube. Oh yes, everything is vegetarian and the best part is that you won't miss your meat with this place, their 'mutton' curry will have you fooled in seconds. 'Spare ribs', 'prawns', 'duck' and 'fish' all take a turn as well, in typical Chinese dishes, highly flavoured. If you're a newly converted veggie, or just fancy taking a walk on the healthy side, this is your place.

Yishensu also caters to events such as anniversary celebration, wedding receptions, birthdays, family days etc. For reservations, please visit www.yishensu.com/website_v2/Reservation.asp

Halal

Other Branch:

First Floor, BBT One Boulevard, Lebuh Batu Nilam 2, Bandar Bukit Tinggi, 41200 Klang

content.short-description: Hot & Spicy Bangsar Cuisine, a one of a kind restaurant run by an Indian family but serving Chinese cuisine...
content.description:
It's not the bank and no, the bank did not venture into the food industry- HSBC actually stands for Hot & Spicy Bangsar Cuisine. Bangsar cuisine you say? Well, HSBC actually serves Chinese food. This one of a kind restaurant is run by an Indian family but serving Chinese cuisine. Although it is run by an Indian family, the Chinese cuisine served is splendid.

Menus include vegetarian pattaya fried rice, char koay teow, various chinese noodles and guess what? There's even vegetarian belacan!

Halal

content.short-description: Soi 23 has much to offer; the ambience is classy without being pretentious and mostly modern, with a few traditional Thai touches...
content.description:
Its tagline reads 'A heady dining experience fit for royalty' - surely an exaggeration but Soi 23 certainly has much to offer. The ambience is classy without being pretentious and mostly modern, with a few traditional Thai touches. Patrons can overlook the KL skyline while feasting on the outstanding soft shell crabs which are wonderfully crispy and light.

For you early birds or insomniacs, Soi 23 opens from 6.30am for their breakfast buffet and closest at 11pm. Expect delicious, out-of-this-world Thai-Asian cuisine and be sure to try their desserts.

Halal

content.short-description: MyThai is a silk-draped corner of Starhill that serves up both a literal and visual feast...
content.description:
Opened by the man (or shop, at least) singlehandedly responsible for today's abundance of elephants on silk, MyThai is a silk-draped corner of Starhill that serves up both a literal and visual feast.

Menus include thod mun phla (deep fried fish with red curry and basil) and poh pia pak (vegetable spring rolls) for starters, tom kha hed (spicy and sour coconut milk and mushrooms) and the list goes on for the soup menu. There are also bento sets which are the combination of several dishes in case you can't make up your mind on which dish to choose from their extended menu. Bento sets starts from RM38.

And for those of you who loves desserts, be sure to try their desserts for it is cheap!

 

Halal

content.short-description: Coca single-handedly made steamboat hip again; their steamboat has retained its goodness, with a mild, flavourful soup and ample choice of ingredients...
content.description:
Coca single-handedly made steamboat hip again, with their cleverly positioned shopping mall outlets wafting fragrant steam to tired shoppers. What's special about Coca is the fact that they have their very own fishball which has its own rich taste that would satisfy your taste bud. Apart from that, their steamboat is cooked on an electrical cooking utensil which saves you from all the uncomfortable sweaty situation.

Although the chain has downsized a little over the years, their steamboat has retained its goodness, with a mild, flavourful soup and ample choice of ingredients. Their calamari is also excellent. And most of all, they serve fresh ingredients instead of days old ingredients.

Halal

content.short-description: Billed as a Casual Thai Dining outlet, BAHT is slightly hidden away from the myriad of fine dining outlets in its vicinity...
content.description:
Thairiffic

TOKL Rating: 2.5/5

    Thai food in Kuala Lumpur seems to veer between extremes: it's either served by really grubby street vendors with questionable hygiene standards or in sanitised eateries in shopping malls, with rare standalone exceptions scattered few and far between. Enter BAHT, which falls into none of the aforementioned categories and for (more than) that reason alone, is worth visiting. Tucked away in the sleepy enclave of Lorong Kurau where time, apparently, has stood still, BAHT's decor is imbued with a quaintly charming DIY feel, but it's the vivacious staff, tasty food and cheap prices that grab your attention.
   From the bog standard green curry chicken and four-angle bean salad to kale with garlic and tom yam soup, the menu makes up in taste what it lacks in creativity. The characteristic OTT fiery, savoury notes of Thai cuisine are present here in spades, but it's the fried marinated beef studded with cracked pepper that deserves star billing. Neither overly tenderised nor excessively chewy, the texture of the meat is spot on and made all the more irresistible by a peppery marinade. The main complaint? One (serving) just isn't quite enough. For the tight-of-fist, there are great value set lunches at just RM11 - the crispy chilli fish rice with soup, fruit and lemongrass drink is a good example.
   Apart from a rather garrulous - albeit friendly - lady owner who will attempt invariably to foist sandwiches onto you (a residual habit no doubt from her days as the concession holder of Oliver's Super Sandwiches), BAHT is wonderfully peaceful and a superb venue in which to dine if you're feeling hermitish and/or leery of the air kisses of the Bangsar set, but don't want to venture too far away from the mothership. Fay Khoo 

15A Lorong Kurau, Bangsar (03 2282 0991). Lunch and dinner daily (call if you're a bit late for dinner as they sometimes close early), closed Sun.

content.short-description: Purveyor of Taiwanese fi ne dining with slick modern decor and imaginative dishes...
content.description:
Looking for Taiwanese food? Well, Zhen Shan Mei is the purveyor of Taiwanese fine dining with slick modern decor and imaginative dishes. With fully composed interior to soothe your mind, this place offers dishes like prawn with mayonnaise salad, braised pork rice, deep fried pork rolls and oh, the list goes on. However, if you're thinking of stopping by, do try the steamed silver cod with cordia seeds.

The food price is quite reasonable if you're willing to invest your money in food that comes in small portions. This is also a good place to dine with your family or for business purposes due to its serene atmosphere.

content.short-description: Not the most authentic Swiss in town, but they still boast a mean Raclette, and the steaks are very well done (but only if you want them to be)...
content.description:
It's not the most authentic Swiss in town, but they still boast a mean Raclette, and the steaks are very well done (but only if you want them to be), with a range of interesting sauces - try the mussel herb one.

What else is on the menu you ask? Hot swiss cheese and no, its unlike any other swiss cheese. La Suisse serves deliciously melted cheese with boiled potato, pickled onions and cornichons. Another must-mention meal is definitely their Black Angus beef which would leave you begging for more. What's special about La Suisse is their sauce, the taste is just superb!

content.short-description: Diners come in for the Swiss specialty Raclette Valaisanne (melted cheese, essentially) and the steam-roast Australian cod...
content.description:
Although not as frequented as before, Chalet still has its regulars who come in for the Swiss specialty Raclette Valaisanne (melted cheese, essentially) and the steam-roast Australian cod. Menus include pan fried medallion of foie gras with onion marmalade, carpaccio of black cod and soursop sherbet. 

It is open daily from 2.30pm - 11.30pm.

Pork Free


The Time Out Food 40 is our regular definitive guide on where to eat in the Klang Valley. Establishments will only appear in the TOKL Food 40 if they rank amongst the best and most satisfying dining experiences according to our team of independent, honest and experienced food critics.

content.short-description: The butter cheese crab in clay pot is a must try because diners come to Wong Poh specifically for it...
content.description:
The butter cheese crab in clay pot is a must try because diners come to Wong Poh specifically for it. Crack the crab and purr as the delicious melting cheese runs down over your hand. But if crabs aren't your thing, then try their marmite pork ribs or for an exotic experience (to some people, that is), try their pig intestine stir fried with 'chilli padi'. Another dish you should try, besides the deliciously irresistable butter crab is their 'teow chew' style steamed fish.

Now that we've covered the main courses, order wantau and eat together with your meal for an additional tasty bonus. However, you might want to order Chinese tea for you're in for a super treat here.

content.short-description: A franchising bakery called My Roti Shop
content.description: My Roti Shop is a classical malay bakery. Its unique ordering system and promotions draws many "roti "lovers towards its doors.

content.short-description: Introducing Uncle Chilli's New Ala Carte Menu with a special offer "A table for three, a bill for two". From January 15 until March 15...
content.description: Uncle Chilli's offers Western specialties, all time favourite comfort food and light bites. It mixes modern retro interior, dining and bar functions for a cosy dining experience.

content.short-description: hangout@jonker is a treasure find for savvy travellers looking for a fun yet fuss-free stay while they scour the quaint streets of Melaka...
content.description:
Just as stylish as the hotel in Singapore, 'hangout@jonker' is Hangout Hotel's second establishment which is strategically situated right in the middle of Jonker Street - the must-visit destination for all tourists visiting Malacca. The hotel is a treasure find for savvy travellers looking for a fun yet fuss-free stay whilst they enjoy discovering the streets of Malacca's famous old town.

Designed with their signature "no frills, just fun" concept, the 22-room boutique hotel has been built without unnecessary amenities, with the exception of cushy, comfortable beds and immaculately clean bathrooms. The staff at Hangout Hotel are friendly and make you feel at home the second you step through their doors. It is the ultimate destination for sociable travellers who enjoy meeting fellow travellers and sharing adventure tales to enhance their understanding and experiences of Asia. Hangout Hotels promises a fun yet affordable stay in a clean environment, assured through their ISO certification.

You can bask in the tropical sun all year round or watch the sunset every evening at Look Out on the rooftop. Hangout Hotel provides token-operated Laundromats and Dryers at Wash Out allowing you to travel light, making your trip that much more convenient. Hangout also offers both free WIFI and free local calls at their Call Out corners to tell everyone what a fabulous place Hangout is!

Log on to www.hangouthotels.com or email enquiries_malacca@hangouthotels.com to book rooms and find out more.
